original: ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ paṭicca tayo mahābhūtā …pe… mahābhūte paṭicca kaṭattārūpaṁ upādārūpaṁ.
analyzed: ekam mahābhūtam paṭicca tayaḥ mahābhūtā pe mahābhūte paṭicca kaṭattā rūpam upādā rūpa
translated: with one of the resultants as condition, the three aggregates … with the three aggregates as condition, one aggregate … with two aggregates as condition, two aggregates. with an external … with what is derived from nutriment as condition … with what is derived from temperature as condition … with one great primary as condition, the three great primaries … with the three great primaries as condition, the one great primary … with the two great primaries as condition, the two great primaries … with the three great primaries as condition, the four great primaries … with the four great primaries as condition, the three great primaries … with the three great primaries as condition, the three great primaries and the one great primary … with the four great primaries as condition, the four great primaries and the one great primary … with the three great primaries as condition, the three great primaries and the two great primaries … with the four great primaries as condition, the four great primaries and the two great primaries … with the three great primaries as condition, the three great primaries and the four great primaries … with the four great primaries as condition, derived matter.

original: Nonatthi-novigata
analyzed: nonatthinaḥ vigata
translated: Non-applicability and non-disappearance

original: Kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato dhammo uppajjati nonatthipaccayā … novigatapaccayā—kusale khandhe paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ. (Naārammaṇapaccayasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: kusalam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati nonatthi paccayā no vigata paccayā akusale khandhe paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa na ārammaṇa paccaya sadisa
translated: With a wholesome state as condition, an unwholesome state arises by way of the non-applicability condition … by way of the non-disappearance condition: With the wholesome aggregates as condition, the materiality originated by consciousness. (Like the object condition.)

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The section on enumeration

original: Suddha🔽Nahetuyā dve, naārammaṇe pañca, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare pañca, nasamanantare
analyzed: suddha  na hetuyā dve na ārammaṇe pañca na adhipatiyā nava na anantare pañca na samanantare
translated: Pure

original: pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye pañca, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte nava,
analyzed: pañca na aññamaññe pañca na upanissaye pañca na purejāte satta na pacchājāte nava
translated: With the non-cause condition as condition, two … With the non-object condition as condition, five … With the non-dominance condition as condition, nine … With the non-antecedent condition as condition, five … With the non-conascence condition as condition, five … With the non-neighbouring condition as condition, five … With the non-decisive-support condition as condition, five … With the non-foundation condition as condition, seven … With the non-precondition as condition, nine …

original: naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne
analyzed: na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne
translated: In the non-causality septad there are nine in the non-kamma-result triad,🔽in the non-nutriment one, in the non-faculty one, in the non-absorption one,

original: ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā pañca, novigate pañca.🔽1.2. Paccayapaccanīya
analyzed: na magge eka na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā pañca no vigate pañca  paccaya paccanīya
translated: in the non-path one, in the non-association five, in the non-dissociation three, in the not-so-positioned five, in the non-positioned five.

original: Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The Dependent Origination In Reverse Order

original: Nahetuduka
analyzed: na hetu duka
translated: The Exposition In Brief🔽The Non-Cause Dyad

original: Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇe ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā dve, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ,
analyzed: na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇe eka na adhipatiyā dve na anantare eka na samanantare eka
translated: With non-cause as condition, there is one as object, two as predominance, one as proximity, one as Arousal,

original: naaññamaññe ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ, napurejāte dve, napacchājāte dve, naāsevane
analyzed: na aññamaññe eka na upanissaye eka na purejāte dve na pacchājāte dve na āsevane
translated: one as singleness, one as support, two as arising before, two as arising together, two as repetition,

original: dve, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke dve, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge
analyzed: dve na kamme eka na vipāke dve na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne eka na magge
translated: one as kamma, two as kamma-result, one as nutriment, one as faculty, one as absorption, one as path,

original: ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte dve, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na sampayutte eka na vippayutte dve no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: one as association, two as dissociation, one as presence, one as non-disappearance.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: The Triad

original: Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, na anantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare
analyzed: na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā na adhipatiyā eka na anantare eka na samanantare
translated: With non-cause as condition and with non-object as condition there is one as predominance, one as proximity, one as Arousal,🔽one as singleness,

original: ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ, napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane🔽ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge
analyzed: eka na aññamaññe eka na upanissaye eka na purejāte eka na pacchājāte eka na āsevane  eka na kamme eka na vipāke eka na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne eka na magge
translated: one, not the other; one, not by decisive support; one, not by prenascence; one, not by postnascence; one, not by repetition;🔽one, not by kamma; one, not by result; one, not by nutriment; one, not by faculty; one, not by jhāna; one, not by path;

original: ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ …pe….
analyzed: na sampayutte eka na vippayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate ekam pe
translated: one, not by association; one, not by non-association; one, not by presence; one, not by absence; …

original: Vīsaka
analyzed: vīsaka
translated: The twenty

original: Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatipaccayā naanantarapaccayā nasamanantarapaccayā
analyzed: na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā na adhipati paccayā na anantara paccayā na samanantara paccayā
translated: Not as root-cause, not as object, not as predominance, not as proximity, not as contiguity,

original: naaññamaññapaccayā naupanissayapaccayā napurejātapaccayā napacchājātapaccayā naāsevanapaccayā
analyzed: na aññamañña paccayā na upanissaya paccayā na purejāta paccayā na pacchājāta paccayā na āsevana paccayā
translated: not as decisive-support, not as prenascence, not as postnascence, not by repetition,

original: nakammapaccayā navipākapaccayā naāhārapaccayā naindriyapaccayā najhānapaccayā namaggapaccayā🔽nasampayuttapaccayā navippayuttapaccayā nonatthipaccayā novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na kamma paccayāḥ na vipāka paccayāḥ na āhāra paccayāḥ na indriya paccayāḥ na jhāna paccayāḥ na magga paccayāḥ  na sampayutta paccayā na vippayutta paccayā no natthi paccayā no vigate eka
translated: not by kamma, not by result, not by nutriment, not by faculty, not by jhāna, not by path,

original: Nahetumūlakaṁ.🔽Naārammaṇaduka
analyzed: na hetu mūlaka 🔽na ārammaṇa duka
translated: not by association, not by non-association, not by presence, not by absence; one, not by disappearance.

original: Naārammaṇapaccayā nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā pañca, naanantare pañca, nasamanantare
analyzed: na ārammaṇa paccayā na hetuyā eka na adhipatiyā pañca na anantare pañca na samanantare
translated: With respect to object condition as condition, there is one … (as above) … With respect to non-causality, there are one … (as above) … With respect to non-deprivation, there are one … (as above) …

original: pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye pañca, napurejāte pañca, napacchājāte pañca,🔽naāsevane pañca, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke pañca, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne
analyzed: pañca na aññamaññe pañca na upanissaye pañca na purejāte pañca na pacchājāte pañca  na āsevane pañca na kamme eka na vipāke pañca na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne
translated: With respect to object condition as condition, there is one … (as above) … With respect to non-deprivation, there are one … (as above) …🔽With respect to object condition as condition, there is one … (as above) … With respect to non-deprivation, there are one … (as above) …🔽With respect to object condition as condition, there is one … (as above) … With respect to non-deprivation, there are one … (as above) …

original: ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā pañca, novigate pañca …pe….🔽Catukka
analyzed: eka na magge eka na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte eka no natthiyā pañca no vigate pañca pe  catukka
translated: With respect to object condition as condition, there is one … (as above) … With respect to non-deprivation, there are one … (as above) …🔽With respect to object condition as condition, there is one … (as above) … With respect to non-deprivation, there are one … (as above) …

original: Naārammaṇapaccayā nahetupaccayā naadhipatipaccayā naanantare ekaṁ …pe… nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ …pe….🔽Naadhipatiduka
analyzed: na ārammaṇa paccayā na hetu paccayā na adhipati paccayā na anantare ekam pe nonatthiyāḥ eka novigate ekam pe na adhipati duka
translated: With respect to object condition as condition, there is one … (as above) … With respect to non-deprivation, there are one … (as above) …

original: Naadhipatipaccayā nahetuyā dve, naārammaṇe pañca, naanantare pañca, nasamanantare🔽pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye pañca, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte nava,

translated: With respect to object condition as condition, there is one … (as above) … With respect to non-deprivation, there are one … (as above) …

original: naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne
analyzed: na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne
translated: In the non-causality septad, there are nine in the non-kamma-result septad, nine in the non-nutriment septad, one in the non-faculty septad, one in the non-jhāna septad,

original: ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā pañca, novigate pañca.
analyzed: na magge eka na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā pañca no vigate pañca
translated: one in the non-path septad, five in the non-association septad, three in the non-dissociation septad, five in the non-requitement septad, and five in the non-deprivation septad.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: Tika

translated: one in the non-path condition, one in the non-association condition, two in the non-dissociation condition, one in the non-requitement condition, and one in the non-deprivation condition.

original: Catukka
analyzed: catukka

As condition being a prenascent condition and not a postnascent condition, there are three. As condition being a prenascent condition and not a kamma condition, there are three. As condition being a prenascent condition and not a ripening condition, there are three. As condition being a prenascent condition and not a jhana condition, there is one. As condition being a prenascent condition and not a path condition, there is one.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: The triad

translated: With jhāna as condition, as non-cause condition, there are two. As non-object condition, there are five. As non-dominance condition, there are nine. As non-pre-nascence condition, there are five.

original: nasamanantare pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye pañca, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte🔽nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte pañca,
analyzed: na samanantare pañca na aññamaññe pañca na upanissaye pañca na purejāte satta na pacchājāte  nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na magge eka na sampayutte pañca
translated: As non-decisive-support condition, there are five. As non-contiguity condition, there are five. As non-kamma condition, there are five. As non-resultant condition, there are five. As non-pre-birth condition, there are five. As non-deathless-birth condition, there are five.

original: navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā pañca, novigate pañca.🔽Tika🔽Jhānapaccayā hetupaccayā naārammaṇe pañca, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare pañca, nasamanantare
analyzed: na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā pañca no vigate pañca  tika  jhāna paccayā hetu paccayā na ārammaṇe pañca na adhipatiyā nava na anantare pañca na samanantare
translated: As non-corporeality condition, there are five. As non-path condition, there are five. As non-association condition, there are five. As non-dissociation condition, there are three. As non-presence condition, there are five. As non-non-deathless-birth condition, there are five.

original: pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye pañca, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte nava,🔽naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte tīṇi,
analyzed: pañca na aññamaññe pañca na upanissaye pañca na purejāte satta na pacchājāte nava  na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: With jhāna as condition, as cause condition, as non-object condition, there are five. As non-dominance condition, there are nine. As non-pre-nascence condition, there are five. As non-decisive-support condition, there are five. As non-contiguity condition, there are five. As non-kamma condition, there are five. As non-resultant condition, there are five. As non-association condition, there are five. As non-dissociation condition, there are three.

original: nonatthiyā pañca, novigate pañca.🔽Catukka
analyzed: nonatthiyā pañca no vigate pañca 🔽catukka
translated: As non-presence condition, there are five. As non-non-deathless-birth condition, there are five.🔽With jhāna as condition, as cause condition, as non-object condition, as non-dominance condition, as non-pre-nascence condition, as non-decisive-support condition, as non-contiguity condition, as non-kamma condition, as non-resultant condition, as non-association condition, as non-dissociation condition, as non-presence condition, as non-non-deathless-birth condition, there are five.

original: Jhānapaccayā hetupaccayā ārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi.
analyzed: jhāna paccayāḥ hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇa paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: With jhāna as condition, with cause as condition, with object as condition, there are three; with non-dominance as condition, there are three; with pre-nascence as condition, there are three; with post-nascence as condition, there are three; with repetition as condition, there are three; with kamma as condition, there are three; with result as condition, there are three; with absence as condition, there are three.

original: Yathā hetumūlakaṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.
analyzed: yathā hetu mūlake evam
translated: As with the root series on cause, so should it be expanded here.

original: Maggaduka
analyzed: maggaduka
translated: The Section on the Path

original: Maggapaccayā nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe pañca, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare pañca,
analyzed: magga paccayā na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe pañca na adhipatiyā nava na anantare pañca
translated: With the path as condition, not as cause, there is one; not as object, five; not as non-dominance, nine; not as proximity, five;

original: nasamanantare pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye pañca, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte
analyzed: na samanantare pañca na aññamaññe pañca na upanissaye pañca na purejāte satta na pacchājāte
translated: not as contiguity, five; not as mutuality, five; not as support, five; not as pre-nascence, seven; not as post-nascence,

original: nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte
analyzed: nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte
translated: nine; not as repetition, nine; not as kamma, three; not as result, nine; not as association, five; not as dissociation,

original: tīṇi, nonatthiyā pañca, novigate pañca.
analyzed: tīṇi nonatthiyā pañca no vigate pañca
translated: three; not as absence, five; not as presence, five.

original: Tika🔽Maggapaccayā hetupaccayā naārammaṇe pañca, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare pañca, nasamanantare
analyzed: tika  magga paccayāḥ hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe pañca na adhipatiyā nava na anantare pañca na samanantare
translated: The Triad🔽With the path as condition, with cause as condition, not as object, five; not as non-dominance, nine; not as proximity, five; not as contiguity,

original: pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye pañca, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte nava,
analyzed: pañca na aññamaññe pañca na upanissaye pañca na purejāte satta na pacchājāte nava
translated: five; not as mutuality, five; not as support, five; not as pre-nascence, seven; not as post-nascence, nine;

original: naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte tīṇi,
analyzed: na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: In the non-causality triad there are nine. In the non-kamma triad there are three. In the non-result triad there are nine. In the non-association triad there are five. In the non- dissociation triad there are three.

original: nonatthiyā pañca, novigate pañca.
analyzed: nonatthiyā pañca no vigate pañca
translated: In the non- presence triad there are five. In the non- absence triad there are five.

original: Catukka
analyzed: catukka
translated: The fours

original: Maggapaccayā hetupaccayā ārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi.
analyzed: magga paccayāḥ hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇa paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: In the condition triad there are three. In the cause triad there are three. In the object triad there are three. In the non- predominance triad there are three. In the pre-nascence triad there are three. In the post-nascence triad there are three. In the non-decisive-support triad there are three. In the non-nutritive-essence triad there are three. In the non-root triad there are three. In the non-path triad there are three.

original: Yathā hetumūlakaṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.🔽Sampayuttaduka
analyzed: yathā hetu mūlake evam  sampayutta duka
translated: As with the cause pentad, so with the rest of the condition pentad.🔽The two-term combinations with association

original: Sampayuttapaccayā nahetuyā dve, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte tīṇi.
analyzed: sampayutta paccayā na hetuyā dve na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na jhāne eka na magge eka na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: In the association triad there are two. In the non-cause triad there are three. In the non-predominance triad there are three. In the pre-nascence triad there are three. In the post-nascence triad there are three. In the non-decisive-support triad there are three. In the non-nutritive-essence triad there are three. In the non-path triad there are three. In the non-dissociation triad there are three.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: The triads

original: Sampayuttapaccayā hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi.
analyzed: sampayutta paccayāḥ hetu paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: In the association-cause triad there are three. In the association-predominance triad there are three. In the association-pre-nascence triad there are three. In the association-post-nascence triad there are three. In the association-non-decisive-support triad there are three. In the association-non-nutritive-essence triad there are three. In the association-non-dissociation triad there are three.

original: Yathā hetumūlakaṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.
analyzed: yathā hetu mūlake evam
translated: As with the root cause, so should it be expanded here.

original: Vippayuttaduka
analyzed: vippayutta duka
translated: The dyad disjoined

original: Vippayuttapaccayā nahetuyā dve, naārammaṇe pañca, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare pañca,
analyzed: vippayutta paccayā na hetuyā dve na ārammaṇe pañca na adhipatiyā nava na anantare pañca
translated: With the condition being dissociated, there are two under not as root cause, five under not object, nine under not dominant condition, five under not proximity,

original: nasamanantare pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye pañca, napurejāte pañca, napacchājāte
analyzed: na samanantare pañca na aññamaññe pañca na upanissaye pañca na purejāte pañca na pacchājāte
translated: five under not contiguity, five under not mutuality, five under not support, five under not prenascence, five under not postnascence,

original: nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte
analyzed: nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte
translated: nine under not nutriment, nine under not faculty, three under not jhāna, one under not path, one under not association,

original: pañca, nonatthiyā pañca, novigate pañca.
analyzed: pañca nonatthiyā pañca no vigate pañca
translated: five under not absence, five under not presence.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: The triad

original: Vippayuttapaccayā hetupaccayā naārammaṇe pañca, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare pañca,
analyzed: vippayutta paccayāḥ hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe pañca na adhipatiyā nava na anantare pañca
translated: With the condition being dissociated, there are five under root cause and object, nine under dominant condition, five under proximity,

original: nasamanantare pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye pañca, napurejāte pañca, napacchājāte
analyzed: na samanantare pañca na aññamaññe pañca na upanissaye pañca na purejāte pañca na pacchājāte
translated: five under contiguity, five under mutuality, five under support, five under prenascence, five under postnascence,

original: nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, nasampayutte pañca, nonatthiyā
analyzed: nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na sampayutte pañca no natthiyā
translated: nine under nutriment, nine under faculty, five under association, five under absence,

original: pañca, novigate pañca.
analyzed: pañca na u vigate pañca
translated: five under presence.

original: Catukka
analyzed: catukka
translated: The tetrad

original: Vippayuttapaccayā hetupaccayā ārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi.
analyzed: vippayutta paccayāḥ hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇa paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte eka na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi
translated: As condition being a condition by way of non-disappearance condition, by way of cause condition, by way of object condition, not as a dominant condition: there are three. Not as a prenascence condition: there is one. Not as a postnascence condition: there are three. Not as a repetition condition: there are three. Not as a kamma condition: there are three. Not as a result condition: there are three.

original: Pañcaka
analyzed: pañcaka
translated: Five

original: Vippayuttapaccayā hetupaccayā ārammaṇapaccayā adhipatipaccayā napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi …pe….
analyzed: vippayutta paccayā hetu paccayā ārammaṇa paccayā adhipati paccayā na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi pe
translated: As condition being a condition by way of non-disappearance condition, by way of cause condition, by way of object condition, by way of dominant condition, not as a postnascence condition: there are three. Not as a repetition condition: there are three. Not as a kamma condition: there are three. Not as a result condition: there are three.

original: Dvādasaka🔽Vippayuttapaccayā hetupaccayā ārammaṇapaccayā adhipatipaccayā anantarapaccayā samanantarapaccayā
analyzed: dvādasaka  vippayutta paccayāḥ hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇa paccayāḥ adhipati paccayāḥ anantara paccayāḥ samanantara paccayāḥ
translated: Twelve🔽As condition being a condition by way of non-disappearance condition, by way of cause condition, by way of object condition, by way of dominant condition, by way of prenascence condition, by way of proximity condition, by way of contiguity condition,

original: sahajātapaccayā aññamaññapaccayā nissayapaccayā upanissayapaccayā purejātapaccayā
analyzed: sahajāta paccayāḥ aññamañña paccayāḥ nissaya paccayāḥ upanissaya paccayāḥ purejāta paccayāḥ
translated: by way of arising together condition, by way of dependence condition, by way of support condition, by way of pre-arising condition,

original: napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi.
analyzed: na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi
translated: not as a postnascence condition: there are three. Not as a repetition condition: there are three. Not as a kamma condition: there are three. Not as a result condition: there are three.

original: Tevīsaka (sāsevana)
analyzed: tevīsaka sāsevana
translated: Twenty-three (with repetition)

original: Vippayuttapaccayā hetupaccayā …pe… purejātapaccayā āsevanapaccayā kammapaccayā āhārapaccayā …pe… avigatapaccayā napacchājāte tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi.
analyzed: vippayutta paccayāḥ hetu paccayā pe purejāta paccayāḥ āsevana paccayāḥ kamma paccayāḥ āhāra paccayāḥ pe avigata paccayāḥ na pacchājāte tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi
translated: As condition being dissociated, as condition being a root, … As condition being prior, as condition being post-nascence, as condition being repetition, as condition being kamma, as condition being nutriment, … As condition being non-disappearance, there are three in the post-nascence, three in the kamma-result,

original: Cuddasaka (savipāka)
analyzed: cuddasaka sa vipāka
translated: The Group of Fourteen (with Resultant)

original: Vippayuttapaccayā hetupaccayā …pe… purejātapaccayā kammapaccayā vipākapaccayā napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ.
analyzed: vippayutta paccayā hetu paccayā pe purejāta paccayā kamma paccayā vipāka paccayā na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka
translated: As condition being dissociated, as condition being a root, … As condition being prior, as condition being kamma, as condition being kamma-result, there is one in the post-nascence, one in the repetition.

original: Tevīsaka (savipāka)
analyzed: tevīsaka sa vipāka
translated: The Group of Twenty-three (with Resultant)

original: Vippayuttapaccayā hetupaccayā …pe… purejātapaccayā kammapaccayā vipākapaccayā āhārapaccayā …pe… avigatapaccayā napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ.
analyzed: vippayutta paccayā hetu paccayā pe purejāta paccayā kamma paccayā vipāka paccayā āhāra paccayā pe avigata paccayā na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka
translated: As condition being dissociated, as condition being a root, … As condition being prior, as condition being kamma, as condition being kamma-result, as condition being nutriment, … As condition being non-disappearance, there is one in the post-nascence, one in the repetition.

original: Atthiduka
analyzed: atthiduka
translated: The Group of Eight (with Resultant)

original: Atthipaccayā nahetuyā dve, naārammaṇe pañca, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare pañca,
analyzed: atthi paccayā na hetuyā dve na ārammaṇe pañca na adhipatiyā nava na anantare pañca
translated: As condition being existent, there are two as conditions not being roots, five as conditions not being object, nine as conditions not being predominance, five as conditions not being proximity,

original: nasamanantare pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye pañca, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte
analyzed: na samanantare pañca na aññamaññe pañca na upanissaye pañca na purejāte satta na pacchājāte
translated: five as conditions not being contiguity, five as conditions not being mutuality, five as conditions not being support, seven as conditions not being prenascence,

original: nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ,
analyzed: nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na āhāre eka na aindriye eka
translated: with nine, with nine, with three, with nine, with one, with one,

original: najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā pañca, novigate pañca.
analyzed: na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā pañca no vigate pañca
translated: with one, with one, with five, with three, with five, with five.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: Triad

original: Atthipaccayā hetupaccayā naārammaṇe pañca, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare pañca, nasamanantare
analyzed: atthi paccayā hetu paccayā na ārammaṇe pañca na adhipatiyā nava na anantare pañca na samanantare
translated: With the condition root, with the condition cause, with five as object, with nine as dominant, with five as proximate, with five as sequential,

original: pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye pañca, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte nava,
analyzed: pañca na aññamaññe pañca na upanissaye pañca na purejāte satta na pacchājāte nava
translated: with five as decisive support, with five as prior, with seven as prior and arisen together, with nine as arisen together,

original: naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte tīṇi,
analyzed: na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: with nine as non-arisen, with three as kamma, with nine as ripening, with five as associated, with three as dissociated,

original: nonatthiyā pañca, novigate pañca.
analyzed: nonatthiyā pañca no vigate pañca
translated: with five as present, with five as past or future.

original: Catukka🔽Atthipaccayā hetupaccayā ārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi.
analyzed: catukka  atthi paccayā hetu paccayā ārammaṇa paccayā na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: Quadriads

original: Yathā hetumūlakaṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.
analyzed: yathā hetu mūlake evam
translated: With the condition root, with the condition cause, with the condition object, with three as dominant, with three as prior, with three as subsequent, with three as kamma, with three as ripening, with three as associated, with three as dissociated, with three as present, with three as past or future.

original: Natthi-vigataduka
analyzed: natthi vigata duka
translated: The “non-existent” triad

original: Natthipaccayā …pe… vigatapaccayā nahetuyā dve, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi,
analyzed: natthi paccayā pe vigata paccayā na hetuyā dve na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi
translated: With the non-existent condition … With the departed condition … With the non-cause condition there are two. With the non- predominance condition there are three. With the non-preceded-by-arising condition there are three.

original: napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge
analyzed: na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na jhāne eka na magge
translated: With the non-consequent-arising condition there are three. With the non-requiring-arising condition there are three. With the non-kamma condition there are three. With the non-result condition there are three. With the non-absorption condition there is one. With the non-path condition

original: ekaṁ, navippayutte tīṇi.
analyzed: eka na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: there is one. With the non-non-associated condition there are three.

original: Yathā ārammaṇamūlakaṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.
analyzed: yathā ārammaṇa mūlake evam
translated: As with the object root, so should it be expanded.

original: Avigataduka
analyzed: avigata duka
translated: The “not departed” triad

original: Avigatapaccayā nahetuyā dve, naārammaṇe pañca, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare pañca,
analyzed: avigata paccayā na hetuyā dve na ārammaṇe pañca na adhipatiyā nava na anantare pañca
translated: With the not departed condition … With the non-cause condition there are two. With the non-object condition there are five. With the non-predominance condition there are nine. With the non- proximity condition there are five.

original: nasamanantare pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye pañca, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte
analyzed: na samanantare pañca na aññamaññe pañca na upanissaye pañca na purejāte satta na pacchājāte
translated: With the non-contiguity condition there are five. With the non-conascence condition there are five. With the non-decisive-support condition there are five. With the non-requiting condition there are seven. With the non-consequent-arising condition

original: nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ,
analyzed: nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na āhāre eka na aindriye eka
translated: there are nine. With the non-requiring-arising condition there are nine. With the non-kamma condition there are three. With the non-result condition there are nine. With the non-nutritive-essence condition there is one. With the non-faculty condition there is one.

original: najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā pañca, novigate pañca.🔽Tika
analyzed: na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā pañca no vigate pañca 🔽tika
translated: With the non-absorption condition there is one. With the non-path condition there is one. With the non-association condition there are five. With the non-non-associated condition there are three. With the non-presence condition there are five. With the non- disappearance condition there are five.

original: Avigatapaccayā hetupaccayā naārammaṇe pañca, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare pañca,
analyzed: avigata paccayā hetu paccayā na ārammaṇe pañca na adhipatiyā nava na anantare pañca
translated: As condition being excluded, as cause being excluded, in object five, in predominance nine, in proximity five,🔽in non-deprivation five, in kamma three, in kamma-result nine, in association five, in dissociation three,

original: nasamanantare pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye pañca, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte🔽nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte
analyzed: na samanantare pañca na aññamaññe pañca na upanissaye pañca na purejāte satta na pacchājāte  nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte
translated: in dependence five, in dependence-condition five, in arising before seven, in arising after nine,🔽in repetition nine, in action three, in ineffectiveness nine, in association five, in dissociation three,

original: tīṇi, nonatthiyā pañca, novigate pañca.
analyzed: tīṇi nonatthiyā pañca no vigate pañca
translated: in presence five, in absence five, in disappearance five, in non-disappearance five.

original: Yathā hetumūlakaṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.🔽Anulomapaccanīyagaṇanā.
analyzed: yathā hetu mūlake evam  anuloma paccanīya gaṇanā
translated: As the section dealing with cause should be elaborated, so should the rest be elaborated.🔽The method of calculation in the forward and reverse order.

original: 1.2.1.4. Paccayapaccanīyānuloma
analyzed: paccaya paccanīya anuloma
translated: The method of calculation in the reverse order of conditions.

original: Nahetuduka
analyzed: na hetu duka
translated: The Section on Not as Root-Cause

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe dve, anantare dve, samanantare dve, sahajāte dve, aññamaññe🔽dve, nissaye dve, upanissaye dve, purejāte dve, āsevane dve, kamme dve, vipāke ekaṁ,
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe dve anantare dve samanantare dve sahajāte dve aññamaññe  dve nissaye dve upanissaye dve purejāte dve āsevane dve kamme dve vipāke eka
translated: As root-cause being excluded, in object two, in proximity two, in non-deprivation two, in kamma two, in kamma-result one,

original: āhāre dve, indriye dve, jhāne dve, magge ekaṁ, sampayutte dve, vippayutte dve, atthiyā
analyzed: āhāre dve indriye dve jhāne dve magge eka sampayutte dve vippayutte dve atthiyā
translated: in nutriment two, in faculty two, in jhana two, in path one, in association two, in dissociation two, in presence two,

original: dve, natthiyā dve, vigate dve, avigate dve.
analyzed: dve natthiyā dve vigate dve avigate dve
translated: in absence two, in disappearance two, in non-disappearance two.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: Triad

original: Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā sahajāte ekaṁ, aññamaññe ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, kamme🔽ekaṁ, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, jhāne ekaṁ, vippayutte ekaṁ, atthiyā
analyzed: na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā sahajāte eka aññamaññe eka nissaye eka kamme  eka vipāke eka āhāre eka indriye eka jhāne eka vippayutte eka atthiyā
translated: With “not as root condition” and “not as object condition,” there is one in “arisen together,” one in “mutually,” one in “support,” one in “kamma,”

original: ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ …pe….
analyzed: eka a vigate ekam pe
translated: one in “result,” one in “nutriment,” one in “faculty,” one in “absorption,” one in “dissociated,” one in “present,” one in “non-disappeared.”

original: Sattaka🔽Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatipaccayā naanantarapaccayā nasamanantarapaccayā
analyzed: sattaka  na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā na adhipati paccayā na anantara paccayā na samanantara paccayā
translated: Septad

original: naaññamaññapaccayā sahajāte ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, kamme ekaṁ, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre ekaṁ,
analyzed: na aññamañña paccayā sahajāte eka nissaye eka kamme eka vipāke eka āhāre eka
translated: With “not as root condition” and “not as object condition” and “not as predominance condition” and “not as proximity condition” and “not as contiguity condition” and “not as mutuality condition,” there is one in “arisen together,” one in “support,” one in “kamma,” one in “result,” one in “nutriment,”

original: indriye ekaṁ, jhāne ekaṁ, vippayutte ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ, (sabbattha ekaṁ) …pe….
analyzed: indriye eka jhāne eka vippayutte eka atthiyāḥ eka avigate eka sabbattha eka pe
translated: one in “faculty,” one in “absorption,” one in “dissociated,” one in “present,” one in “non-disappeared.” (Everywhere one.)

original: Ekādasaka🔽Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatipaccayā naanantarapaccayā nasamanantarapaccayā
analyzed: ekādasaka  na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā na adhipati paccayā na anantara paccayā na samanantara paccayā
translated: Eleven-factored

original: naaññamaññapaccayā naupanissayapaccayā napurejātapaccayā napacchājātapaccayā naāsevanapaccayā.
analyzed: na aññamañña paccayā na upanissaya paccayā na purejāta paccayā na pacchājāta paccayā na āsevana paccayā
translated: With “not as root condition” and “not as object condition” and “not as predominance condition” and “not as proximity condition” and “not as contiguity condition” and “not as mutuality condition” and “not as support condition” and “not as prenascence condition” and “not as postnascence condition” and “not as repetition condition” and “not as kamma condition,”🔽there is one in “arisen together,” one in “nutriment,” one in “faculty,” one in “absorption,” one in “path,” one in “dissociated,” one in “present,” one in “non-disappeared.”

original: (Yāvāsevanā sabbaṁ sadisaṁ, nakamme gaṇite pañca pañhā honti.)
analyzed: sabbam gaṇite pañca pañhāḥ honti
translated: (The whole is the same as above, except that there are five questions in the section on kamma.)

original: Dvādasaka
analyzed: dvādasaka
translated: The twelve

original: Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā …pe… naāsevanapaccayā nakammapaccayā sahajāte ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, āhāre ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ …pe….
analyzed: na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā pe na āsevana paccayā na kamma paccayā sahajāte eka nissaye eka āhāre eka atthiyāḥ eka avigate ekaṃ pe
translated: With respect to the clause “not as root-cause condition, not as object condition,” etc.: In the section on conascence there is one, in the section on support there is one, in the section on nutriment there is one, in the section on presence there is one, in the section on non-disappearance there is one. …

original: Cuddasaka
analyzed: cud dasaka
translated: The fourteen

original: Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatipaccayā naanantarapaccayā nasamanantarapaccayā🔽naaññamaññapaccayā naupanissayapaccayā napurejātapaccayā napacchājātapaccayā naāsevanapaccayā
analyzed: na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā na adhipati paccayā na anantara paccayā na samanantara paccayā  na aññamañña paccayā na upanissaya paccayā na purejāta paccayā na pacchājāta paccayā na āsevana paccayā
translated: With respect to the clause “not as root-cause condition, not as object condition, not as predominance condition, not as proximity condition, not as contiguity condition,🔽not as mutuality condition, not as support condition, not as decisive-support condition, not as prenascence condition, not as postnascence condition, not as repetition condition,

original: nakammapaccayā navipākapaccayā naāhārapaccayā sahajāte ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, atthiyā
analyzed: na kamma paccayā na vipāka paccayā na āhāra paccayā sahajāte eka nissaye eka atthiyā
translated: not as kamma condition, not as ripening condition, not as nutriment condition”: In the section on conascence there is one, in the section on support there is one, in the section on presence there is one,

original: ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ …pe….
analyzed: eka a vigate ekam pe
translated: in the section on non-disappearance there is one, in the section on non-disappearance there is one. …

original: Ekavīsaka
analyzed: ekavīsaka
translated: The twenty-one

original: Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatipaccayā naanantarapaccayā nasamanantarapaccayā
analyzed: na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā na adhipati paccayā na anantara paccayā na samanantara paccayā
translated: With respect to the clause “not as root-cause condition, not as object condition, not as predominance condition, not as proximity condition, not as contiguity condition,🔽not as mutuality condition, not as support condition, not as decisive-support condition, not as prenascence condition, not as postnascence condition, not as kamma condition,🔽not as ripening condition, not as nutriment condition, not as faculty condition, not as jhāna condition, not as path condition”:

original: naaññamaññapaccayā naupanissayapaccayā napurejātapaccayā napacchājātapaccayā naāsevanapaccayā
analyzed: na aññamañña paccayā na upanissaya paccayā na purejāta paccayā na pacchājāta paccayā na āsevana paccayā
translated: not as a condition due to mutual dependence, not as a condition due to decisive support, not as a condition due to prenascence, not as a condition due to postnascence, not as a condition due to repetition,

original: nakammapaccayā navipākapaccayā naāhārapaccayā naindriyapaccayā najhānapaccayā namaggapaccayā
analyzed: na kamma paccayāḥ na vipāka paccayāḥ na āhāra paccayāḥ na indriya paccayāḥ na jhāna paccayāḥ na magga paccayāḥ
translated: not as a condition due to kamma, not as a condition due to result, not as a condition due to nutriment, not as a condition due to faculty, not as a condition due to path,

original: nasampayuttapaccayā navippayuttapaccayā nonatthipaccayā novigatapaccayā sahajāte
analyzed: na sampayutta paccayā na vippayutta paccayā no natthi paccayā no vigata paccayā sahajāte
translated: not as a condition due to association, not as a condition due to dissociation, not as a condition due to presence, not as a condition due to absence, arising together,

original: ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: eka nissaye eka atthiyāḥ eka avigate eka
translated: one, in dependence, one, in the state of presence, one, in the state of non-disappearance.

original: Naārammaṇaduka🔽Naārammaṇapaccayā hetuyā pañca, adhipatiyā pañca, sahajāte pañca, aññamaññe ekaṁ,
analyzed: na ārammaṇa duka  na ārammaṇa paccayā hetuyā pañca adhipatiyā pañca sahajāte pañca aññamaññe eka
translated: The Section on Not as Object🔽As condition not as object: as condition being a root, five; as condition being predominance, five; as condition being conascence, five; as condition being mutuality, one;

original: nissaye pañca, kamme pañca, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre pañca, indriye pañca, jhāne pañca,
analyzed: nissaye pañca kamme pañca vipāke eka āhāre pañca indriye pañca jhāne pañca
translated: as condition being support, five; as condition being prenascence, five; as condition being postnascence, five; as condition being repetition, five; as condition being kamma, five; as condition being result, one; as condition being nutriment, five; as condition being faculty, five; as condition being path, five;

original: magge pañca, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā pañca, avigate pañca.
analyzed: magge pañca vippayutte pañca atthiyā pañca avigate pañca
translated: as condition being dissociation, five; as condition being presence, five; as condition being absence, five; as condition being non-disappearance, five.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: The Triad

original: Naārammaṇapaccayā nahetupaccayā sahajāte ekaṁ, aññamaññe ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, kamme
analyzed: na ārammaṇa paccayā na hetu paccayā sahajāte eka aññamaññe eka nissaye eka kamme
translated: As condition not as object: as condition not being a root, in the state of arising together, one; in the state of mutuality, one; in the state of support, one; in the state of kamma, one;

original: ekaṁ, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, jhāne ekaṁ, vippayutte ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: eka vipāke eka āhāre eka indriye eka jhāne eka vippayutte eka atthiyā eka avigate eka
translated: in result, in nutriment, in faculty, in absorption, in dependence, in absence, in non-disappearance.

original: Yathā nahetumūlakaṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.
analyzed: yathā na hetu mūlake evam
translated: As with the root cause, so it should be expanded here.

original: Naadhipatiduka
analyzed: na adhipati duka
translated: The dyad on root cause

original: Naadhipatipaccayā hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe tīṇi, anantare tīṇi, samanantare tīṇi, sahajāte
analyzed: na adhipati paccayā hetuyā nava ārammaṇe tīṇi anantare tīṇi samanantare tīṇi sahajāte
translated: As root cause condition, as condition being a root cause, there are nine. As object, three. As proximity, three. As contiguity, three.

original: nava, aññamaññe tīṇi, nissaye nava, upanissaye tīṇi, purejāte tīṇi, āsevane tīṇi,
analyzed: nava aññamaññe tīṇi nissaye nava upanissaye tīṇi purejāte tīṇi āsevane tīṇi
translated: As conascence, nine. As mutuality, three. As support, nine. As decisive support, three. As prenascence, three. As postnascence, three.

original: kamme nava, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre nava, indriye nava, jhāne nava, magge nava, sampayutte
analyzed: kamme nava vipāke eka āhāre nava indriye nava jhāne nava magge nava sampayutte
translated: As kamma, nine. As result, one. As nutriment, nine. As faculty, nine. As absorption, nine. As path, nine. As association,

original: tīṇi, vippayutte nava, atthiyā nava, natthiyā tīṇi, vigate tīṇi, avigate nava.
analyzed: tīṇi vippayutte nava atthiyā nava natthiyā tīṇi vigate tīṇi avigate nava
translated: three. As dissociation, nine. As presence, nine. As absence, three. As disappearance, three. As non-disappearance, nine.

original: Tika🔽Naadhipatipaccayā nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe dve, anantare dve, samanantare dve, sahajāte
analyzed: tika  na adhipati paccayā na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe dve anantare dve samanantare dve sahajāte
translated: The triad🔽As root cause condition, as condition being a root cause, as object, two. As proximity, two. As contiguity, two. As conascence,🔽two. As mutuality, two. As support, two. As decisive support, two. As prenascence, two. As postnascence, two. As nutriment,🔽two. As faculty, two. As jhāna, two. As path, two. As association,

original: dve, aññamaññe dve, nissaye dve, upanissaye dve, purejāte dve, āsevane dve, kamme
analyzed: dve aññamaññe dve nissaye dve upanissaye dve purejāte dve āsevane dve kamme
translated: two. As dissociation, two. As presence, two. As absence, two. As disappearance, two. As non-disappearance, two.

original: dve, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre dve, indriye dve, jhāne dve, magge ekaṁ, sampayutte dve,
analyzed: dve vipāke eka āhāre dve indriye dve jhāne dve magge eka sampayutte dve
translated: two, in result one, in nutriment two, in faculty two, in absorption two, in path one, in association two,

original: vippayutte dve, atthiyā dve, natthiyā dve, vigate dve, avigate dve.
analyzed: vippayutte dve atthiyā dve natthiyā dve vigate dve avigate dve
translated: in dissociation two, in presence two, in absence two, in disappearance two, in non-disappearance two.

original: Catukka🔽Naadhipatipaccayā nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā sahajāte ekaṁ, aññamaññe ekaṁ,
analyzed: catukka  na adhipati paccayā na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā sahajāte eka aññamaññe eka
translated: The Tetrads

original: nissaye ekaṁ, kamme ekaṁ, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, jhāne ekaṁ, vippayutte🔽ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Naanantaradukādi🔽Naanantarapaccayā … nasamanantarapaccayā … naaññamaññapaccayā … naupanissayapaccayā🔽hetuyā pañca, adhipatiyā pañca, sahajāte pañca, aññamaññe ekaṁ, nissaye pañca, kamme🔽pañca, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre pañca, indriye pañca, jhāne pañca, magge pañca, vippayutte
analyzed: nissaye eka kamme eka vipāke eka āhāre eka indriye eka jhāne eka vippayutte  eka atthiyā eka avigate eka saṅkhitta  na anantara duka ādi  na anantara paccayā na samanantara paccayā na aññamañña paccayā na upanissaya paccayā  hetuyā pañca adhipatiyā pañca sahajāte pañca aññamaññe eka nissaye pañca kamme  pañca vipāke eka āhāre pañca indriye pañca jhāne pañca magge pañca vippayutte
translated: Not as root-cause, not as non-cause, not as object, in relation to conascence one, in relation to kamma-result one, in relation to nutriment one, in relation to faculty one, in relation to absorption one, in relation to path one, in relation to association one,

analyzed: pañca atthiyā pañca avigate pañca 🔽tika

original: Naupanissayapaccayā nahetupaccayā sahajāte ekaṁ, aññamaññe ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, kamme🔽ekaṁ, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, jhāne ekaṁ, vippayutte ekaṁ, atthiyā
analyzed: na upanissaya paccayā na hetu paccayā sahajāte eka aññamaññe eka nissaye eka kamme  eka vipāke eka āhāre eka indriye eka jhāne eka vippayutte eka atthiyā
translated: With non-support condition, with non-cause condition, in the born-with, one; in the mutual, one; in the support, one; in the kamma,🔽one; in the result, one; in the nutriment, one; in the faculty, one; in the jhāna, one; in the dissociated, one; in the present,

original: ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: eka avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: one; in the not-present, one; in the past, one; in the future, one; in the unacquired, one; in the unarisen, one; in the non-arising, one; in the void, one; in the signless, one; in the undirected, one; in the conditioned, one; in the unconditioned, one; in the seen, one; in the heard, one; in the sensed, one; in the cognized, one; in the traversed, one; in the not-traversed, one; in the to-be-traversed, one; in the internal, one; in the external, one; in the external, one; in the not-apprehensible, one; in the far, one; in the near, one; in the near, one. (In brief.)

original: Napurejātaduka
analyzed: napurejātaduka
translated: The born-with and the postnascent

original: Napurejātapaccayā hetuyā satta, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā satta, anantare tīṇi, samanantare

original: Naindriyapaccayā sahajāte ekaṁ, aññamaññe ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, kamme ekaṁ, āhāre ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na indriya paccayā sahajāte eka aññamaññe eka nissaye eka kamme eka āhāre eka atthiyāḥ eka avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: With respect to “not as faculty condition,” there is one in terms of “arising together,” one in terms of “mutual,” one in terms of “support,” one in terms of “kamma,” one in terms of “food,” one in terms of “presence,” and one in terms of “non-disappearance.” (In brief:)

original: Najhānaduka
analyzed: na jhā na duka
translated: Not as path condition,

original: Najhānapaccayā ārammaṇe ekaṁ, anantare ekaṁ, samanantare ekaṁ, sahajāte ekaṁ, aññamaññe
analyzed: na jhāna paccayā ārammaṇe eka anantare eka samanantare eka sahajāte eka aññamaññe
translated: With respect to “not as path condition,” there is one in terms of “object,” one in terms of “precedes,” one in terms of “immediately precedes,” one in terms of “arising together,” one in terms of “mutual,”

original: ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, upanissaye ekaṁ, purejāte ekaṁ, kamme ekaṁ, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre
analyzed: eka nissaye eka upanissaye eka purejāte eka kamme eka vipāke eka āhāre
translated: one in terms of “support,” one in terms of “decisive support,” one in terms of “pre-arising,” one in terms of “kamma,” one in terms of “result,” one in terms of “food,”

original: ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, sampayutte ekaṁ, vippayutte ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ, natthiyā ekaṁ,
analyzed: eka indriye eka sampayutte eka vippayutte eka atthiyā eka natthiyā eka
translated: one in terms of “faculty,” one in terms of “association,” one in terms of “dissociation,” one in terms of “presence,” one in terms of “absence,”

original: vigate ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: vigate eka avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: one in terms of “disappearance,” and one in terms of “non-disappearance.” (In brief:)

original: Namaggatika
analyzed: namak gatika
translated: Not as path condition,

original: Namaggapaccayā nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe ekaṁ, anantare ekaṁ, samanantare ekaṁ, sahajāte
analyzed: na magga paccayā na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe eka anantare eka samanantare eka sahajāte
translated: With respect to “not as path condition,” there is one in terms of “not as root condition,” one in terms of “object,” one in terms of “precedes,” one in terms of “immediately precedes,”

original: ekaṁ, aññamaññe ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, upanissaye ekaṁ, purejāte ekaṁ, āsevane ekaṁ,
analyzed: eka aññamaññe eka nissaye eka upanissaye eka purejāte eka āsevane eka
translated: one as object, one as object of the other, one as support, one as object of strong sense, one as prenascence, one as repetition,

original: kamme ekaṁ, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, jhāne ekaṁ, sampayutte ekaṁ, vippayutte
analyzed: kamme eka vipāke eka āhāre eka indriye eka jhāne eka sampayutte eka vippayutte
translated: one as condition being a condition by way of decisive support, one as condition being a condition by way of support, one as condition being a condition by way of object, one as condition being a condition by way of prenascence, one as condition being a condition by way of postnascence, one as condition being a condition by way of nutriment, one as condition being a condition by way of faculty, one as condition being a condition by way of absorption, one as condition being a condition by way of association, one as condition being a condition by way of non-association,

original: ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ, natthiyā ekaṁ, vigate ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: eka atthiyā eka natthiyā eka vigate eka avigate eka
translated: one as condition being a condition by way of presence, one as condition being a condition by way of absence, one as condition being a condition by way of disappearance, one as condition being a condition by way of non-disappearance.

original: Catukka🔽Namaggapaccayā nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā sahajāte ekaṁ, aññamaññe ekaṁ, nissaye
analyzed: catukka  na magga paccayā na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā sahajāte eka aññamaññe eka nissaye
translated: The four

original: ekaṁ, kamme ekaṁ, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, jhāne ekaṁ, vippayutte ekaṁ,
analyzed: eka kamme eka vipāke eka āhāre eka indriye eka jhāne eka vippayutte eka
translated: As condition being a condition by way of non-adverting, there is one as condition being a condition by way of object, one as condition being a condition by way of decisive support, one as condition being a condition by way of support, one as condition being a condition by way of prenascence, one as condition being a condition by way of postnascence, one as condition being a condition by way of nutriment, one as condition being a condition by way of faculty, one as condition being a condition by way of absorption, one as condition being a condition by way of non-association,

original: atthiyā ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: atthiyā eka avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: one as condition being a condition by way of presence, one as condition being a condition by way of non-disappearance. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nasampayuttaduka
analyzed: na sampayut taduka
translated: The two on non-association

original: Nasampayuttapaccayā hetuyā pañca, adhipatiyā pañca, sahajāte pañca, aññamaññe ekaṁ,🔽nissaye pañca, kamme pañca, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre pañca, indriye pañca, jhāne pañca,
analyzed: na sampayutta paccayā hetuyā pañca adhipatiyā pañca sahajāte pañca aññamaññe eka 🔽nissaye pañca kamme pañca vipāke eka āhāre pañca indriye pañca jhāne pañca
translated: As non-association condition, there are five as root-cause, five as object, five as support, one as prenascence, one as postnascence, five as nutriment, five as faculty, five as absorption,

original: magge pañca, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā pañca, avigate pañca.
analyzed: magge pañca vippayutte pañca atthiyā pañca avigate pañca
translated: in the path, five; in the unassociated, five; in the existent, five; in the non-disappeared, five.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: Triad

original: Nasampayuttapaccayā nahetupaccayā sahajāte ekaṁ, aññamaññe ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, kamme
analyzed: na sampayutta paccayā na hetu paccayā sahajāte eka aññamaññe eka nissaye eka kamme
translated: In the non-conjoined condition, in the not-root condition, in the conascent, one; in the mutually-related, one; in the support, one; in the kamma,

original: ekaṁ, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, jhāne ekaṁ, vippayutte ekaṁ, atthiyā
analyzed: eka vipāke eka āhāre eka indriye eka jhāne eka vippayutte eka atthiyā
translated: one; in the result, one; in the nutriment, one; in the faculty, one; in the absorption, one; in the unassociated, one; in the existent,

original: ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: eka avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: one; in the non-disappeared, one. (In brief.)

original: Navippayuttaduka
analyzed: na vippayutta duka
translated: Non-conjoined dyad

original: Navippayuttapaccayā hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi, anantare tīṇi, samanantare
analyzed: na vippayutta paccayā hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi anantare tīṇi samanantare
translated: In the non-conjoined condition, in the root condition, three; in the object, three; in the predominance, three; in the proximity, three;

original: tīṇi, sahajāte tīṇi, aññamaññe tīṇi, nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye tīṇi, āsevane tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi sahajāte tīṇi aññamaññe tīṇi nissaye tīṇi upanissaye tīṇi āsevane tīṇi
translated: in the immediately preceding, three; in the conascence, three; in the mutually-related, three; in the support, three; in the object-predominance, three; in the prenascence, three;

original: kamme tīṇi, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre tīṇi, indriye tīṇi, jhāne tīṇi, magge tīṇi, sampayutte
analyzed: kamme tīṇi vipāke eka āhāre tīṇi indriye tīṇi jhāne tīṇi magge tīṇi sampayutte
translated: in the postnascence, three; in the repetition, three; in the kamma, three; in the result, one; in the nutriment, three; in the faculty, three; in the absorption, three; in the path, three; in the association,

original: tīṇi, atthiyā tīṇi, natthiyā tīṇi, vigate tīṇi, avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: tīṇi atthiyā tīṇi natthiyā tīṇi vigate tīṇi avigate tīṇi
translated: three; in the presence, three; in the absence, three; in the disappearance, three; in the non-disappearance, three.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: Triad

original: Navippayuttapaccayā nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe dve, anantare dve, samanantare dve, sahajāte
analyzed: na vippayutta paccayā na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe dve anantare dve samanantare dve sahajāte
translated: In the non-conjoined condition, in the not-root condition, in the object, two; in the proximity, two; in the immediately preceding, two; in the conascence,🔽two; in the mututally-related, two; in the support, two; in the object-predominance, two; in the prenascence, two; in the postnascence, two; in the repetition, two; in the nutriment, two; in the faculty, two; in the absorption, two; in the path, two; in the association,🔽two; in the presence, two; in the absence, two; in the disappearance, two; in the non-disappearance, two.

original: dve, aññamaññe dve, nissaye dve, upanissaye dve, āsevane ekaṁ, kamme dve, āhāre dve,🔽indriye dve, jhāne dve, magge ekaṁ, sampayutte dve, atthiyā dve, natthiyā dve, vigate dve, avigate dve.
analyzed: dve aññamaññe dve nissaye dve upanissaye dve āsevane eka kamme dve āhāre dve  indriye dve jhāne dve magge eka sampayutte dve atthiyā dve natthiyā dve vigate dve avigate dve
translated: two, two, one, two, two, two, two.

original: Catukka
analyzed: catukka
translated: Quadruple

original: Navippayuttapaccayā nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā sahajāte ekaṁ, aññamaññe ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, kamme ekaṁ, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na vippayutta paccayā na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā sahajāte eka aññamaññe eka nissaye eka kamme eka āhāre eka indriye eka atthiyāḥ eka avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: In the absence of the non-related condition, the non-root condition, the non-object condition, there is one in the simultaneous, one in the mutually-related, one in the support, one in the kamma, one in the nutriment, one in the faculty, one in the presence, one in the non-disappearance. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nonatthi-novigataduka
analyzed: no natthi no vigata duka
translated: Non-absence, non-disappearance, dyad

original: Nonatthipaccayā … novigatapaccayā hetuyā pañca, adhipatiyā pañca, sahajāte pañca,
analyzed: nonatthi paccayā no vigata paccayā hetuyā pañca adhipatiyā pañca sahajāte pañca
translated: In the absence condition, … in the disappearance condition, there are five in the cause, five in the predominance, five in the arising together,

original: aññamaññe ekaṁ, nissaye pañca, kamme pañca, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre pañca, indriye pañca,
analyzed: aññamaññe eka nissaye pañca kamme pañca vipāke eka āhāre pañca indriye pañca
translated: one in the mutually-related, five in the support, five in the kamma, one in the result, five in the nutriment, five in the faculty,

original: jhāne pañca, magge pañca, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā pañca, avigate pañca.
analyzed: jhāne pañca magge pañca vippayutte pañca atthiyā pañca avigate pañca
translated: five in the jhāna, five in the path, five in the unassociated, five in the presence, five in the non-disappearance.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: Triad

original: Novigatapaccayā nahetupaccayā sahajāte ekaṁ, aññamaññe ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, kamme
analyzed: no vigata paccayā na hetu paccayā sahajāte eka aññamaññe eka nissaye eka kamme
translated: Conditioned by non-disappearance, not as condition being a root, in the homogeneous, one; in the reciprocal, one; in the support, one; in the kamma,

original: ekaṁ, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, jhāne ekaṁ, vippayutte ekaṁ, atthiyā
analyzed: eka vipāke eka āhāre eka indriye eka jhāne eka vippayutte eka atthiyā
translated: one; in the result, one; in the nutriment, one; in the faculty, one; in the absorption, one; in the dissociate, one; in the absence,

original: ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ …pe….
analyzed: eka a vigate ekam pe
translated: one; in the non-disappearance, one.

original: Aṭṭhaka
analyzed: aṭṭhaka
translated: Eight

original: Novigatapaccayā nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatipaccayā naanantarapaccayā
analyzed: no vigata paccayā na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā na adhipati paccayā na anantara paccayā
translated: Conditioned by non-disappearance, not as condition being a root, not as object, not as predominance, not as proximity,

original: nasamanantarapaccayā naaññamaññapaccayā sahajāte ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, kamme ekaṁ,
analyzed: na samanantara paccayā na aññamañña paccayā sahajāte eka nissaye eka kamme eka
translated: not as contiguity, not as dependence, not as association, not as dissociation, not as presence, in the homogeneous, one; in the support, one; in the kamma, one;

original: vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, jhāne ekaṁ, vippayutte ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ …pe….
analyzed: vipāke eka āhāre eka indriye eka jhāne eka vippayutte eka atthiyā eka avigate ekam pe
translated: in the result, one; in the nutriment, one; in the faculty, one; in the absorption, one; in the dissociate, one; in the absence, one; in the non-disappearance, one.

original: Terasaka
analyzed: terasaka
translated: Thirteen

original: Novigatapaccayā nahetupaccayā …pe… nakammapaccayā sahajāte ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, āhāre ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ …pe….
analyzed: no vigata paccayā na hetu paccayā pe na kamma paccayā sahajāte eka nissaye eka āhāre eka atthiyāḥ eka avigate ekaṃ pe
translated: Conditioned by non-disappearance, not as condition being a root … not as kamma condition, in the homogeneous, one; in the support, one; in the nutriment, one; in the absence, one; in the non-disappearance, one.

original: Pannarasaka
analyzed: pannarasaka
translated: Fifteen

original: Novigatapaccayā nahetupaccayā …pe… nakammapaccayā navipākapaccayā naāhārapaccayā sahajāte ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ …pe….
analyzed: novigata paccayā na hetu paccayā pe na kamma paccayā na vipāka paccayā na āhāra paccayā sahajāte eka nissaye eka atthiyāḥ eka avigate ekam pe
translated: With non-concomitant condition as condition, with non-root condition … with non-kamma condition … with non-result condition … with non-nutrient condition … are conjoined.

original: Ekavīsaka🔽Novigatapaccayā nahetupaccayā …pe… nakammapaccayā navipākapaccayā naāhārapaccayā🔽naindriyapaccayā najhānapaccayā namaggapaccayā nasampayuttapaccayā navippayuttapaccayā
analyzed: ekavīsaka  no vigata paccayā na hetu paccayā pe na kamma paccayā na vipāka paccayā na āhāra paccayā  na indriya paccayā na jhāna paccayā na magga paccayā na sampayutta paccayā na vippayutta paccayā
translated: The twenty-one🔽With non-concomitant condition as condition, with non-root condition … with non-kamma condition … with non-result condition … with non-nutrient condition …🔽with non-faculty condition … with non-path condition … with non-association condition … with non-dissociation condition …

original: nonatthipaccayā sahajāte ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ.🔽Paccanīyānulomaṁ.
analyzed: nonatthi paccayā sahajāte eka nissaye eka atthiyāḥ eka avigate eka  paccanīya anuloma
translated: with non-presence condition … are conjoined.

original: Paṭiccavāro.🔽1.2.2. Sahajātavāra
analyzed: paṭiccavāro  sahajātavāra
translated: The reverse order.🔽The section on condition is finished.🔽The section on conascence

original: 1.2.2.1. Paccayānuloma
analyzed: paccaya anuloma
translated: The section on condition in forward order

original: Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The section on analysis

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Root cause

original: Kusalaṁ dhammaṁ sahajāto kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—kusalaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ
analyzed: kusalam dhammam sahajātaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā akusalam ekam khandha
translated: A wholesome root-cause is conjoined with a wholesome thought-arising through the condition being by way of root cause.

original: sahajātā tayo khandhā, tayo khandhe sahajāto eko khandho, dve khandhe sahajātā dve
analyzed: sahajātā tayo khandhā tayo khandhe sahajātaḥ ekaḥ khandhaḥ dve khandhe sahajātā dve
translated: The three aggregates are conjoined with one aggregate. The two aggregates are conjoined with two aggregates.

original: khandhā. Kusalaṁ dhammaṁ sahajāto abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—kusale khandhe🔽sahajātaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ. Kusalaṁ dhammaṁ sahajāto kusalo ca abyākato ca
analyzed: khandhā kusalam dhammam sahajātaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā akusale khandhe  sahajātam citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa kusalam dhammam sahajātaḥ kusalo ca abyākato ca
translated: the aggregates. A resultant, indeterminate, mental concomitant dhammas arise together with a wholesome, indeterminate, mental concomitant dhamma, conditioned by cause condition.🔽The form that is conascent with mind that is a resultant, indeterminate, mental concomitant dhamma arises together with a wholesome, indeterminate, mental concomitant dhamma, conditioned by cause condition.

original: dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā—kusalaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ sahajātā tayo khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca
analyzed: dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccaya akusalam ekam khandham sahajātā tayo khandhā citta samuṭṭhānañca
translated: A wholesome, indeterminate, mental concomitant dhamma and a wholesome, indeterminate, form dhamma arise together, conditioned by cause condition.🔽A wholesome, indeterminate, mental concomitant dhamma and a wholesome, indeterminate, form dhamma arise together, conditioned by cause condition.

original: rūpaṁ, tayo khandhe sahajāto eko khandho cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ, dve khandhe sahajātā🔽dve khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ.
analyzed: rūpa tayo khandhe sahajāto ekaḥ khandho citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpa dve khandhe sahajātā  dve khandhā citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpa
translated: A wholesome, indeterminate, mental concomitant dhamma and a wholesome, indeterminate, form dhamma arise together, conditioned by cause condition.

original: Akusalaṁ dhammaṁ sahajāto akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—akusalaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ🔽sahajātā tayo khandhā, tayo khandhe sahajāto eko khandho, dve khandhe sahajātā dve
analyzed: akusalam dhammam sahajātaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā akusalam ekam khandha  sahajātā tayo khandhā tayo khandhe sahajātaḥ ekaḥ khandhaḥ dve khandhe sahajātā dve
translated: An unwholesome, indeterminate, mental concomitant dhamma arises together with an unwholesome, indeterminate, mental concomitant dhamma, conditioned by cause condition.

original: khandhā. Akusalaṁ dhammaṁ sahajāto abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—akusale
analyzed: khandhāḥ akusalam dhammam sahajātaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā akusale
translated: An unwholesome, indeterminate, mental concomitant dhamma arises together with an unwholesome, indeterminate, form dhamma, conditioned by cause condition.🔽An unwholesome, indeterminate, mental concomitant dhamma arises together with an unwholesome, indeterminate, mental concomitant dhamma and an unwholesome, indeterminate, form dhamma, conditioned by cause condition.

original: khandhe sahajātaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ. Akusalaṁ dhammaṁ sahajāto akusalo ca abyākato
analyzed: khandhe sahajātam citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa akusalam dhammam sahajātaḥ akusalo ca abyākato
translated: From a unprofitable idea, as condition, there arises an unprofitable idea and also a neutral idea.

original: ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā— akusalaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ sahajātā tayo khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca🔽rūpaṁ, tayo khandhe sahajāto eko khandho cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ, dve khandhe sahajātā
analyzed: ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā akusalam ekam khandham sahajātā tayo khandhā citta samuṭṭhānañca  rūpa tayo khandhe sahajāto ekaḥ khandho citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpa dve khandhe sahajātā
translated: From an unprofitable aggregate there arise, as condition, the three other aggregates and the materiality originated by mind.

original: dve khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ.
analyzed: dve khandhā citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpa
translated: From the three aggregates there arises, as condition, the one aggregate and the materiality originated by mind. From two aggregates there arises, as condition, the other aggregate and the materiality originated by mind.

original: Abyākataṁ dhammaṁ sahajāto abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— vipākābyākataṁ
analyzed: abyākatam dhammam sahajātaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā vipāka abyākata
translated: From a neutral idea, as condition, there arises a neutral idea.

original: kiriyābyākataṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ sahajātā tayo khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ, tayo
analyzed: ekam khandham sahajātā tayo khandhā citta samuṭṭhānañca
translated: From a resultant neutral idea there arises, as condition, the three aggregates and the materiality originated by mind.

original: khandhe sahajāto eko khandho cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ, dve khandhe sahajātā dve khandhā🔽cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe vipākābyākataṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ sahajātā
analyzed: khandhe sahajātaḥ ekaḥ khandho citta samuṭṭhānañca dve khandhe sahajātāḥ dve khandhāḥ 🔽citta samuṭṭhānam ca rūpa paṭisandhi kkhaṇe vipāka abyākatam ekam khandham sahajātā
translated: From the three aggregates there arises, as condition, the one aggregate and the materiality originated by mind. original: tayo khandhā kaṭattā ca rūpaṁ, tayo khandhe sahajāto eko khandho kaṭattā ca rūpaṁ,

translated: The two constituents that are conascent with the two constituents and the form that is derived from the constituents. The constituents that are conascent with the physical basis, and the constituents.

original: sahajātā khandhā; ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ sahajātā tayo mahābhūtā, tayo mahābhūte sahajātaṁ
