original: Sahajātapaccayā nahetuyā cattāri, naārammaṇe pañca, naadhipatiyā sattarasa, naanantare
analyzed: sahajāta paccayā na hetuyā cattāri na ārammaṇe pañca na adhipatiyā sattarasa na anantare
translated: As condition being conascence condition, not being cause condition, there are four; as condition being not object condition, there are five; as condition being not predominance condition, there are seventeen; as condition being not proximity condition,

original: pañca, nasamanantare pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye pañca, napurejāte satta,
analyzed: pañca na samanantare pañca na aññamaññe pañca na upanissaye pañca na purejāte satta
translated: there are five; as condition being not contiguity condition, there are five; as condition being not mutuality condition, there are five; as condition being not support condition, there are five; as condition being not prenascence condition, there are seven;

original: napacchājāte sattarasa, naāsevane sattarasa, nakamme satta, navipāke sattarasa, naāhāre
analyzed: na pacchājāte sattarasa na āsevane sattarasa na kamme satta na vipāke sattarasa na āhāre
translated: as condition being not postnascence condition, there are seventeen; as condition being not repetition condition, there are seventeen; as condition being not kamma condition, there are seven; as condition being not result condition, there are seventeen; as condition being not nutriment condition,

original: ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte
analyzed: eka na indriye eka na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte
translated: there is one; as condition being not faculty condition, there is one; as condition being not jhāna condition, there is one; as condition being not path condition, there is one; as condition being not association condition, there are five; as condition being not non-causality condition,

original: tīṇi, nonatthiyā pañca, novigate pañca.
analyzed: tīṇi nonatthiyā pañca no vigate pañca
translated: there are three; as condition being not non-resultant-law condition, there are five; as condition being not non-culmination condition, there are five.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: Triad

original: Sahajātapaccayā hetupaccayā naārammaṇe pañca (saṅkhittaṁ) navipāke sattarasa, nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā pañca, novigate pañca.
analyzed: sahajāta paccayāḥ hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe pañca saṅkhitta na vipāke sattarasa na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā pañca no vigate pañca
translated: As condition being conascence condition, being cause condition, not being object condition, there are five … (in detail as in § 10) … as condition being not result condition, there are seventeen; as condition being not association condition, there are five; as condition being not non-causality condition, there are three; as condition being not non-resultant-law condition, there are five; as condition being not non-culmination condition, there are five.

original: Sahajātapaccayā hetupaccayā ārammaṇapaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta paccayāḥ hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇa paccayāḥ
translated: As condition being conascence condition, being cause condition, being object condition … (in detail as in § 10) …

original: Aññamaññaduka
analyzed: aññam añña duka
translated: The Dyad Mutual-Condition

original: Aññamaññapaccayā nahetuyā cattāri, naārammaṇe ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā satta, naanantare
analyzed: aññamañña paccayā na hetuyā cattāri na ārammaṇe eka na adhipatiyā satta na anantare
translated: As condition being mutuality condition, not being cause condition, there are four; as condition being not object condition, there is one; as condition being not predominance condition, there are seven; as condition being not proximity condition,

original: ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte satta,
analyzed: eka na samanantare eka na upanissaye eka na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte satta
translated: with one in respect of the immediately preceding condition, with one in respect of the decisive support condition, with three in respect of the prenascence condition, with seven in respect of the postnascence condition,

original: naāsevane satta, nakamme satta, navipāke satta, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne
analyzed: na āsevane satta na kamme satta na vipāke satta na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne
translated: with seven in respect of the repetition condition, with seven in respect of the kamma condition, with seven in respect of the ripening condition, with one in respect of the nutriment condition, with one in respect of the faculty condition,

original: ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na magge eka na sampayutte eka na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: with one in respect of the path condition, with one in respect of the association condition, with three in respect of the dissociation condition, with one in respect of the presence condition, with one in respect of the absence condition, with one in respect of the disappearance condition, and with one in respect of the non-disappearance condition.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: Triad

original: Aññamaññapaccayā hetupaccayā naārammaṇe ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā satta, naanantare ekaṁ,🔽nasamanantare ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte satta, naāsevane🔽satta, nakamme satta, navipāke satta, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā
analyzed: aññamañña paccayā hetu paccayā na ārammaṇe eka na adhipatiyā satta na anantare eka  na samanantare eka na upanissaye eka na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte satta na āsevane  satta na kamme satta na vipāke satta na sampayutte eka na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā
translated: With the reciprocal condition as condition, with the causal condition as condition there is one in respect of the object condition, there are seven in respect of the predominance condition, there is one in respect of the proximity condition,🔽there is one in respect of the immediately preceding condition, there is one in respect of the decisive-support condition, there are three in respect of the prenascence condition, there are seven in respect of the postnascence condition, there are seven in respect of the repetition condition,🔽there are seven in respect of the kamma condition, there are seven in respect of the ripening condition, there is one in respect of the association condition, there are three in respect of the dissociation condition, there is one in respect of the presence condition,

original: ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: eka na u vigate eka
translated: there is one in respect of the absence condition, there is one in respect of the disappearance condition, and there is one in respect of the non-disappearance condition.

original: Catukka
analyzed: catukka
translated: Quadriads

original: Aññamaññapaccayā hetupaccayā ārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatiyā satta. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: aññamañña paccayāḥ hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇa paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā satta
translated: With the reciprocal condition as condition, with the causal condition as condition, with the object condition as condition … there are seven in respect of the predominance condition. (In brief.)

original: Nissayaduka
analyzed: nissaya duka
translated: The dependence dyad

original: Nissayapaccayā nahetuyā cattāri. (Nissayapaccayā yathā sahajātapaccayā.)
analyzed: nissaya paccayāḥ na hetuyā cattāri nissaya paccayāḥ yathā sahajāta paccayā
translated: As condition being a condition by way of reliance condition: there are four. (As condition being a condition by way of reliance condition: like as condition being a condition by way of conascence condition.)

original: Upanissayaduka
analyzed: upanissaya duka
translated: The Section on Requisite Conditions

original: Upanissayapaccayā nahetuyā cattāri. (Upanissayapaccayā ārammaṇapaccayasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: upanissaya paccayā na hetuyā cattāri upanissaya paccayā ārammaṇa paccaya sadisa
translated: As condition being a condition by way of decisive support condition: there are four. (As condition being a condition by way of decisive support condition: like as condition being a condition by way of object condition.)

original: Purejātaduka
analyzed: purejātaduka
translated: The Pair: Preceding

original: Purejātapaccayā nahetuyā cattāri, naadhipatiyā satta, napacchājāte satta, naāsevane satta, nakamme satta, navipāke satta, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ.
analyzed: purejāta paccayāḥ na hetuyā cattāri na adhipatiyā satta na pacchājāte satta na āsevane satta na kamme satta na vipāke satta na jhāne eka na magge eka
translated: As condition being a condition by way of a preceding condition: there are four. As condition being a condition by way of a not-an-object condition: there are seven. As condition being a condition by way of a not-immediately-proceeding condition: there are seven. As condition being a condition by way of a not-decisive-support condition: there are seven. As condition being a condition by way of a not-kamma condition: there are seven. As condition being a condition by way of a not-result condition: there are seven. As condition being a condition by way of a not-absorption condition: there are one. As condition being a condition by way of a not-path condition: there are one.

original: Purejātapaccayā hetupaccayā …pe….
analyzed: purejāta paccayāḥ hetu paccayāḥ pe
translated: As condition being a condition by way of a preceding condition and as condition being a condition by way of a cause condition …

original: Āsevanaduka
analyzed: āsevana duka
translated: The Pair: Repetition

original: Āsevanapaccayā nahetuyā cattāri, naadhipatiyā satta, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte satta, nakamme satta, navipāke satta, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte tīṇi.
analyzed: āsevana paccayā na hetuyā cattāri na adhipatiyā satta na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte satta na kamme satta na vipāke satta na magge eka na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: As condition being a condition by way of repetition condition: there are four. As condition being a condition by way of a not-an-object condition: there are seven. As condition being a condition by way of a not-preceded-by-result condition: there are three. As condition being a condition by way of a not-immediately-proceeding condition: there are seven. As condition being a condition by way of a not-kamma condition: there are seven. As condition being a condition by way of a not-result condition: there are seven. As condition being a condition by way of a not-path condition: there are one. As condition being a condition by way of a not-unrelated condition: there are three.

original: Tika🔽Āsevanapaccayā hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā satta, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte satta, nakamme satta, navipāke satta, navippayutte tīṇi.
analyzed: tika  āsevana paccayāḥ hetu paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā satta na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte satta na kamme satta na vipāke satta na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: The Triad

original: Catukka
analyzed: catukka
translated: As condition being a condition by way of repetition condition and as condition being a condition by way of a cause condition and as condition being a condition by way of a not-an-object condition: there are seven. As condition being a condition by way of a not-preceded-by-result condition: there are three. As condition being a condition by way of a

original: Āsevanapaccayā hetupaccayā ārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatiyā satta. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: āsevana paccayāḥ hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇa paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā satta
translated: As condition for kamma, as condition for nutriment, as condition for faculty, as condition for jhāna, as condition for path, as condition for association, as condition for dissociation, as condition for presence, as condition for absence, as condition for non-disappearance: in one way.

original: Tevīsaka
analyzed: tevīsaka
translated: The twenty-one-fold

original: Āsevanapaccayā hetupaccayā …pe… purejātapaccayā kammapaccayā āhārapaccayā …pe… avigatapaccayā napacchājāte satta, navipāke satta.
analyzed: āsevana paccayā hetu paccayā pe purejāta paccayā kamma paccayā āhāra paccayā pe avigata paccayā na pacchājāte satta na vipāke satta
translated: As condition for kamma, as condition for nutriment, as condition for faculty, as condition for jhāna, as condition for path, as condition for prenascence, as condition for postnascence, as condition for arising, as condition for presence, as condition for non-disappearance: in one way.

original: Kammaduka🔽Kammapaccayā nahetuyā cattāri, naārammaṇe pañca, naadhipatiyā sattarasa, naanantare
analyzed: kammaduka  kamma paccayāḥ na hetuyā cattāri na ārammaṇe pañca na adhipatiyā sattarasa na anantare
translated: The kamma pentad

original: pañca, nasamanantare pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye pañca, napurejāte satta,🔽napacchājāte sattarasa, naāsevane sattarasa, navipāke sattarasa, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye🔽ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā
analyzed: pañca na samanantare pañca na aññamaññe pañca na upanissaye pañca na purejāte satta  na pacchājāte sattarasa na āsevane sattarasa na vipāke sattarasa na āhāre eka na aindriye  eka na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā
translated: As condition for kamma, not as condition for non-causation … not as condition for object … not as condition for predominance … not as condition for proximity … not as condition for contiguity … not as condition for immediacy … not as condition for repetition … not as condition for dissociation … not as condition for absence … not as condition for disappearance: in five ways.

original: pañca, novigate pañca.
analyzed: pañca na u vigate pañca
translated: As condition for kamma, not as condition for non-causation … not as condition for object … not as condition for predominance … not as condition for proximity … not as condition for contiguity … not as condition for repetition … not as condition for dissociation … not as condition for absence … not as condition for disappearance: in five ways.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: The three-factored

original: Kammapaccayā hetupaccayā naārammaṇe pañca …pe… navipāke sattarasa, nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā pañca, novigate pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: kamma paccayāḥ hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe pañca pe na vipāke sattarasa na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā pañca no vigate pañca saṅkhitta
translated: As condition for kamma, as condition for a root, as condition for object, there are five … As condition for kamma and as condition for a root, as condition for object, there are five … As condition for kamma and as condition for a root, as condition for non-result, there are seven … As condition for kamma and as condition for a root, as condition for association, there are five … As condition for kamma and as condition for a root, as condition for dissociation, there are three … As condition for kamma and as condition for a root, as condition for absence, there are five … As condition for kamma and as condition for a root, as condition for non-deprivation, there are five. (In brief.)

original: Vipākaduka
analyzed: vipāka duka
translated: The triad on result

original: Vipākapaccayā nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ,🔽nasamanantare ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ, napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte
analyzed: vipāka paccayā na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe eka na adhipatiyā eka na anantare eka  na samanantare eka na aññamaññe eka na upanissaye eka na purejāte eka na pacchājāte
translated: As result condition, as non-root condition, there is one … As result condition, as non-object condition, there is one … As result condition, as non-predominance condition, there is one … As result condition, as non-prenascence condition, there is one …

original: ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte
analyzed: eka na āsevane eka na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka na vippayutte
translated: As result condition, as non-postnascence condition, there is one … As result condition, as non-prior condition, there is one … As result condition, as non-dependence condition, there is one … As result condition, as non-nutriment condition, there is one … As result condition, as non-kamma condition, there is one … As result condition, as non-kamma-formation condition, there is one … As result condition, as non-deprivation condition, there is one … As result condition, as non-guarding condition, there is one … As result condition, as non-investigation condition, there is one … As result condition, as non-non-causality condition, there is one … As result condition, as non-resolve condition, there is one … As result condition, as non-non-resolve condition, there is one … As result condition, as non-foundation condition, there is one … As result condition, as non-path condition, there is one … As result condition, as non-association condition, there is one … As result condition, as non-dissociation condition, there is one …

original: ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: eka nonatthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: As result condition, as non-absence condition, there is one … As result condition, as non-deprivation condition, there is one.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: The triad on result

original: Vipākapaccayā hetupaccayā naārammaṇe ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare🔽ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ, napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane

original: Abyākataṁ dhammaṁ nissāya akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—vatthuṁ nissāya akusalā khandhā.
analyzed: abyākatam dhammam nissāya akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā vatthum nissāya akusalāḥ khandhāḥ
translated: With an indeterminate object, an unwholesome thought arises, as a condition being a root condition, the unwholesome aggregates, taking the object as a basis.

original: Abyākataṁ dhammaṁ nissāya kusalo ca abyākato ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā— vatthuṁ nissāya kusalā khandhā, mahābhūte nissāya cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ.
analyzed: abyākatam dhammam nissāya kusalaḥ ca abyākataḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā vatthum nissāya kusalāḥ khandhāḥ mahābhūte nissāya citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa
translated: With an indeterminate object, a wholesome and an indeterminate thought arise, as a condition being a root condition, the wholesome aggregates, taking the object as a basis. With the great essentials as object, the materiality originated by consciousness arises.

original: Abyākataṁ dhammaṁ nissāya akusalo ca abyākato ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā—vatthuṁ nissāya akusalā khandhā, mahābhūte nissāya cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ.
analyzed: abyākatam dhammam nissāya akusalaḥ ca abyākataḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccaya vatthum nissāya akusalāḥ khandhāḥ mahābhūte nissāya citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa
translated: With an indeterminate object, an unwholesome and an indeterminate thought arise, as a condition being a root condition, the unwholesome aggregates, taking the object as a basis. With the great essentials as object, the materiality originated by consciousness arises.

original: Kusalañca abyākatañca dhammaṁ nissāya kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— kusalaṁ
analyzed: kusalañca abyākatañca dhammam nissāya kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā kusala
translated: With a wholesome and an indeterminate object, a wholesome thought arises, as a condition being a root condition, a wholesome aggregate, taking the object as a basis.

original: ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca nissāya tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe ca vatthuñca nissāya
analyzed: ekam khandhañca vatthuñca nissāya tayo khandhāḥ pe dve khandhe ca vatthuñca nissāya
translated: With one aggregate and the object as condition, three aggregates arise … With two aggregates and the object as condition, two aggregates arise.

original: dve khandhā. Kusalañca abyākatañca dhammaṁ nissāya abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—kusale
analyzed: dve khandhā kusalañca abyākatañca dhammam nissāya abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā akusale
translated: With a wholesome and an indeterminate object, an indeterminate thought arises, as a condition being a root condition, the materiality originated by consciousness.

original: khandhe ca mahābhūte ca nissāya cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ. Kusalañca abyākatañca dhammaṁ
analyzed: khandhe ca mahābhūte ca nissāya citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa kusalañca abyākatañca dhamma
translated: and the form that is derived from mind-objects and the great essentials.

original: nissāya kusalo ca abyākato ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā—kusalaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca
analyzed: nissāya kusalaḥ ca abyākataḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccaya akusalam ekam khandhañca
translated: When a wholesome and an indeterminate thought arise in dependence on a wholesome and an indeterminate object, then with a wholesome object and the great essentials as condition there arises a wholesome thought.

original: vatthuñca nissāya tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe ca vatthuñca nissāya dve khandhā,
analyzed: vatthuñca nissāya tayo khandhā pe dve khandhe ca vatthuñca nissāya dve khandhā
translated: With one aggregate and the physical basis as condition there arise three aggregates. … With two aggregates and the physical basis as condition there arise two aggregates.

original: kusale khandhe ca mahābhūte ca nissāya cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ.
analyzed: kusale khandhe ca mahābhūte ca nissāya citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa
translated: With the wholesome aggregates and the great essentials as condition there arises the form that is derived from mind-object.

original: Akusalañca abyākatañca dhammaṁ nissāya akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— akusalaṁ
analyzed: akusalañca abyākatañca dhammam nissāya akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā akusala
translated: When an unwholesome thought arises in dependence on an unwholesome object, then with an unwholesome object and the great essentials as condition there arises an unwholesome thought.

original: ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca nissāya tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe ca vatthuñca nissāya🔽dve khandhā. Akusalañca abyākatañca dhammaṁ nissāya abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—akusale
analyzed: ekam khandhañca vatthuñca nissāya tayo khandhāḥ pe dve khandhe ca vatthuñca nissāya  dve khandhā akusalañca abyākatañca dhammam nissāya abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā akusale
translated: With one aggregate and the physical basis as condition there arise three aggregates. … With two aggregates and the physical basis as condition there arise two aggregates.

original: khandhe ca mahābhūte ca nissāya cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ. Akusalañca abyākatañca dhammaṁ
analyzed: khandhe ca mahābhūte ca nissāya citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa akusalañca abyākatañca dhamma
translated: When an indeterminate thought arises in dependence on an unwholesome object, then with the unwholesome aggregates and the great essentials as condition there arises the form that is derived from mind-object.

original: nissāya akusalo ca abyākato ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā—akusalaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca
analyzed: nissāya akusalaḥ ca abyākataḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā akusalam ekam khandhañca
translated: Unwholesome and indeterminate thoughts arise with a condition by way of cause condition: depending on one of the unwholesome aggregates and

original: vatthuñca nissāya tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe ca vatthuñca nissāya dve khandhā,
analyzed: vatthuñca nissāya tayo khandhā pe dve khandhe ca vatthuñca nissāya dve khandhā
translated: the physical basis, three aggregates … depending on two aggregates and the physical basis, two aggregates.

original: akusale khandhe ca mahābhūte ca nissāya cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ.
analyzed: akusale khandhe ca mahābhūte ca nissāya citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa
translated: Depending on the unwholesome aggregates and the great primaries, materiality derived from the four great primaries arises.

original: Yathā paccayavāre, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.
analyzed: yathā paccaya vāre evam
translated: As in the case of the condition chapter, so here the method of treatment should be understood in detail.

original: Yathā paccayavāre, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.🔽Nissayavāre anulomaṁ.🔽1.2.4.2. Paccayapaccanīya
analyzed: yathā paccaya vāre evam  nissaya vāre anuloma  paccaya paccanīya
translated: As in the case of the conditions, so here too the method should be understood in detail.🔽In the section on the requisites, in the case of the direct order,

original: Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The Exposition

original: Nahetu🔽Akusalaṁ dhammaṁ nissāya akusalo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā— vicikicchāsahagate uddhaccasahagate khandhe nissāya vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho.
analyzed: na hetu  akusalam dhammam nissāya akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā vicikicchā sahagate uddhacca sahagate khandhe nissāya vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho
translated: Not a Root🔽An unwholesome state … arises … not as a root condition, that is, the unwholesome doubt and the unwholesome uncertainty that arise in one who is in doubt and uncertainty about the four noble truths.

original: Abyākataṁ dhammaṁ nissāya abyākato dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ vipākābyākataṁ🔽kiriyābyākataṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ nissāya tayo khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ, tayo🔽khandhe nissāya eko khandho cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ, dve khandhe nissāya dve khandhā
analyzed: abyākatam dhammam nissāya abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetukam vipāka abyākata  kiriyā abyākatam ekam khandham nissāya tayo khandhā citta samuṭṭhānañca  khandhe nissāya ekaḥ khandho citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpa dve khandhe nissāya dve khandhā
translated: A resultant indeterminate state … arises … not as a root condition, that is, the resultant indeterminate consciousness element and the resultant indeterminate mental factors arise in one who is in doubt and uncertainty about the four noble truths.

original: cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ; ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe vipākābyākataṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ nissāya
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhānam ca rūpa ahetuka paṭisandhi kkhaṇe vipāka abyākatam ekam khandham nissāya
translated: An inoperative indeterminate state … arises … not as a root condition, that is, the inoperative indeterminate consciousness element and the inoperative indeterminate mental factors arise in one who is in doubt and uncertainty about the four noble truths.🔽A single aggregate … arises … not as a root condition, that is, the three aggregates and the materiality derived by clinging arise in one who is in doubt and uncertainty about the four noble truths.🔽The three aggregates … arise … not as a root condition, that is, the single aggregate and the materiality derived by clinging arise in one who is in doubt and uncertainty about the four noble truths.

original: tayo khandhā kaṭattā ca rūpaṁ …pe… dve khandhe nissāya dve khandhā kaṭattā ca rūpaṁ;
analyzed: tayo khandhā kaṭattā ca rūpam pe dve khandhe nissāya dve khandhā kaṭattā ca rūpa
translated: The two aggregates … arise … not as a root condition, that is, the two aggregates and the materiality derived by clinging arise in one who is in doubt and uncertainty about the four noble truths.🔽At the rebirth-linking consciousness moment, the three aggregates and the materiality derived by nutriment, by temperature, and by kamma arise in one who is in doubt and uncertainty about the four noble truths.🔽At the death moment, the three aggregates and the materiality derived by nutriment, by temperature, and by kamma arise in one who is in doubt and uncertainty about the four noble truths.

original: khandhe nissāya vatthu, vatthuṁ nissāya khandhā; ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ nissāya tayo mahābhūtā🔽…pe… mahābhūte nissāya cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ kaṭattārūpaṁ upādārūpaṁ; bāhiraṁ …🔽āhārasamuṭṭhānaṁ … utusamuṭṭhānaṁ … asaññasattānaṁ ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ nissāya tayo mahābhūtā
analyzed: khandhe nissāya vatthu vatthum nissāya khandhāḥ ekam mahābhūtam nissāya tayo mahābhūtā  pe mahābhūte nissāya citta samuṭṭhānam rūpam kaṭattā rūpam upādā rūpa bāhiram  āhāra samuṭṭhānam utu samuṭṭhānam asaññasattānam ekam mahābhūtam nissāya tayaḥ mahābhūtā
translated: The physical bases are dependent on the aggregates. The aggregates are dependent on the physical bases. One of the four great elementalities is dependent on the other three.🔽… The four great elementalities are dependent on the derived materiality originated by mind, on the materiality of position, and on the materiality of continuity. The external is dependent on the internal.🔽… The derived materiality originated by nutriment is dependent on the derived materiality originated by temperature, on the derived materiality originated by consciousness, and on the materiality of continuity. The derived materiality originated by temperature is dependent on the derived materiality originated by kamma, on the derived materiality originated by consciousness, and on the materiality of continuity. The derived materiality originated by kamma is dependent on the derived materiality originated by consciousness and on the materiality of continuity. The derived materiality originated by consciousness is dependent on the materiality of continuity. The materiality of continuity is dependent on the four great elementalities. The four great elementalities are dependent on the derived materiality originated by consciousness, on the materiality of position, and on the materiality of continuity. The derived materiality originated by mind is dependent on the four great elementalities.

original: …pe… mahābhūte nissāya kaṭattārūpaṁ upādārūpaṁ; cakkhāyatanaṁ nissāya cakkhuviññāṇaṁ🔽…pe… kāyāyatanaṁ nissāya kāyaviññāṇaṁ; vatthuṁ nissāya ahetukā vipākābyākatā kiriyābyākatā khandhā.
analyzed: pe mahābhūte nissāya kaṭattā rūpa upādā rūpa cakkhu āyatanam nissāya cakkhu viññāṇa  pe kāya āyatanam nissāya kāya viññāṇa vatthum nissāya ahetukāḥ vipāka abyākatā kiriyā abyākatā khandhāḥ
translated: … The four great elementalities are dependent on the materiality of position, on the materiality of continuity, and on the derived materiality. The eye base is dependent on eye-consciousness.🔽… The body base is dependent on body-consciousness. The physical bases are dependent on the non-causally arisen resultant indeterminate and the causally arisen functional indeterminate mental aggregates.🔽An unwholesome state is dependent on an indeterminate state as a condition by way of non-suppression condition—the physical bases are dependent on doubt-accompanied delusion and restlessness-accompanied delusion.

original: Abyākataṁ dhammaṁ nissāya akusalo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—vatthuṁ nissāya vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho.🔽Akusalañca abyākatañca dhammaṁ nissāya akusalo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā— vicikicchāsahagate
analyzed: abyākatam dhammam nissāya akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā vatthum nissāya vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho 🔽akusalam ca abyākatam ca dhammam nissāya akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā vicikicchā sahagate
translated: An unwholesome state is dependent on an unwholesome and an indeterminate state as a condition by way of non-suppression condition—doubt-accompanied and restlessness-accompanied states are dependent on the physical bases.

original: uddhaccasahagate khandhe ca vatthuñca nissāya vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho.
analyzed: uddhacca sahagate khandhe ca vatthuñca nissāya vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho
translated: and the states associated with restlessness, and the physical basis, he has delusion associated with uncertainty and associated with restlessness.

original: Yathā paccayavāre, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.
analyzed: yathā paccaya vāre evam
translated: As in the case of the condition by way of object, so should it be expanded.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The section on enumeration

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: Pure

original: Nahetuyā cattāri, naārammaṇe pañca, naadhipatiyā sattarasa, naanantare pañca, nasamanantare
analyzed: na hetuyā cattāri na ārammaṇe pañca na adhipatiyā sattarasa na anantare pañca na samanantare
translated: In the absence of a root cause there are four. In the absence of an object there are five. In the absence of predominance there are seventeen. In the absence of an antecedent there are five. In the absence of a consequence there are five.

original: pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye pañca, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte sattarasa,
analyzed: pañca na aññamaññe pañca na upanissaye pañca na purejāte satta na pacchājāte sattarasa
translated: In the absence of a simulta-neity there are five. In the absence of support there are five. In the absence of prior arising there are seven. In the absence of subsequent arising there are seventeen.

original: naāsevane sattarasa, nakamme satta, navipāke sattarasa, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ,
analyzed: na āsevane sattarasa na kamme satta na vipāke sattarasa na āhāre eka na indriye eka
translated: In the absence of repetition there are seventeen. In the absence of kamma there are seven. In the absence of kamma result there are seventeen. In the absence of nutriment there is one. In the absence of a faculty there is one.

original: najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā pañca, novigate pañca.
analyzed: na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā pañca no vigate pañca
translated: In the absence of a jhana there is one. In the absence of a path there is one. In the absence of association there are five. In the absence of dissociation there are three. In the absence of presence there are five. In the absence of non-disappearance there are five.

original: Nissayavāre paccanīyaṁ.
analyzed: nissaya vāre paccanīya
translated: In the absence of support, the reverse order is to be understood.🔽… In the forward and reverse order by way of conditions

original: 1.2.4.3. Paccayānulomapaccanīya🔽Hetuduka
analyzed: paccaya anuloma paccanīya  hetu duka
translated: The section on the root cause

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe pañca, naadhipatiyā sattarasa, naanantare pañca, nasamanantare
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe pañca na adhipatiyā sattarasa na anantare pañca na samanantare
translated: In the absence of a root cause, in the absence of an object there are five. In the absence of predominance there are seventeen. In the absence of an antecedent there are five. In the absence of a consequence there are five.

original: pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye pañca, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte sattarasa,
analyzed: pañca na aññamaññe pañca na upanissaye pañca na purejāte satta na pacchājāte sattarasa
translated: five, five not by way of relation, five not by way of support, seven by way of prenascence, seventeen by way of postnascence,

original: naāsevane sattarasa, nakamme satta, navipāke sattarasa, nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte
analyzed: na āsevane sattarasa na kamme satta na vipāke sattarasa na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte
translated: seventeen by way of nutriment, seven by way of action, seventeen by way of result, five by way of association,🔽three by way of presence, five by way of non-disappearance, five by way of non-disappearance. (Abbreviated.)

original: tīṇi, nonatthiyā pañca, novigate pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nissayavāre anulomapaccanīyaṁ.
analyzed: tīṇi no natthiyā pañca no vigate pañca  nissaya vāre anuloma paccanīya
translated: In the section on the conditions, in the forward order and the reverse order.

original: 1.2.4.4. Paccayapaccanīyānuloma
analyzed: paccaya paccanīya anuloma
translated: .... In the reverse order from the conditions, in the forward order

original: Nahetuduka
analyzed: na hetu duka
translated: The not-root dyad🔽With non-root as condition: as object four, as proximity four, as proximity-deprivation four, as association four,

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe cattāri, anantare cattāri, samanantare cattāri, sahajāte cattāri,🔽aññamaññe cattāri, nissaye cattāri, upanissaye cattāri, purejāte cattāri, āsevane
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe cattāri anantare cattāri samanantare cattāri sahajāte cattāri  aññamaññe cattāri nissaye cattāri upanissaye cattāri purejāte cattāri āsevane
translated: as dissociation four, as presence four, as non-disappearance four, as disappearance four, as root four, as great-primary-four-spheres four, as faculty four, as absorption four,

original: cattāri, kamme cattāri, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre cattāri, indriye cattāri, jhāne cattāri,🔽magge tīṇi, sampayutte cattāri, vippayutte cattāri, atthiyā cattāri, natthiyā cattāri,🔽vigate cattāri, avigate cattāri. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: cattāri kamme cattāri vipāke eka āhāre cattāri indriye cattāri jhāne cattāri 🔽magge tīṇi sampayutte cattāri vippayutte cattāri atthiyā cattāri natthiyā cattāri 🔽vigate cattāri avigate cattāri
translated: as path four, as fruit four, as nutriment four, as faculty four, as jhāna four, as path three, as association four, as dissociation four, as presence four, as absence four,🔽as disappearance four, as non-disappearance four, as support four, as supported four, as arising four, as presence four, as non-disappearance four, as disappearance four, as non-disappearance four, as supported four, as supported-supported four, as great-primary-four-spheres four, as faculty four, as absorption four, as path four, as fruit four, as nutriment four, as faculty four, as jhāna four, as path three, as association four, as dissociation four, as presence four, as absence four, as disappearance four, as non-disappearance four, as support four, as supported four, as arising four, as presence four, as non-disappearance four, as disappearance four, as non-disappearance four, as supported four, as supported-supported four, as great-primary-four-spheres four, as faculty four, as absorption four, as path four, as fruit four, as nutriment four, as faculty four, as jhāna four, as path three, as association four, as dissociation four, as presence four, as absence four, as disappearance four, as non-disappearance four, as support four, as supported four, as arising four, as presence four, as non-disappearance four, as disappearance four, as

original: Nissayavāre paccanīyānulomaṁ.
analyzed: nissaya vāre paccanīya anuloma
translated: In the section on conditions, in the reverse order, and in the forward order.

original: (Paccayattaṁ nāma nissayattaṁ, nissayattaṁ nāma paccayattaṁ.)
analyzed: paccayattam nāma nissayatta nissayattam nāma paccayatta
translated: (The state of being a condition is the state of being a support, and the state of being a support is the state of being a condition.)

original: Nissayavāro.🔽1.2.5. Saṁsaṭṭhavāra
analyzed: nissaya vāro  sa saṭṭhavāra
translated: The section on support.🔽… The section on association🔽… The section on conditions in direct order

original: 1.2.5.1. Paccayānuloma🔽Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: paccaya anuloma  vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The section on exposition

original: Hetu🔽Kusalaṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—kusalaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā tayo khandhā, tayo khandhe saṁsaṭṭho eko khandho, dve khandhe saṁsaṭṭhā dve khandhā.
analyzed: hetu  kusalam dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā akusalam ekam khandham sa saṭṭhā tayaḥ khandhā tayaḥ khandhe sa saṭṭhaḥ ekaḥ khandhaḥ dve khandhe sa saṭṭhāḥ dve khandhāḥ
translated: Causes🔽A wholesome consciousness element associated with wholesome consciousness elements arises with wholesome consciousness elements as condition by way of condition being a cause: a single wholesome aggregate associated with three aggregates, three aggregates associated with a single aggregate, two aggregates associated with two aggregates.

original: Akusalaṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—akusalaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ🔽saṁsaṭṭhā tayo khandhā, tayo khandhe saṁsaṭṭho eko khandho, dve khandhe saṁsaṭṭhā dve khandhā.
analyzed: akusalam dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā akusalam ekam khandha  sa saṭṭhā tayo khandhā tayo khandhe sa saṭṭhaḥ ekaḥ khandhaḥ dve khandhe sa saṭṭhāḥ dve khandhā
translated: An unwholesome consciousness element associated with unwholesome consciousness elements arises with unwholesome consciousness elements as condition by way of condition being a cause: an unwholesome aggregate associated with three aggregates, three aggregates associated with an unwholesome aggregate, two aggregates associated with two aggregates.

original: Abyākataṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— vipākābyākataṁ
analyzed: abyākatam dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā vipāka abyākata
translated: An indeterminate consciousness element associated with an indeterminate consciousness element arises with an indeterminate consciousness element as condition by way of condition being a cause: a resultant indeterminate consciousness element associated with three aggregates, three aggregates associated with a resultant indeterminate consciousness element, two aggregates associated with two aggregates.

original: kiriyābyākataṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā tayo khandhā, tayo khandhe saṁsaṭṭho eko khandho,
analyzed: kiriyā abyākatam ekam khandham sa saṭṭhā tayo khandhā tayo khandhe sa saṭṭhaḥ ekaḥ khandho
translated: An actional indeterminate consciousness element associated with an actional indeterminate consciousness element arises with an actional indeterminate consciousness element as condition by way of condition being a cause: a single aggregate associated with three aggregates, three aggregates associated with a single aggregate,

original: dve khandhe saṁsaṭṭhā dve khandhā; paṭisandhikkhaṇe vipākābyākataṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ
analyzed: dve khandhe sa saṭṭhā dve khandhā paṭisandhi kkhaṇe vipāka abyākatam ekam khandha
translated: Two aggregates are related to two aggregates. At the mind-consciousness element, at the mind-consciousness-contact element, and at the equanimity faculty, the two aggregates are related to the two aggregates.

original: saṁsaṭṭhā tayo khandhā, tayo khandhe saṁsaṭṭho eko khandho, dve khandhe saṁsaṭṭhā dve khandhā.🔽Ārammaṇādi
analyzed: sa saṭṭhā tayo khandhā tayo khandhe sa saṭṭhaḥ ekaḥ khandhaḥ dve khandhe sa saṭṭhāḥ dve khandhā  ārammaṇa ādi
translated: At the mind-consciousness element, at the mind-consciousness-contact element, and at the equanimity faculty, the three aggregates are related to the one aggregate. At the mind-consciousness element, at the mind-consciousness-contact element, and at the equanimity faculty, the one aggregate is related to the three aggregates. At the mind-consciousness element, at the mind-consciousness-contact element, and at the equanimity faculty, the two aggregates are related to the two aggregates.🔽Object condition …

original: Kusalaṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho kusalo dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā … adhipatipaccayā🔽… (adhipati paṭisandhikkhaṇe natthi.) Anantarapaccayā … samanantarapaccayā … sahajātapaccayā
analyzed: kusalam dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā adhipati paccayā  adhipati paṭisandhi khaṇe natthi anantara paccayā samanantara paccayā sahajāta paccayā
translated: A wholesome thought is related to a wholesome thought that arises by way of object condition … by way of predominance condition …

original: … aññamaññapaccayā … nissayapaccayā … upanissayapaccayā. (Sabbāni padāni hetumūlakasadisāni.)
analyzed: aññamañña paccayā nissaya paccayā upanissaya paccayā sabbāni padāni hetu mūlaka sadisāni
translated: … (The predominance condition is not found in the section on rebirth-linking.) … by way of proximity condition … by way of contiguity condition … by way of support condition … by way of decisive support condition … by way of nutriment condition … by way of faculty condition … by way of absorption condition … by way of path condition … by way of association condition … by way of non-association condition … by way of presence condition … by way of absence condition … by way of disappearance condition … by way of non-disappearance condition … by way of the condition being a wholesome root … by way of the condition being a factor … by way of the condition being an associated factor … by way of the condition being a prior and similar factor … by way of the condition being a prior and similar factor with regard to rebirth-linking … by way of the condition being a prior and dissimilar factor … by way of the condition being a subsequent and dissimilar factor … by way of the condition being a prior and similar or dissimilar factor … by way of the condition being a subsequent and similar or dissimilar factor … by way of the condition being a prior and similar or dissimilar or subsequent and similar or dissimilar factor.

original: Purejāta🔽Kusalaṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho kusalo dhammo uppajjati purejātapaccayā—kusalaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ
analyzed: purā jāta  kusalam dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati purejāta paccaya akusalam ekam khandha
translated: Preceding condition

original: saṁsaṭṭhā tayo khandhā, tayo khandhe saṁsaṭṭho eko khandho, dve khandhe saṁsaṭṭhā🔽dve khandhā, vatthuṁ purejātapaccayā.
analyzed: sa saṭṭhā tayo khandhā tayo khandhe sa saṭṭhaḥ ekaḥ khandhaḥ dve khandhe sa saṭṭhā 🔽dve khandhāḥ vatthum purejāta paccayā
translated: A wholesome thought is related to a wholesome thought that arises by way of preceding and arising simultaneously condition … by way of preceding and arising simultaneously and immediately preceding condition … by way of preceding and arising simultaneously and support condition … by way of preceding and arising simultaneously and decisive support condition … by way of preceding and arising simultaneously and nutriment condition … by way of preceding and arising simultaneously and faculty condition … by way of preceding and arising simultaneously and absorption condition … by way of preceding and arising simultaneously

original: Akusalaṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho akusalo dhammo uppajjati purejātapaccayā—akusalaṁ ekaṁ
analyzed: akusalam dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati purejāta paccayā akusalam eka
translated: A wholesome thought is related to a wholesome thought as a prior condition, being related to it as a prenascent condition. A wholesome thought is related to a resultant thought … A wholesome thought is related to a functional thought … A wholesome thought is related to a wholesome and a resultant thought … A wholesome thought is related to a wholesome and a functional thought … A wholesome thought is related to a wholesome, resultant and functional thought … A wholesome thought is related to a resultant and a functional thought … A wholesome thought is related to a wholesome, resultant and functional thought as a prior condition, being related to it as a prenascent condition.

original: khandhaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā tayo khandhā, tayo khandhe saṁsaṭṭho eko khandho, dve khandhe🔽saṁsaṭṭhā dve khandhā; vatthuṁ purejātapaccayā.🔽Abyākataṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho abyākato dhammo uppajjati purejātapaccayā— vipākābyākataṁ🔽kiriyābyākataṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā tayo khandhā, tayo khandhe saṁsaṭṭho eko khandho,

analyzed: suddha  hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi anantare tīṇi samanantare tīṇi sahajāte

translated: In the case of cause there are three, in the case of object there are three, in the case of predominance there are three, in the case of proximity there are three, in the case of contiguity there are three, in the case of arising together there are three, in the case of conascence there are three, in the case of mutuality there are three, in the case of support there are three, in the case of dependence there are three, in the case of dissociation there are three, in the case of presence there are three, in the case of absence there are three, in the case of disappearance there are three, in the case of non-disappearance there are three.

original: tīṇi, vippayutte tīṇi, atthiyā tīṇi, natthiyā tīṇi, vigate tīṇi, avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: tīṇi vippayutte tīṇi atthiyā tīṇi natthiyā tīṇi vigate tīṇi avigate tīṇi
translated: In the case of kamma there are three, in the case of kamma-result there is one, in the case of nutriment there are three, in the case of faculty there are three, in the case of jhana there are three, in the case of path there are three, in the case of association there are three, in the case of dissociation there are three, in the case of presence there are three, in the case of absence there are three, in the case of disappearance there are three, in the case of non-disappearance there are three.

analyzed: na vipāka paccayā na hetu paccayā na adhipati paccayā na purejāta paccayā na pacchājāta paccayā na āsevana paccayā na kamme eka na magge eka na vippayutte dve saṅkhitta
translated: With non-result as condition, as non-cause, as non-decisive support, as non-pre-nascence, as non-post-nascence, as non-nutritive-essence, as non-kamma, one … as non-path one … as non-non-contention two … (In brief.)

original: Najhānaduka

analyzed: na jhāna paccayā na hetuyā eka na adhipatiyā eka na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na magge ekaṃ pe
translated: With non-absorption as condition, as non-cause one … as non-decisive support one … as non-post-nascence one … as non-nutritive-essence one … as non-path one … (In brief.)

original: Chakka
analyzed: chakka

translated: With non-absorption as condition, as non-cause, as non-decisive support, as non-post-nascence, as non-nutritive-essence, as non-path one.

original: Namaggaduka
analyzed: namaggaduka

original: Namaggapaccayā nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

translated: With non-root-cause as condition, there is one … (as in §1, but with each section reduced by one).

original: Navippayuttaduka
analyzed: na vippayutta duka

translated: With non-consanguinity as condition, there are two … (as in §1, but with each section reduced by one).

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: The triad

original: Navippayuttapaccayā nahetupaccayā naadhipatiyā dve, napurejāte dve, napacchājāte dve, naāsevane dve, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke dve, namagge ekaṁ …pe….
analyzed: na vippayutta paccayā na hetu paccayā na adhipatiyā dve na purejāte dve na pacchājāte dve na āsevane dve na kamme eka na vipāke dve na magge ekam pe
translated: With non-consanguinity as condition and as non-root-cause, there are two … (as in §1, but with each section reduced by one).

original: Navaka🔽Navippayuttapaccayā nahetupaccayā naadhipatipaccayā napurejātapaccayā napacchājātapaccayā naāsevanapaccayā nakammapaccayā navipākapaccayā namagge ekaṁ.
analyzed: navaka  na vippayutta paccayā na hetu paccayā na adhipati paccayā na purejāta paccayā na pacchājāta paccayā na āsevana paccayā na kamma paccayā na vipāka paccayā na magge eka

original: Paccanīyaṁ.

original: 1.2.5.3. Paccayānulomapaccanīya
analyzed: paccaya anuloma paccanīya
translated: The reverse order🔽… with non-result as condition …

original: Hetuduka
analyzed: hetu duka

analyzed: hetu paccayā na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: With cause as condition, without as decisive support, there are three; without as prior, three; without as subsequent, three; without as nutriment, three; without as kamma, three; without as result, three; without as association, three.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika

translated: With cause as condition, with object as condition, without as decisive support, there are three; without as prior, three; without as subsequent, three; without as nutriment, three; without as kamma, three; without as result, three; without as association, three.

original: Catukka
analyzed: catukka

original: Hetupaccayā ārammaṇapaccayā adhipatipaccayā napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi …pe….
analyzed: hetu paccayā ārammaṇa paccayā adhipati paccayā na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi pe
translated: With cause as condition, with object as condition, with decisive support as condition, without as prior, there are three; without as subsequent, three; without as nutriment, three; without as kamma, three; without as result, three; without as association, three. …

original: Ekādasaka
analyzed: ekādasaka

original: Hetupaccayā ārammaṇapaccayā adhipatipaccayā anantarapaccayā samanantarapaccayā sahajātapaccayā🔽aññamaññapaccayā nissayapaccayā upanissayapaccayā purejātapaccayā napacchājāte tīṇi,
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇa paccayāḥ adhipati paccayāḥ anantara paccayāḥ samanantara paccayāḥ sahajāta paccayāḥ  aññamañña paccayāḥ nissaya paccayāḥ upanissaya paccayāḥ purejāta paccayāḥ na pacchājāte tīṇi
translated: With cause as condition, with object as condition, with decisive support as condition, with proximity as condition, with contiguity as condition, with arising together as condition,🔽with dependence as condition, with non-dependence as condition, with support as condition, with prenascence as condition, without as subsequent, there are three;

analyzed: na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi
translated: without as nutriment, three; without as kamma, three; without as result, three.

original: Dvādasaka (sāsevana)

original: Hetupaccayā ārammaṇapaccayā …pe… purejātapaccayā āsevanapaccayā napacchājāte tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi …pe….
analyzed: hetu paccayā ārammaṇa paccayā pe purejāta paccayā āsevana paccayā na pacchājāte tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi pe

original: Tevīsaka (sāsevana)
analyzed: tevīsaka sāsevana

translated: With the condition of root cause and the condition of object… With the condition of prenascence and the condition of conveying, with the condition of kamma, with the condition of nutriment… With the condition of non-disappearance, there are three in the postnascent, three in the ripening.

original: Terasaka (savipāka)
analyzed: terasaka sa vipāka

analyzed: hetu paccayā ārammaṇa paccayā pe purejāta paccayā kamma paccayā vipāka paccayā na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka
translated: With the condition of root cause and the condition of object… With the condition of prenascence, with the condition of kamma, with the condition of ripening, there is one in the postnascent, one in the non-conveying.

original: Tevīsaka (savipāka)
analyzed: tevīsaka sa vipāka

original: Hetupaccayā ārammaṇapaccayā …pe… purejātapaccayā kammapaccayā vipākapaccayā āhārapaccayā …pe… avigatapaccayā napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ.

original: Ārammaṇaduka

original: Ārammaṇapaccayā nahetuyā dve, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte tīṇi.

translated: As condition, not as root-cause, there are two. As condition, not as predominance, there are three. As condition, not as prior condition, there are three. As condition, not as subsequent condition, there are three. As condition, not as kamma condition, there are three. As condition, not as ripening, there are three. As condition, not as path, there are one. As condition, not as association, there are three.

original: Tika

original: Adhipatiduka

original: Tika

translated: As condition being a frequent resort, not as root cause, there are two; not as dominant, three; not as prior, three; not as post-nascence, three; not as kamma, three; not as result, three; not as path, one; not as association, three.

original: Tika

translated: As condition being a frequent resort, as root cause, not as dominant, there are three; not as prior, three; not as post-nascence, three; not as kamma, three; not as result, three; not as association, three. (Abbreviated.)

analyzed: jhānaduka
translated: The Meditations

original: Jhānapaccayā nahetuyā dve, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte tīṇi.
analyzed: jhāna paccayāḥ na hetuyā dve na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na magge eka na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: With respect to the condition being a meditation, there are two as non-cause, three as non-dominance, three as non-pre-nascence, three as non-post-nascence, three as non-nutritive-essence, three as non-kamma, three as non-result, one as non-path, three as non-association, and three as non-deprivation.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: The Triads

original: Jhānapaccayā hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: jhāna paccayāḥ hetu paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā tīṇi
translated: With respect to the condition being a meditation and being a cause, there are three as non-dominance. (In brief.)

original: Maggaduka
analyzed: maggaduka
translated: The Path

original: Maggapaccayā nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi.
analyzed: magga paccayā na hetuyā eka na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: With respect to the condition being a path, there is one as non-cause, three as non-dominance, three as non-pre-nascence, three as non-post-nascence, three as non-nutritive-essence, three as non-kamma, three as non-result, three as non-association, and three as non-deprivation.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: The Triads

original: Maggapaccayā hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: magga paccayāḥ hetu paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā tīṇi
translated: With cause as condition, with decisive-support condition, but not with root-cause condition, there are three. (In brief.)

original: Sampayuttaduka
analyzed: sampayutta duka
translated: The Dyad: Associated

original: Sampayuttapaccayā nahetuyā dve, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte tīṇi.
analyzed: sampayutta paccayā na hetuyā dve na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na jhāne eka na magge eka na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: With associated condition, but not with cause condition, there are two. But with decisive-support condition, there are three. But with prenascence condition, there are three. But with postnascence condition, there are three. But with nutriment condition, there are three. But with action condition, there are three. But with kamma-result condition, there are three. But with jhāna condition, there is one. But with path condition, there is one. But with absence condition, there are three.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: The Triad

original: Sampayuttapaccayā hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: sampayutta paccayāḥ hetu paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā tīṇi saṅkhitta
translated: With associated condition, with cause condition, but not with decisive-support condition, there are three. (In brief.)

original: Vippayuttaduka
analyzed: vippayutta duka
translated: The Dyad: Non-associated

original: Vippayuttapaccayā nahetuyā dve, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ.
analyzed: vippayutta paccayā na hetuyā dve na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte eka na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na jhāne eka na magge eka
translated: With non-associated condition, but not with cause condition, there are two. But with decisive-support condition, there are three. But with prenascence condition, there is one. But with postnascence condition, there are three. But with nutriment condition, there are three. But with action condition, there are three. But with kamma-result condition, there are three. But with jhāna condition, there is one. But with path condition, there is one.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: The Triad

original: Vippayuttapaccayā hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi.
analyzed: vippayutta paccayāḥ hetu paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte eka na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi
translated: With non-associated condition, with cause condition, but not with decisive-support condition, there are three. But with prenascence condition, there is one. But with postnascence condition, there are three. But with nutriment condition, there are three. But with action condition, there are three. But with kamma-result condition, there are three.

original: Catukka
analyzed: catukka
translated: The Tetrad

original: Vippayuttapaccayā hetupaccayā ārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi …pe….
analyzed: vippayutta paccayāḥ hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇa paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte eka na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi pe
translated: As condition being a condition by way of non-disappearance condition, by way of cause condition, by way of object condition, not as condition being a condition by way of predominance condition, there are three; not as condition being a condition by way of prior condition, there is one; not as condition being a condition by way of post-nascence condition, there are three; not as condition being a condition by way of repetition condition, there are three; not as condition being a condition by way of kamma condition, there are three; not as condition being a condition by way of result condition, there are three.

original: Dvādasaka
analyzed: dvādasaka
translated: Twelve

original: Vippayuttapaccayā hetupaccayā ārammaṇapaccayā …pe… purejātapaccayā napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi …pe….
analyzed: vippayutta paccayāḥ hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇa paccayāḥ pe purejāta paccayāḥ na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi pe
translated: As condition being a condition by way of non-disappearance condition, by way of cause condition, by way of object condition, … by way of prior condition, not as condition being a condition by way of post-nascence condition, there are three; not as condition being a condition by way of repetition condition, there are three; not as condition being a condition by way of kamma condition, there are three; not as condition being a condition by way of result condition, there are three.

original: Tevīsaka (sāsevana)
analyzed: tevīsaka sāsevana
translated: Twenty-three (with repetition)

original: Vippayuttapaccayā hetupaccayā …pe… purejātapaccayā āsevanapaccayā kammapaccayā āhārapaccayā …pe… avigatapaccayā napacchājāte tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi.
analyzed: vippayutta paccayāḥ hetu paccayā pe purejāta paccayāḥ āsevana paccayāḥ kamma paccayāḥ āhāra paccayāḥ pe avigata paccayāḥ na pacchājāte tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi
translated: As condition being a condition by way of non-disappearance condition, by way of cause condition, … by way of prior condition, by way of repetition condition, by way of kamma condition, by way of nutriment condition, … by way of non-disappearance condition, not as condition being a condition by way of post-nascence condition, there are three; not as condition being a condition by way of result condition, there are three.

original: Tevīsaka (savipāka)
analyzed: tevīsaka sa vipāka
translated: Twenty-three (with result)

original: Vippayuttapaccayā hetupaccayā …pe… purejātapaccayā kammapaccayā vipākapaccayā āhārapaccayā …pe… avigatapaccayā napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ.🔽Atthidukādi
analyzed: vippayutta paccayā hetu paccayā pe purejāta paccayā kamma paccayā vipāka paccayā āhāra paccayā pe avigata paccayā na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka 🔽atthi duka ādi
translated: As condition being a condition by way of non-disappearance condition, by way of cause condition, … by way of prior condition, by way of kamma condition, by way of result condition, by way of nutriment condition, … by way of non-disappearance condition, not as condition being a condition by way of post-nascence condition, there is one; not as condition being a condition by way of repetition condition, there is one.

original: Atthipaccayā … natthipaccayā … vigatapaccayā … avigatapaccayā ….
analyzed: atthi paccayā natthi paccayā vigata paccayā avigata paccayā
translated: With respect to presence … with respect to absence … with respect to disappearance … with respect to non-disappearance …

original: Yathā ārammaṇamūlakaṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.
analyzed: yathā ārammaṇa mūlake evam
translated: As with the root conditions, so too with respect to object condition, etc.

original: Anulomapaccanīyaṁ.

translated: The direct order of conditions.🔽The reverse order of conditions in direct order.

translated: The dyad on not being a root condition.

analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe dve anantare dve samanantare dve sahajāte dve aññamaññe
translated: With respect to not being a root condition, there are two in object, two in proximity, two in singleness, two in conascence, two in mutuality,

original: dve, nissaye dve, upanissaye dve, purejāte dve, āsevane dve, kamme dve, vipāke ekaṁ,
analyzed: dve nissaye dve upanissaye dve purejāte dve āsevane dve kamme dve vipāke eka
translated: two in support, two in dependence, two in prior, two in post, two in kamma, one in result,

analyzed: āhāre dve indriye dve jhāne dve magge eka sampayutte dve vippayutte dve atthiyā
translated: two in nutriment, two in faculty, two in absorption, one in path, two in association, two in dissociation, two in presence,

analyzed: dve natthiyā dve vigate dve avigate dve
translated: two in absence, two in disappearance, two in non-disappearance.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika

analyzed: na hetu paccayā na adhipati paccayā ārammaṇe dve pe avigate dve sabbattha dve
translated: With respect to not being a root condition, there are two in not being a predominance condition, etc. (In all cases two.)

conditions, and two for the two conditions,

original: nakammapaccayā navipākapaccayā namaggapaccayā navippayuttapaccayā ārammaṇe ekaṁ,
analyzed: na kamma paccayā na vipāka paccayā na magga paccayā na vippayutta paccayā ārammaṇe eka
translated: With the condition being a non-resultant, the condition being a non-path, the condition being a non-associated, there is one object.

original: anantare ekaṁ, samanantare ekaṁ, sahajāte ekaṁ, aññamaññe ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, upanissaye
analyzed: anantare eka samanantare eka sahajāte eka aññamaññe eka nissaye eka upanissaye
translated: With the condition being an antecedent, there is one. With the condition being a similar antecedent, there is one. With the condition being a conascent, there is one. With the condition being a mutuality, there is one. With the condition being a support, there is one.

original: ekaṁ, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, jhāne ekaṁ, sampayutte ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ, natthiyā
analyzed: eka āhāre eka indriye eka jhāne eka sampayutte eka atthiyā eka natthiyā
translated: With the condition being a decisive support, there is one. With the condition being a nutriment, there is one. With the condition being a faculty, there is one. With the condition being a absorption, there is one. With the condition being an association, there is one. With the condition being a presence, there is one. With the condition being an absence, there is one.

original: ekaṁ, vigate ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ. (Navipākaṁ namaggaṁ navippayuttaṁ nakammapaccayasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: eka vigate eka avigate eka na vipākam na maggam na vippayuttam na kamma paccaya sadisa
translated: With the condition being a disappearance, there is one. With the condition being a non-disappearance, there is one. (The non-resultant, the non-path, the non-associated, with the condition being a non-action, is similar to the non-resultant, the non-path, the non-associated, with the condition being a non-action.)

original: Naadhipatiduka
analyzed: na adhipati duka
translated: The Non-Dominant Section

original: Naadhipatipaccayā hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na adhipati paccayā hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With the condition being a non-dominant, with the condition being a cause, there are three. With the condition being an object, there are three. … With the condition being a non-disappearance, there are three.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: The Triad

original: Naadhipatipaccayā nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate dve. (Naadhipatimūlakaṁ nahetumhi ṭhitena nahetumūlakasadisaṁ kātabbaṁ.)
analyzed: na adhipati paccayā na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe dve pe avigate dve na adhipati mūlakam na hetumhi ṭhitena na hetu mūlaka sadisam
translated: With the condition being a non-dominant, with the condition being not a cause, with the condition being an object, there are two. … With the condition being a non-disappearance, there are two. (The section beginning with the non-dominant should be treated in the same way as the section beginning with the not a cause.)

original: Napurejātaduka
analyzed: napurejātaduka
translated: The Non-Preceding-Birth Section

original: Napurejātapaccayā hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… āsevane tīṇi, kamme tīṇi, vipāke ekaṁ.
analyzed: na purejāta paccayā hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi pe āsevane tīṇi kamme tīṇi vipāke eka
translated: With the condition being a non-preceding-birth, with the condition being a cause, there are three. With the condition being an object, there are three. … With the condition being a repetition, there are three. With the condition being a deed, there are three. With the condition being a nutriment, there are three. With the condition being a faculty, there are three. With the condition being a absorption, there are three. With the condition being a path, there are three. With the condition being a fruition, there are three. With the condition being an attainment, there are three

original: (Sabbāni padāni vitthāretabbāni, imāni alikhitesu padesu tīṇi pañhā. Napurejātamūlake
analyzed: sabbāni padāni vitthāretabbāni imāni alikhitesu padesu tīṇi pañhā napurejāta mūlake
translated: (All the terms should be elaborated. These are the three questions in the blank spaces.

original: nahetuyā ṭhitena āsevane ca magge ca eko pañho kātabbo, avasesāni nahetupaccayasadisāni.
analyzed: na hetuyā ṭhitena āsevane ca magge ca ekaḥ pañhaḥ kātabbaḥ avasesāni na hetu paccaya sadisāni
translated: In the non-preceded state, there is one question to be asked in the condition by way of root and in the condition by way of nutriment and in the path. The rest are similar to the condition by way of root.

original: Napacchājātapaccayā paripuṇṇaṁ naadhipatipaccayasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: na pacchājāta paccayā paripuṇṇam na adhipati paccaya sadisa
translated: In the non-consequent condition, it is complete. It is similar to the condition by way of predominance.)

original: Nakammaduka
analyzed: na kam maduka
translated: The Section on Action

original: Nakammapaccayā hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi, anantare tīṇi, samanantare
analyzed: na kamma paccayā hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi anantare tīṇi samanantare
translated: In the condition by way of action, there are three in the condition by way of root, three in the condition by way of object, three in the condition by way of predominance, three in the condition by way of proximity,

original: tīṇi, sahajāte tīṇi, aññamaññe tīṇi, nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye tīṇi, purejāte tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi sahajāte tīṇi aññamaññe tīṇi nissaye tīṇi upanissaye tīṇi purejāte tīṇi
translated: three in the condition by way of contiguity, three in the condition by way of arising together, three in the condition by way of dependence, three in the condition by way of support, three in the condition by way of prenascence,

original: āsevane tīṇi, āhāre tīṇi, indriye tīṇi, jhāne tīṇi, magge tīṇi, sampayutte tīṇi,
analyzed: āsevane tīṇi āhāre tīṇi indriye tīṇi jhāne tīṇi magge tīṇi sampayutte tīṇi
translated: three in the condition by way of nutriment, three in the condition by way of faculty, three in the condition by way of absorption, three in the condition by way of path, three in the condition by way of association,

original: vippayutte tīṇi, atthiyā tīṇi, natthiyā tīṇi, vigate tīṇi, avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: vippayutte tīṇi atthiyā tīṇi natthiyā tīṇi vigate tīṇi avigate tīṇi
translated: three in the condition by way of dissociation, three in the condition by way of presence, three in the condition by way of absence, three in the condition by way of disappearance, three in the condition by way of non-disappearance.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: The Triad

original: Nakammapaccayā nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe ekaṁ, anantare ekaṁ, samanantare ekaṁ, sahajāte
analyzed: na kamma paccayā na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe eka anantare eka samanantare eka sahajāte
translated: In the condition by way of action, in the non-condition by way of root, there is one in the condition by way of object, one in the condition by way of proximity, one in the condition by way of contiguity, one in the condition by way of arising together,

original: ekaṁ, aññamaññe ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, upanissaye ekaṁ, purejāte ekaṁ, āsevane ekaṁ,
analyzed: eka aññamaññe eka nissaye eka upanissaye eka purejāte eka āsevane eka
translated: one as condition being a condition by way of object condition, one as condition being a condition by way of support condition, one as condition being a condition by way of decisive support condition, one as condition being a condition by way of prenascence condition, one as condition being a condition by way of nutriment condition,

original: āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, jhāne ekaṁ, sampayutte ekaṁ, vippayutte ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ,

translated: one as condition being a condition by way of faculty condition, one as condition being a condition by way of absorption condition, one as condition being a condition by way of association condition, one as condition being a condition by way of dissociation condition, one as condition being a condition by way of presence condition,

original: natthiyā ekaṁ, vigate ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ …pe….
analyzed: natthiyā eka vigate eka avigate ekam pe
translated: one as condition being a condition by way of absence condition, one as condition being a condition by way of disappearance condition, one as condition being a condition by way of non-disappearance condition.

original: Pañcaka

translated: Five

original: Abyākato dhammo akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—cakkhuṁ assādeti abhinandati;
analyzed: abyākataḥ dhammaḥ akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo cakkhuṃ assādeti abhinandati
translated: An indeterminate Dhamma is a condition, as object condition, for an unwholesome Dhamma: One intends and delights in the eye,

original: taṁ ārabbha rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati, vicikicchā uppajjati, uddhaccaṁ uppajjati,
analyzed: tam ārabbha rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati vicikicchā uppajjati uddhaccam uppajjati
translated: and because of that greed arises, view arises, uncertainty arises, agitation arises,

original: domanassaṁ uppajjati. Sotaṁ … ghānaṁ … jivhaṁ … kāyaṁ … rūpe … sadde … gandhe … rase
analyzed: domanassam uppajjati sotam ghānam jivham kāyam rūpe sadde gandhe rase
translated: grief arises. One intends and delights in the ear … in the nose … in the tongue … in the body … in visible forms … in sounds … in smells … in tastes …🔽in tangible things … in the mind-object … in the resultant indeterminate and the functional indeterminate aggregates,

original: … phoṭṭhabbe … vatthuṁ … vipākābyākate kiriyābyākate khandhe assādeti abhinandati;
analyzed: phoṭṭhabbe vatthum vipāka abyākate kiriyā abyākate khandhe assādeti abhinandati
translated: and because of that greed arises, view arises, uncertainty arises, agitation arises,

original: taṁ ārabbha rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati, vicikicchā uppajjati, uddhaccaṁ uppajjati,
analyzed: tam ārabbha rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati vicikicchā uppajjati uddhaccam uppajjati
translated: Delight arises in dependence on that, and greed, view, uncertainty, agitation,

original: domanassaṁ uppajjati.🔽Adhipati
analyzed: domanassam uppajjati  adhipati
translated: and grief arise.

original: Kusalo dhammo kusalassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati.
analyzed: kusalaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati
translated: Dominant condition means: a skillful object is a dominant condition for a skillful object.

original: Ārammaṇādhipati—dānaṁ datvā sīlaṁ samādiyitvā uposathakammaṁ katvā, taṁ garuṁ katvā🔽paccavekkhati, pubbe suciṇṇāni garuṁ katvā paccavekkhati, jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhānaṁ🔽garuṁ katvā paccavekkhati. Sekkhā gotrabhuṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhanti, vodānaṁ garuṁ
analyzed: ārammaṇa adhipati dānam da tvā sīlam samādiyitvā uposatha kammam katvā tam garum katvā  paccavekkhati pubbe su ciṇṇāni garum katvā paccavekkhati jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhāna  garum katvā paccavekkhati sekkhā gotrabhum garum katvā paccavekkhanti vodānam garu
translated: Dominant condition as object means: after giving a gift, after undertaking a precept, after performing a rite, one reflects on that as being important.🔽After reviewing what was previously well-done, one reflects on that as being important. After emerging from jhāna, one reflects on the jhāna as being important.

original: katvā paccavekkhanti. Sekkhā maggā vuṭṭhahitvā maggaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhanti.
analyzed: katvā paccavekkhanti sekkhāḥ maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā maggam garum katvā paccavekkhanti
translated: Learners reflect on the path as being important.

original: Sahajātādhipati—kusalādhipati sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sahajāta adhipati kusala adhipati sampayuttakānam khandhānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Dominant condition as co-nascence means: a skillful dominant condition is a dominant condition for the associated aggregates.

original: Kusalo dhammo akusalassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Ārammaṇādhipati—dānaṁ
analyzed: kusalaḥ dhammaḥ akusalassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati dāna
translated: A profitable thought is a condition, as predominance condition, for an unprofitable thought.

original: datvā sīlaṁ samādiyitvā uposathakammaṁ katvā, taṁ garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati;🔽taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati, pubbe suciṇṇāni garuṁ katvā assādeti
analyzed: datvā sīlam samādiyitvā uposatha kammam katvā tam garum katvā assādeti abhinandati  tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati pubbe su ciṇṇāni garum katvā assādeti
translated: Predominance as object: after giving a gift, after undertaking the precepts, after doing a meditation exercise, he makes much of that, exults in that, delights in that;🔽because of making much of that, lust arises in him, view arises in him. After recollecting what was well done in the past, he makes much of that, exults in that, delights in that;

original: abhinandati; taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati. Jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā
analyzed: abhinandati tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā
translated: because of making much of that, lust arises in him, view arises in him. After emerging from jhāna,

original: jhānaṁ garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati; taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati.
analyzed: jhānam garum katvā assādeti abhinandati tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati
translated: he makes much of the jhāna, exults in that, delights in that; because of making much of that, lust arises in him, view arises in him.

original: Kusalo dhammo abyākatassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati.
analyzed: kusalaḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati
