translated: As decisive-support condition: having given a gift and undertaken the precepts and performed the Uposatha duties, he exalts himself and disparages others because of that, and because of that exaltation and disparagement, greed arises in him, and false view. Having formerly done a profitable action, he exalts himself and disparages others because of that, and because of that exaltation and disparagement, greed arises in him, and false view.

original: Jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhānaṁ garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati.🔽Pakatūpanissayo—saddhaṁ upanissāya mānaṁ jappeti, diṭṭhiṁ gaṇhāti. Sīlaṁ …pe… sutaṁ
analyzed: jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhānam garum katvā assādeti abhinandati tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati  pakata upanissaya usaddham upanissāya mānam jappeti diṭṭhim gaṇhāti sīlam pe suta
translated: Having emerged from a jhāna, he exalts that jhāna and disparages other states, and because of that exaltation and disparagement, greed arises in him, and false view.

original: …pe… cāgaṁ …pe… paññaṁ upanissāya mānaṁ jappeti, diṭṭhiṁ gaṇhāti. Saddhā … sīlaṁ
analyzed: pe cāgam pe paññam upanissāya mānam jappeti diṭṭhim gaṇhāti saddhā
translated: As decisive-support condition: through faith he exalts himself and disparages others, and through exaltedness and disparagement, greed arises in him, and false view. Through virtue … through learning … through generosity … through understanding he exalts himself and disparages others, and through exaltedness and disparagement, greed arises in him, and false view.

original: … sutaṁ … cāgo … paññā rāgassa … dosassa … mohassa … mānassa … diṭṭhiyā … patthanāya🔽upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sutam cāgaḥ paññā rāgassa dosassa mohassa mānassa diṭṭhiyāḥ patthanāya  upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … what is heard … generosity … wisdom …🔽is a condition, as decisive support condition, for greed … for hate … for delusion … for conceit … for views … for longing …

original: Kusalo dhammo abyākatassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇūpanissayo, anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo.
analyzed: kusalaḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ
translated: A wholesome thought is a condition, as decisive support condition, for an indeterminate thought, as object decisive support, as proximate decisive support, as natural decisive support.

original: Ārammaṇūpanissayo—arahā maggā vuṭṭhahitvā maggaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhati.🔽Anantarūpanissayo—kusalaṁ vuṭṭhānassa … maggo phalassa … anulomaṁ sekkhāya phalasamāpattiyā
analyzed: ārammaṇa upanissaya uarahā maggā vuṭṭhahitvā maggam garum katvā paccavekkhati  vuṭṭhānassa maggo phalassa anulomam sekkhāya phala samāpattiyā
translated: As object decisive support: a perfected one, having emerged from the path, reviews the path as a result of giving it attention.

original: … nirodhā vuṭṭhahantassa nevasaññānāsaññāyatanakusalaṁ phalasamāpattiyā upanissayapaccayena paccayo.🔽Pakatūpanissayo—saddhaṁ upanissāya attānaṁ ātāpeti paritāpeti, pariyiṭṭhimūlakaṁ

translated: As proximate decisive support: a wholesome thought is a condition, as decisive support condition, for the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling, for the attainment of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, for the attainment of the base of nothingness, for the attainment of the base of the infinity of consciousness, for the attainment of the base of the infinity of space, for the attainment of the fourth jhana, for the attainment of the third jhana, for the attainment of the second jhana, for the attainment of the first jhana, for the attainment of the base consisting of boundless consciousness, for the attainment of the base consisting of boundless space, for the attainment of the fourth jhana, for the attainment of the third jhana, for the attainment of the second jhana, for the attainment of the first jhana, for the attainment of the base consisting of boundless consciousness, for the attainment of the base consisting of boundless space, for the attainment of the third jhana, for the attainment of the second jhana, for the attainment of the first jhana, for the attainment of the base consisting of boundless consciousness, for the attainment of the base consisting of boundless space, for the attainment of the second jhana, for the attainment of the first jhana, for the attainment of the base consisting of boundless consciousness, for the attainment of the base consisting of boundless space, for the attainment of the first jhana.

original: dukkhaṁ paccanubhoti. Sīlaṁ …pe… sutaṁ …pe… cāgaṁ …pe… paññaṁ upanissāya attānaṁ
analyzed: dukkham paccanubhoti sīlam pe sutam pe cāgam pe paññam upanissāya attāna
translated: As natural decisive support: One who has faith, being resolved on his faith, makes an effort, exerts energy, rouses will, and strives. He generates desire to act and he generates desire for non-abandonment. He generates desire to undertake and he generates desire for non-remorse. He generates desire for joy and he generates desire for happiness. He generates desire for non-distraction and he generates desire for non-wavering. He generates desire for knowledge and he generates desire for vision. He generates desire for the attainment of the as-yet-unattained, for the achievement of the

original: ātāpeti paritāpeti, pariyiṭṭhimūlakaṁ dukkhaṁ paccanubhoti. Saddhā … sīlaṁ … sutaṁ
analyzed: ātāpeti paritāpeti pariyiṭṭhi mūlakam dukkham paccanubhoti saddhā sīlam
translated: he heats himself and burns himself and experiences pain, anguish, and suffering born of burning. Faith … virtue … learning …

original: … cāgo … paññā kāyikassa sukhassa … kāyikassa dukkhassa … phalasamāpattiyā upanissayapaccayena🔽paccayo. Kusalaṁ kammaṁ vipākassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo. Arahā maggaṁ upanissāya🔽anuppannaṁ kiriyasamāpattiṁ uppādeti, uppannaṁ samāpajjati, saṅkhāre aniccato dukkhato🔽anattato vipassati. Maggo arahato atthappaṭisambhidāya, dhammappaṭisambhidāya, niruttippaṭisambhidāya,🔽paṭibhānappaṭisambhidāya, ṭhānāṭhānakosallassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo. Maggo
analyzed: cāgaḥ paññā kāyikassa sukhassa kāyikassa dukkhassa phala samāpattiyā upanissaya paccayena  paccayaḥ kusalam kammam vipākassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ arahā maggam upanissāya  anuppannam kiriya samāpattim uppādeti uppannam samāpajjati saṅkhāre aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ  an attataḥ vipassati maggaḥ arahataḥ attha paṭisambhidāya dhamma ppaṭisambhidāya nirutti ppaṭisambhidāya  paṭibhāna paṭisambhidāya ṭhāna aṭhāna kosallassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ maggo
translated: He heats himself and dries himself, and he experiences pain due to the drying up of the bile. Faith … virtue … learning … generosity … wisdom is a condition, as decisive support condition, for bodily pleasure … bodily pain … the attainment of the fruit of stream-entry … the attainment of the fruit of once-returning … the attainment of the fruit of non-returning … the attainment of arahatship.🔽A profitable kamma is a condition, as decisive support condition, for its result. A noble disciple, depending on faith,

original: phalasamāpattiyā upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: phala samāpattiyāḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: arouses desire for the arising of unarisen profitable jhāna; he makes effort, arouses energy, exerts his mind, and strives. He arouses desire for the continuance of arisen jhāna, for its non-decline, increase, expansion, and fulfilment by development. He contemplates the jhāna as impermanent, contemplating it as not self, contemplating it as subject to destruction, contemplating it as subject to vanishing, contemplating it as subject to fading away, contemplating it as subject to cessation. The jhāna is a condition, as decisive support condition, for the understanding of the Teaching, for the understanding of the meaning, for the understanding of the Paṭṭhāna, for the understanding of engagement, for the understanding of discernment, for the understanding of the various kinds of knowledge, for the understanding of the way, for the understanding of the fruit. The jhāna is a condition, as decisive support condition, for the attainment of the fruit of stream-entry … for the attainment of the fruit of once-returning … for the attainment of the fruit of non-returning … for the attainment of arahatship.

original: Akusalo dhammo akusalassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇūpanissayo, anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo.🔽Ārammaṇūpanissayo—rāgaṁ garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo uppajjati,
analyzed: akusalaḥ dhammaḥ akusalassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ  ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ rāgam garum katvā assādeti abhinandati tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati
translated: An unwholesome root is a condition, as support condition, for an unwholesome state.🔽As the support condition for the object: having made greed great, one approves, welcomes, and remains holding to it. From making that great, greed arises.

original: diṭṭhi uppajjati. Diṭṭhiṁ garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo
analyzed: diṭṭhi uppajjati diṭṭhim garum katvā assādeti abhinandati tam garum katvā rāgaḥ
translated: A view arises. Having made a view great, one approves, welcomes, and remains holding to it. From making that great, greed arises.

original: uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati.🔽Anantarūpanissayo—purimā purimā akusalā khandhā pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ akusalānaṁ khandhānaṁ upanissayapaccayena paccayo.🔽Pakatūpanissayo—rāgaṁ upanissāya pāṇaṁ hanati, adinnaṁ ādiyati, musā bhaṇati, pisuṇaṁ
analyzed: uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati  anantara upanissayaḥ purimā purimāḥ akusalāḥ khandhāḥ pacchimānam pacchimānam akusalānam khandhānam upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ  pakata upanissaya urāgam upanissāya pāṇam hanati adinnam ādiyati musā bhaṇati pisuṇa
translated: A view arises.🔽As the support condition for what is immediately past: the earlier and earlier unwholesome aggregates are a condition, as support condition, for the later and later unwholesome aggregates.

original: bhaṇati, pharusaṁ bhaṇati, samphaṁ palapati, sandhiṁ chindati, nillopaṁ harati, ekāgārikaṁ
analyzed: bhaṇati pharusam bhaṇati sampham palapati sandhim chindati nillopam harati ekāgārika
translated: As the support condition for natural constitution: by depending on greed, one kills living beings … one misconducts oneself in sensual pleasures; one speaks falsely; one speaks maliciously; one speaks harshly; one gossips; one breaks into houses; one robs; one commits burglary; one attacks people; one is not content with one’s own wife and so sleeps with someone else’s wife or with a woman who has a husband or with a woman protected by her family.

original: karoti, paripanthe tiṭṭhati, paradāraṁ gacchati, gāmaghātaṁ karoti, nigamaghātaṁ

analyzed: karoti mātaram jīvitā voropeti pitaram jīvitā voropeti arahantam jīvitā voropeti
