original: tīṇi. Avigata sahajāta aññamañña nissaya sampayutta atthīti tīṇi. Avigata sahajāta
analyzed: tīṇi avigata sahajāta aññamañña nissaya sampayutta atthi iti tīṇi avigata sahajāta
translated: There are three sets of three, with the last term of each set being “a mutuality and association condition.”🔽There are three sets of three, with the last term of each set being “a mutuality, association, and presence condition.”

original: nissaya vippayutta atthīti tīṇi. Avigata sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vippayutta atthīti ekaṁ. [Avipāka—5]🔽Avigata sahajāta nissaya vipāka atthīti ekaṁ. Avigata sahajāta aññamañña nissaya🔽vipāka atthīti ekaṁ. Avigata sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka sampayutta atthīti
analyzed: nissaya vippayutta atthi iti tīṇi avigata sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vippayutta atthi iti eka  avigata sahajāta nissaya vipāka atthi iti eka avigata sahajāta aññamañña nissaya  vipāka atthi iti eka avigata sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka sampayutta atthi iti
translated: and conascence, mutuality, support, and object-predominance, there is one.🔽and conascence, support, and kamma-result, there is one. and conascence, mutuality, support,🔽and kamma-result, there is one. and conascence, mutuality, support,

original: ekaṁ. Avigata sahajāta nissaya vipāka vippayutta atthīti ekaṁ. Avigata sahajāta aññamañña
analyzed: eka avigata sahajāta nissaya vipāka vippayutta atthi iti eka avigata sahajāta aññamañña
translated: and kamma-result, and association, there is one. and conascence, mutuality, support,🔽and kamma-result, and dissociation, there is one. and conascence, mutuality, support,

original: nissaya vipāka vippayutta atthīti ekaṁ. [Savipāka—5]
analyzed: nissaya vipāka vippayutta atthi iti eka
translated: and kamma-result, and dissociation, there is one.

original: Avigatamūlakaṁ.
analyzed: avigata mūlaka
translated: With the root “not-disappeared”

original: Pañhāvārassa anulomagaṇanā.
analyzed: pañhāvārassa anuloma gaṇanā
translated: The reckoning in the forward order of the question series is finished.

original: Paccanīyuddhāra🔽Kusalo dhammo kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra  kusalaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The reverse order🔽A profitable idea is a condition, as object condition, for a profitable idea … for a unprofitable idea … for an indeterminate idea …

original: Kusalo dhammo akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: kusalaḥ dhammaḥ akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A profitable idea is a condition, as object condition, for a profitable idea … for an unprofitable idea … for an indeterminate idea …

original: Kusalo dhammo abyākatassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: kusalaḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A wholesome state is a condition, as object condition, for a neutral state … is a condition, as conascence condition, … is a condition, as support condition, … is a condition, as post-nascence condition, … is a condition, as kamma condition.

original: Kusalo dhammo kusalassa ca abyākatassa ca dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo.🔽Akusalo dhammo akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo.🔽Akusalo dhammo kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: kusalaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa ca abyākatassa ca dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ  akusalaḥ dhammaḥ akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ  akusalaḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A wholesome state is a condition, as conascence condition, for a wholesome and a neutral state.🔽An unwholesome state is a condition, as object condition, for an unwholesome state … is a condition, as conascence condition, … is a condition, as support condition.🔽An unwholesome state is a condition, as object condition, for a wholesome state … is a condition, as support condition.

original: Akusalo dhammo abyākatassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: akusalaḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An unwholesome state is a condition, as object condition, for a neutral state … is a condition, as conascence condition, … is a condition, as support condition, … is a condition, as post-nascence condition, … is a condition, as kamma condition.

original: Akusalo dhammo akusalassa ca abyākatassa ca dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: akusalaḥ dhammaḥ akusalassa ca abyākatassa ca dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An unwholesome state is a condition, as conascence condition, for an unwholesome state and for an indeterminate state.

original: Abyākato dhammo abyākatassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena🔽paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena
analyzed: abyākataḥ dhammaḥ abyākatassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena  paccayo upanissaya paccayena paccayo purejāta paccayena paccayo pacchājāta paccayena
translated: An indeterminate state is a condition, as object condition, for an indeterminate state. …🔽It is a condition, as conascence condition, …🔽It is a condition, as support condition, … It is a condition, as prenascence condition, … It is a condition, as postnascence condition, …

original: paccayo … āhārapaccayena paccayo … indriyapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ indriya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: It is a condition, as nutriment condition, … It is a condition, as faculty condition, …

original: Abyākato dhammo kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: abyākataḥ dhammaḥ kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An indeterminate state is a condition, as object condition, for a wholesome state. … It is a condition, as support condition, … It is a condition, as prenascence condition, …

original: Abyākato dhammo akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: abyākataḥ dhammaḥ akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An indeterminate state is a condition, as object condition, for an unwholesome state. … It is a condition, as support condition, … It is a condition, as prenascence condition, …

original: Kusalo ca abyākato ca dhammā kusalassa dhammassa sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ.
analyzed: kusalo ca abyākato ca dhammā kusalassa dhammassa sahajāta purejāta
translated: A wholesome and an indeterminate state are a condition, as conascence and as prenascence, for a wholesome state.

original: Kusalo ca abyākato ca dhammā abyākatassa dhammassa sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ.🔽Akusalo ca abyākato ca dhammā akusalassa dhammassa sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ.
analyzed: kusalo ca abyākato ca dhammā abyākatassa dhammassa sahajāta pacchājāta āhāra indriya  akusalo ca abyākato ca dhammā akusalassa dhammassa sahajāta purejāta
translated: Skillful and indeterminate dhammas are conascent with, and arisen before, and nutriment for, and a faculty of, an indeterminate dhamma.🔽Unwholesome and indeterminate dhammas are conascent with, and arisen before, an unwholesome dhamma.

original: Akusalo ca abyākato ca dhammā abyākatassa dhammassa sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ.
analyzed: akusalo ca abyākato ca dhammā abyākatassa dhammassa sahajāta pacchājāta āhāra indriya
translated: Unwholesome and indeterminate dhammas are conascent with, and arisen after, and nutriment for, and a faculty of, an indeterminate dhamma.

original: Nonatthipaccayā nahetuyā pannarasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Nonatthiyā ca, novigate ca. (Nahetupaccayasadisaṁ.)🔽Novigataduka
analyzed: nonatthi paccayāḥ na hetuyā pannarasa saṅkhitta nonatthiyā ca no vigate ca na hetu paccaya sadisa  na u vigata duka
translated: And with the condition not-disappeared, there are fifteen without cause. (Abbreviated.)

original: Novigatapaccayā nahetuyā pannarasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Noavigataduka🔽Noavigatapaccayā nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava, naadhipatiyā nava …pe… novigate nava.

translated: With the condition not-disappeared, there are fifteen without cause. (Abbreviated.)🔽With the condition not-disappeared, there are nine without object, nine without predominance, … and nine without disappearance.

original: Noavigatapaccayā …. (Noatthipaccayasadisaṁ.)🔽Pañhāvārassa paccanīyagaṇanā.
analyzed: no avigata paccayā no atthi paccaya sadisa  pañhāvārassa paccanīya gaṇanā
translated: With the condition not-disappeared, there are nine without object, nine without predominance, … and nine without disappearance.🔽The calculation of the reverse order of the section on questions.

original: 1.2.7.3. Paccayānulomapaccanīya
analyzed: paccaya anuloma paccanīya
translated: .... The reverse order of conditions in forward order

original: Hetuduka
analyzed: hetu duka
translated: The section on cause

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe satta, naadhipatiyā satta, naanantare satta, nasamanantare🔽satta, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye satta, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte satta,
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe satta na adhipatiyā satta na anantare satta na samanantare  satta na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye satta na purejāte satta na pacchājāte satta
translated: With the condition cause, there are seven without object, seven without predominance, seven without proximity, seven without contiguity,🔽seven without immediacy, three without association, seven without support, seven without foundation, seven without result, seven without nutriment, seven without root, seven without path,

original: naāsevane satta, nakamme satta, navipāke satta, naāhāre satta, naindriye satta, najhāne
analyzed: na āsevane satta na kamme satta na vipāke satta na āhāre satta na indriye satta na jhāne
translated: seven without fruition, seven without cessation, and seven without jhāna.

original: satta, namagge satta, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā satta, novigate satta.
analyzed: satta na magge satta na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā satta no vigate satta
translated: there are seven in the condition by way of faculty, there are seven in the condition by way of object, there are seven in the condition by way of root, there are seven in the condition by way of support, there are seven in the condition by way of object-predominance, there are seven in the condition by way of dissociation, there are seven in the condition by way of presence, there are seven in the condition by way of non-disappearance.

original: Hetusāmaññaghaṭanā
analyzed: hetu sāmañña ghaṭanā
translated: The Combination of Conditions

original: Hetu sahajāta nissaya atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe satta, naadhipatiyā satta, naanantare🔽satta, nasamanantare satta, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye satta, napurejāte satta,🔽napacchājāte satta, naāsevane satta, nakamme satta, navipāke satta, naāhāre satta,🔽naindriye satta, najhāne satta, namagge satta, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi,🔽nonatthiyā satta, novigate satta.
analyzed: hetu sahajāta nissaya atthi avigata nti na ārammaṇe satta na adhipatiyā satta na anantare  satta na samanantare satta na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye satta na purejāte satta  na pacchājāte satta na āsevane satta na kamme satta na vipāke satta na āhāre satta  na indriye satta na jhāne satta na magge satta na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi  nonatthiyā satta no vigate satta
translated: There are seven in the condition by way of root, by way of arising together, by way of support, by way of presence, by way of non-disappearance, but not in the condition by way of object. There are seven in the condition by way of root, by way of arising together, by way of support, by way of presence, by way of non-disappearance, by way of object-predominance, but not in the condition by way of proximity.🔽There are seven in the condition by way of root, by way of arising together, by way of support, by way of presence, by way of non-disappearance, by way of object-predominance, by way of proximity, but not in the condition by way of immediate proximity. There are seven in the condition by way of root, by way of arising together, by way of support, by way of presence, by way of non-disappearance, by way of object-predominance, by way of proximity, by way of reciprocal, but not in the condition by way of decisive support.

original: Hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissaya atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi,🔽naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte
analyzed: hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissaya atthi avigata nti na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi 🔽na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte
translated: There are seven in the condition by way of root, by way of arising together, by way of support, by way of presence, by way of non-disappearance, by way of object-predominance, by way of proximity, by way of reciprocal, by way of decisive support, but not in the condition by way of prior. There are seven in the condition by way of root, by way of arising together, by way of support, by way of presence, by way of non-disappearance, by way of object-predominance, by way of proximity, by way of reciprocal, by way of decisive support, by way of prior, but not in the condition by way of subsequent.🔽There are seven in the condition by way of root, by way of arising together, by way of support, by way of presence, by way of non-disappearance, by way of object

original: tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi, naindriye tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi na indriye tīṇi

analyzed: hetu sahajāta nissaya vipāka vippayutta atthi avigatanti na ārammaṇe eka na adhipatiyā

analyzed: na anantare eka na samanantare eka na aññamaññe eka na upanissaye eka na purejāte
translated: one, not in the immediately preceding, one, not in the same, one, not in the other, one, not in the support, one, not in the prior,

translated: In the case of object, there is one. In the case of non-disappearance, there is one. In the case of dissociation, there is one. In the case of association, there is one.

original: Ārammaṇaduka
analyzed: ārammaṇa duka
translated: In the case of object, there is one. In the case of non-disappearance, there is one. In the case of dissociation, there is one. In the case of association, there is one.

original: Ārammaṇapaccayā nahetuyā nava, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare nava, nasamanantare🔽nava, nasahajāte nava, naaññamaññe nava, nanissaye nava, naupanissaye nava, napurejāte
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayā na hetuyā nava na adhipatiyā nava na anantare nava na samanantare  nava na sahajāte nava na aññamaññe nava na nissaye nava na upanissaye nava na purejāte
translated: In the case of object, there is one. In the case of non-disappearance, there is one. In the case of dissociation, there is one. In the case of association, there is one.

original: nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme nava, navipāke nava, naāhāre nava,
analyzed: nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme nava na vipāke nava na āhāre nava
translated: In the case of object, there is one. In the case of non-disappearance, there is one. In the case of dissociation, there is one. In the case of association, there is one.

original: naindriye nava, najhāne nava, namagge nava, nasampayutte nava, navippayutte nava,
analyzed: na indriye nava na jhāne nava na magge nava na sampayutte nava na vippayutte nava
translated: In the case of object, there is one. In the case of non-disappearance, there is one. In the case of dissociation, there is one. In the case of association, there is one.🔽In the case of object, there is one. In the

original: noatthiyā nava, nonatthiyā nava, novigate nava, noavigate nava.
analyzed: no atthiyā nava no natthiyā nava no vigate nava no avigate nava
translated: There are nine in regard to not being a condition. There are nine in regard to not being a support. There are nine in regard to not being a non-support.

original: Ārammaṇaghaṭanā
analyzed: ārammaṇa ghaṭanā
translated: The Section on the Linking of Objects

original: Ārammaṇa adhipati upanissayanti nahetuyā satta, naanantare satta, nasamanantare satta,
analyzed: ārammaṇa adhipati upanissayanti na hetuyā satta na anantare satta na samanantare satta
translated: There are seven in regard to object, predominance, support, and decisive support, but not in regard to root cause. There are seven in regard to not being a preceding condition. There are seven in regard to not being a subsequent condition.

original: nasahajāte satta, naaññamaññe satta, nanissaye satta, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte🔽satta, naāsevane satta, nakamme satta, navipāke satta, naāhāre satta, naindriye satta,🔽najhāne satta, namagge satta, nasampayutte satta, navippayutte satta, noatthiyā satta,
analyzed: na sahajāte satta na aññamaññe satta na nissaye satta na purejāte satta na pacchājāte  satta na āsevane satta na kamme satta na vipāke satta na āhāre satta na indriye satta  na jhāne satta na magge satta na sampayutte satta na vippayutte satta no atthiyā satta
translated: There are seven in regard to not being a co-nascent condition. There are seven in regard to not being a mutually co-existent condition. There are seven in regard to not being a support condition. There are seven in regard to not being a prenascence condition. There are seven in regard to not being a postnascence condition.🔽There are seven in regard to not being a nutriment condition. There are seven in regard to not being a faculty condition. There are seven in regard to not being a jhāna condition. There are seven in regard to not being a path condition. There are seven in regard to not being a association condition. There are seven in regard to not being a dissociation condition. There are seven in regard to not being a presence condition.

original: nonatthiyā satta, novigate satta, noavigate satta.
analyzed: nonatthiyā satta no vigate satta no avigate satta
translated: There are seven in regard to not being a root cause condition. There are seven in regard to not being a non-root cause condition. There are seven in regard to not being a non-support condition. There are seven in regard to not being a non-non-support condition.🔽The Section on the Linking of Objects

original: Ārammaṇa purejāta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi,
analyzed: ārammaṇa purejāta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na anantare tīṇi
translated: There are three in regard to object, prenascence, presence, and non-disappearance, but not in regard to root cause. There are three in regard to predominance. There are three in regard to not being a preceding condition.

original: nasamanantare tīṇi, nasahajāte tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, nanissaye tīṇi, naupanissaye
analyzed: na samanantare tīṇi na sahajāte tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na nissaye tīṇi na upanissaye
translated: There are three in regard to not being a subsequent condition. There are three in regard to not being a co-nascent condition. There are three in regard to not being a mutually co-existent condition. There are three in regard to not being a support condition. There are three in regard to not being a decisive support condition.

original: tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi
translated: Three lines with “after” omitted. Three lines with “kamma” omitted. Three lines with “result” omitted. Three lines with “nutriment” omitted.

original: naindriye tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi,
analyzed: na aindriye tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: Three lines with “faculty” omitted. Three lines with “path” omitted. Three lines with “non-causally related” omitted. Three lines with “non-concomitant” omitted.

original: nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.🔽Ārammaṇa nissaya purejāta vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naadhipatiyā
analyzed: nonatthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi  ārammaṇa nissaya purejāta vippayutta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na adhipatiyā
translated: Three lines with “non-existent” omitted. Three lines with “non-related” omitted.🔽With “object” and “support” and “preceded” and “non-concomitant” and “exists” and “not absent”: with “not cause” three lines. With “not dominant” three lines.

original: tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, nasahajāte tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye
analyzed: tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na sahajāte tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye
translated: With “not proximity” three lines. With “not contiguity” three lines. With “not association” three lines. With “not mutuality” three lines. With “not support” three lines.

original: tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi
translated: With “not postnascence” three lines. With “not repetition” three lines. With “not kamma” three lines. With “not result” three lines. With “not nutriment” three lines.

original: naindriye tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.🔽Ārammaṇa adhipati upanissaya purejāta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naanantare
analyzed: na indriye tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi 🔽ārammaṇa adhipati upanissaya purejāta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā eka na anantare
translated: With “not faculty” three lines. With “not path” three lines. With “not concomitant” three lines. With “not existent” three lines. With “not related” three lines.🔽With “object” and “dominant” and “support” and “preceded” and “exists” and “not absent”: with “not cause” one line. With “not proximity” one line.

original: ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, nanissaye ekaṁ, napacchājāte
analyzed: na samanantare eka na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe eka na nissaye eka na pacchājāte
translated: one, not in the prior, one, not in the co-arisen, one, not in the mutually-related, one, not in the support, one, not in the post-arisen,

original: ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ,
analyzed: na āsevane eka na kamme eka na vipāke eka na āhāre eka na indriye eka
translated: one, not in the pursuit, one, not in the kamma, one, not in the result, one, not in the nutriment, one, not in the faculty,

analyzed: na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka na vippayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: one, not in the path, one, not in the associated, one, not in the dissociated, one, not in the conditionally-arisen, one, not in the incondi-tional.

original: Ārammaṇa adhipati nissaya upanissaya purejāta vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā
analyzed: ārammaṇa adhipati nissaya upanissaya purejāta vippayutta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā
translated: Object, dominant, support, decisive support, prior, dissociated, present, not absent. Not cause,

original: ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, napacchājāte
analyzed: na anantare eka na samanantare eka na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe eka na pacchājāte
translated: one, not in the prior, one, not in the co-arisen, one, not in the mutually-related, one, not in the post-arisen,

original: ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ,
analyzed: na āsevane eka na kamme eka na vipāke eka na āhāre eka na indriye eka
translated: one, not in the pursuit, one, not in the kamma, one, not in the result, one, not in the nutriment, one, not in the faculty,

original: najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.🔽Ārammaṇamūlakaṁ.
analyzed: na jhāne na magge eka na sampayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka  ārammaṇa mūlaka
translated: one, not in the path, one, not in the associated, one, not in the conditionally-arisen, one, not in the incondi-tional.🔽The section on the object.

original: Adhipatiduka
analyzed: adhipati duka
translated: The dyad on the dominant condition.

original: Adhipatipaccayā nahetuyā dasa, naārammaṇe satta, naanantare dasa, nasamanantare dasa,
analyzed: adhipati paccayā na hetuyā dasa na ārammaṇe satta na anantare dasa na samanantare dasa
translated: As to condition being dominant, there are ten in the case of not as root cause, seven in the case of not as object, ten in the case of not as proximity, ten in the case of not as contiguity,

original: nasahajāte satta, naaññamaññe aṭṭha, nanissaye satta, naupanissaye satta, napurejāte
analyzed: na sahajāte satta na aññamaññe aṭṭha na nissaye satta na upanissaye satta na purejāte
translated: seven in the case of not as mutuality, eight in the case of not as support, seven in the case of not as prenascence, seven in the case of not as postnascence,

original: dasa, napacchājāte dasa, naāsevane dasa, nakamme dasa, navipāke dasa, naāhāre dasa,🔽naindriye dasa, najhāne dasa, namagge dasa, nasampayutte aṭṭha, navippayutte satta,
analyzed: dasa na pacchājāte dasa na āsevane dasa na kamme dasa na vipāke dasa na āhāre dasa  na indriye dasa na jhāne dasa na magge dasa na sampayutte aṭṭha na vippayutte satta
translated: ten in the case of not as nutriment, ten in the case of not as faculty, ten in the case of not as jhana, ten in the case of not as path, eight in the case of not as association, seven in the case of not as non-causation,

original: noatthiyā satta, nonatthiyā dasa, novigate dasa, no avigate satta.
analyzed: no atthiyā satta no natthiyā dasa no vigate dasa no avigate satta
translated: seven in the case of not as presence, ten in the case of not as absence, ten in the case of not as disappearance, seven in the case of not as non-disappearance.

original: Adhipatimissakaghaṭanā🔽Adhipati atthi avigatanti nahetuyā aṭṭha, naārammaṇe satta, naanantare aṭṭha, nasamanantare🔽aṭṭha, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe cattāri, nanissaye ekaṁ, naupanissaye satta,
analyzed: adhipati missaka ghaṭanā  adhipati atthi avigata nti na hetuyā aṭṭha na ārammaṇe satta na anantare aṭṭha na samanantare  na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe cattāri na nissaye eka na upanissaye satta
translated: The method of combining the dominants🔽As to “when there is a dominant, and when there is no disappearance,” there are eight in the case of not as root cause, seven in the case of not as object, eight in the case of not as proximity, eight in the case of not as contiguity,🔽one in the case of not as mutuality, four in the case of not as support, one in the case of not as prenascence, seven in the case of not as postnascence,

original: napurejāte satta, napacchājāte aṭṭha, naāsevane aṭṭha, nakamme aṭṭha, navipāke aṭṭha,
analyzed: na purejāte satta na pacchājāte aṭṭha na āsevane aṭṭha na kamme aṭṭha na vipāke aṭṭha
translated: eight in the case of not as nutriment, eight in the case of not as faculty, eight in the case of not as jhana, eight in the case of not as path, eight in the case of not as association, seven in the case of not as non-causation,

original: naāhāre aṭṭha, naindriye aṭṭha, najhāne aṭṭha, namagge aṭṭha, nasampayutte cattāri,
analyzed: na āhāre aṭṭha na indriye aṭṭha na jhāne aṭṭha na magge aṭṭha na sampayutte cattāri
translated: There are eight in regard to object, eight in regard to condition, eight in regard to non-causality, eight in regard to non-deprivation.🔽There are four in regard to association, four in regard to dissociation, eight in regard to presence, eight in regard to absence.

original: navippayutte cattāri, nonatthiyā aṭṭha, novigate aṭṭha.
analyzed: na vippayutte cattāri no natthiyāḥ aṭṭha no vigate aṭṭha
translated: There are eight in regard to non-possession, eight in regard to non-disappearance.

original: Adhipati nissaya atthi avigatanti nahetuyā aṭṭha, naārammaṇe satta, naanantare aṭṭha,
analyzed: adhipati nissaya atthi avigatanti na hetuyā aṭṭha na ārammaṇe satta na anantare aṭṭha
translated: There are eight in regard to root, support, presence, and non-disappearance. There are eight in regard to non-causality, seven in regard to object, eight in regard to proximity,

original: nasamanantare aṭṭha, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe cattāri, naupanissaye satta, napurejāte
analyzed: na samanantare aṭṭha na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe cattāri na upanissaye satta na purejāte
translated: eight in regard to non-contiguity, one in regard to conascence, four in regard to mutuality, seven in regard to dependence, seven in regard to prenascence,

original: satta, napacchājāte aṭṭha, naāsevane aṭṭha, nakamme aṭṭha, navipāke aṭṭha, naāhāre🔽aṭṭha, naindriye aṭṭha, najhāne aṭṭha, namagge aṭṭha, nasampayutte cattāri, navippayutte
analyzed: satta na pacchājāte aṭṭha na āsevane aṭṭha na kamme aṭṭha na vipāke aṭṭha na āhāre  na aindriye aṭṭha na jhāne aṭṭha na magge aṭṭha na sampayutte cattāri na vippayutte
translated: eight in regard to postnascence, eight in regard to nutriment, eight in regard to faculty, eight in regard to path, eight in regard to association,

original: tīṇi, nonatthiyā aṭṭha, novigate aṭṭha.
analyzed: tīṇi nonatthiyāḥ aṭṭha no vigate aṭṭha
translated: four in regard to dissociation, three in regard to presence, eight in regard to absence, eight in regard to non-possession, eight in regard to non-disappearance.

original: Adhipati nissaya vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā cattāri, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naanantare
analyzed: adhipati nissaya vippayutta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā cattāri na ārammaṇe tīṇi na anantare
translated: There are four in regard to root, support, dissociation, presence, and non-disappearance. There are four in regard to non-causality, three in regard to object, three in regard to proximity,🔽three in regard to non-contiguity,

original: cattāri, nasamanantare cattāri, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe cattāri, naupanissaye
analyzed: cattāri na samanantare cattāri na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe cattāri na upanissaye
translated: four, in the non-concurrent, four, in the support,

original: tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte cattāri, naāsevane cattāri, nakamme cattāri,
analyzed: tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte cattāri na āsevane cattāri na kamme cattāri
translated: three, in the prenascence, three, in the postnascence, four, in the repetition, four, in the kamma, four,

original: navipāke cattāri, naāhāre cattāri, naindriye cattāri, najhāne cattāri, namagge cattāri,
analyzed: na vipāke cattāri na āhāre cattāri na aindriye cattāri na jhāne cattāri na magge cattāri
translated: in the result, four, in the nutriment, four, in the faculty, four, in the path, four,

original: nasampayutte cattāri, nonatthiyā cattāri, novigate cattāri.
analyzed: na sampayutte cattāri no natthiyā cattāri no vigate cattāri
translated: in the association, four, in the dissociation, four, in the presence, four, in the absence, four.

original: Pakiṇṇakaghaṭanā
analyzed: pakiṇṇaka ghaṭanā
translated: The Numerical Guide

original: Adhipati ārammaṇa upanissayanti nahetuyā satta, naanantare satta, nasamanantare satta,
analyzed: adhipati ārammaṇa upanissayanti na hetuyā satta na anantare satta na samanantare satta
translated: Dominant, object, support, in the non-cause, seven, in the non-antecedent, seven, in the non-conascence, seven,

original: nasahajāte satta, naaññamaññe satta, nanissaye satta, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte
analyzed: na sahajāte satta na aññamaññe satta na nissaye satta na purejāte satta na pacchājāte
translated: in the non-requital, seven, in the non-contention, seven, in the support, seven, in the prenascence, seven, in the postnascence,🔽seven, in the repetition, seven, in the kamma, seven, in the result, seven, in the nutriment, seven, in the faculty, seven,

original: satta, naāsevane satta, nakamme satta, navipāke satta, naāhāre satta, naindriye satta,
analyzed: satta na āsevane satta na kamme satta na vipāke satta na āhāre satta na indriye satta
translated: in the path, seven, in the association, seven, in the dissociation, seven, in the presence, seven, in the absence, seven,

original: najhāne satta, namagge satta, nasampayutte satta, navippayutte satta, noatthiyā satta,
analyzed: na jhāne satta na magge satta na sampayutte satta na vippayutte satta no atthiyā satta
translated: in the disappearance, seven, in the non-disappearance, seven, in the dissociation, seven, in the non-disappearance, seven.

original: nonatthiyā satta, novigate satta, noavigate satta.
analyzed: nonatthiyā satta no vigate satta no avigate satta
translated: There are seven in regard to non-root. There are seven in regard to non-goer. There are seven in regard to non-gone.

original: Adhipati ārammaṇa upanissaya purejāta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naanantare
analyzed: adhipati ārammaṇa upanissaya purejāta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā eka na anantare
translated: There is one in regard to the dominant condition, the object condition, the support condition, the prenascence condition, the presence condition, and the non-disappearance condition that is not a root cause.🔽There is one in regard to the prenascence condition that is not an immediately prior state.

original: ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, nanissaye ekaṁ, napacchājāte🔽ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ,🔽najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na samanantare eka na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe eka na nissaye eka na pacchājāte  na āsevane eka na kamme eka na vipāke eka na āhāre eka na indriye eka  na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka na vippayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: There is one in regard to the prenascence condition that is not a subsequent state. There is one in regard to the prenascence condition that is not a co-nascent state. There is one in regard to the prenascence condition that is not a mutually dependent state. There is one in regard to the prenascence condition that is not a support condition. There is one in regard to the prenascence condition that is not a postnascence condition.🔽There is one in regard to the prenascence condition that is not a repetition condition. There is one in regard to the prenascence condition that is not a kamma condition. There is one in regard to the prenascence condition that is not a result condition. There is one in regard to the prenascence condition that is not a nutriment condition. There is one in regard to the prenascence condition that is not a faculty condition.🔽There is one in regard to the prenascence condition that is not a jhāna condition. There is one in regard to the prenascence condition that is not a path condition. There is one in regard to the prenascence condition that is not a association condition. translated: The Application of the Headings of the Matrix in the case of Energy

original: Adhipati sahajāta nissaya indriya magga atthi avigatanti nahetuyā satta, naārammaṇe
analyzed: adhipati sahajāta nissaya indriya magga atthi avigata nti na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe
translated: In the case of energy, there are seven in regard to cause, there are seven in regard to object,

original: satta, naanantare satta, nasamanantare satta, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye satta,
analyzed: satta na anantare satta na samanantare satta na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye satta
translated: there are seven in regard to proximity, there are seven in regard to contiguity, there are three in regard to presence, there are seven in regard to absence,

original: napurejāte satta, napacchājāte satta, naāsevane satta, nakamme satta, navipāke satta,
analyzed: na purejāte satta na pacchājāte satta na āsevane satta na kamme satta na vipāke satta
translated: there are seven in regard to non-disappearance, there are seven in regard to arising before, there are seven in regard to arising after, there are seven in regard to arising together, there are seven in regard to kamma, there are seven in regard to result,

original: naāhāre satta, najhāne satta, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā satta, novigate satta.
analyzed: na āhāre satta na jhāne satta na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā satta no vigate satta
translated: there are seven in regard to nutriment, there are seven in regard to jhāna, there are three in regard to path, there are three in regard to presence, there are three in regard to absence, there are seven in regard to non-disappearance, there are seven in regard to non-disappearance.

original: Adhipati sahajāta aññamañña nissaya indriya magga sampayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā🔽tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte
analyzed: adhipati sahajāta aññamañña nissaya indriya magga sampayutta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā  tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte
translated: Predominance, conascence, mutuality, support, faculty, path, presence, non-disappearance, not-root,🔽three; not object, three; not proximity, three; not contiguity, three; not dependence, three; not before,

original: tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi
translated: three; not after, three; not adverting, three; not reaction, three; not result, three; not nutriment, three;

original: najhāne tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na jhāne tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: not absorption, three; not non-causality, three; not non-disappearance, three.

original: Adhipati sahajāta nissaya indriya magga vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi,
analyzed: adhipati sahajāta nissaya indriya magga vippayutta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi
translated: Predominance, conascence, support, faculty, path, dissociation, presence, non-disappearance, not-root, not-cause,

original: naārammaṇe tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye
analyzed: na ārammaṇe tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye
translated: three; not object, three; not proximity, three; not contiguity, three; not mutuality, three; not dependence,

original: tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke
analyzed: tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke
translated: three; not before, three; not after, three; not adverting, three; not reaction, three; not result, three; not

original: tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, nasampayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi. [Avipāka—3]
analyzed: tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: nutriment, three; not absorption, three; not association, three; not non-causality, three; not non-disappearance, three.

original: Adhipati sahajāta nissaya vipāka indriya magga atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe🔽ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ, napurejāte
analyzed: adhipati sahajāta nissaya vipāka indriya magga atthi avigata nti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe  na anantare eka na samanantare eka na aññamaññe eka na upanissaye eka na purejāte
translated: Predominance, conascence, support, kamma-result, faculty, path, presence, non-disappearance: not as root-cause, one; not as object, one; not as proximity, one; not as contiguity, one; not as dissociation, one; not as non-disappearance, one.

original: ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ,🔽nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.🔽Adhipati sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka indriya magga sampayutta atthi avigatanti🔽nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naupanissaye
analyzed: eka na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na āhāre eka na jhāne eka  na sampayutte eka na vippayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka  adhipati sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka indriya magga sampayutta atthi avigatanti  na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na upanissaye
translated: Predominance, conascence, mutuality, support, kamma-result, faculty, path, association, presence, non-disappearance: not as root-cause, one; not as object, one; not as proximity, one; not as contiguity, one; not as dependence, one; not as prior, one; not as post-existence, one; not as nutriment, one; not as faculty, one; not as jhana, one; not as path, one; not as non-disappearance, one.

original: ekaṁ, napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ,🔽najhāne ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na purejāte eka na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na āhāre eka 🔽na jhāne na vippayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: Predominance, conascence, mutuality, support, kamma-result, faculty, path, association, presence, non-disappearance: not as root-cause, one; not as object, one; not as proximity, one; not as dependence, one; not as prior, one; not as post-existence, one; not as nutriment, one; not as faculty, one; not as jhana, one; not as path, one; not as non-disappearance, one.

original: Adhipati sahajāta nissaya vipāka indriya magga vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā🔽ekaṁ, naārammaṇe ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, naupanissaye
analyzed: adhipati sahajāta nissaya vipāka indriya magga vippayutta atthi avigatanti na hetuyā  eka na ārammaṇe eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na aññamaññe eka na upanissaye
translated: Predominance, Conascence, Support, Kamma-Result, Faculty, Path, Dissociated, Present, not Disappeared.

original: ekaṁ, napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ,
analyzed: na purejāte eka na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na āhāre eka
translated: From not Cause one, not Object one, not Antecedent one, not Proximity one, not Conascence one, not Mutuality one, not Support one,

original: najhāne ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ. [Savipāka—3]
analyzed: na jhāne eka na sampayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: not Nutriment one, not Association one, not Dependant one, not Disappearance one, not Nurture one, not Hindrance one.

original: Vīmaṁsādhipatighaṭanā
analyzed: vīmasa adhipati ghaṭanā
translated: The Application of the Method of Eights

original: Adhipati hetu sahajāta nissaya indriya magga atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe cattāri,
analyzed: adhipati hetu sahajāta nissaya indriya magga atthi avigata nti na ārammaṇe cattāri
translated: Predominance, Cause, Conascence, Support, Faculty, Path, Present, not Disappeared.

original: naanantare cattāri, nasamanantare cattāri, naaññamaññe dve, naupanissaye cattāri,
analyzed: na anantare cattāri na samanantare cattāri na aññamaññe dve na upanissaye cattāri
translated: From not Object four, not Antecedent four, not Proximity four, not Conascence four, not Mutuality two, not Support four,

original: napurejāte cattāri, napacchājāte cattāri, naāsevane cattāri, nakamme cattāri, navipāke
analyzed: na purejāte cattāri na pacchājāte cattāri na āsevane cattāri na kamme cattāri na vipāke
translated: not Nutriment four, not Association four, not Dependant four, not Disappearance four, not Nurture four, not Hindrance four.

original: cattāri, naāhāre cattāri, najhāne cattāri, nasampayutte dve, navippayutte dve, nonatthiyā
analyzed: cattāri na āhāre cattāri na jhāne cattāri na sampayutte dve na vippayutte dve nonatthiyā
translated: four, not in relation to nutriment four, not in relation to jhāna two, not in relation to association two, not in relation to dissociation two, not in relation to presence two, not in relation to absence

original: cattāri, novigate cattāri.
analyzed: cattāri no vigate cattāri
translated: four, not in relation to arising four, not in relation to falling away four.🔽Predominance, cause, conascence, mutuality, support, faculty, path, association, present, not absent—

original: Adhipati hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissaya indriya magga sampayutta atthi avigatanti
analyzed: adhipati hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissaya indriya magga sampayutta atthi avigatanti

original: naārammaṇe dve, naanantare dve, nasamanantare dve, naupanissaye dve, napurejāte dve,🔽napacchājāte dve, naāsevane dve, nakamme dve, navipāke dve, naāhāre dve, najhāne
analyzed: na ārammaṇe dve na anantare dve na samanantare dve na upanissaye dve na purejāte dve  na pacchājāte dve na āsevane dve na kamme dve na vipāke dve na āhāre dve na jhāne
translated: two, in relation to path two, in relation to association two, in relation to dissociation two, in relation to presence two, in relation to absence two, in relation to non-disappearance two, in relation to arising two,

original: dve, navippayutte dve, nonatthiyā dve, novigate dve.
analyzed: dve na vippayutte dve no natthiyā dve no vigate dve
translated: in relation to falling away two, in relation to arising together two, in relation to dissolution two, in relation to change two.

original: Adhipati hetu sahajāta nissaya indriya magga vippayutta atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe🔽dve, naanantare dve, nasamanantare dve, naaññamaññe dve, naupanissaye dve, napurejāte
analyzed: adhipati hetu sahajāta nissaya indriya magga vippayutta atthi avigata nti na ārammaṇe  dve na anantare dve na samanantare dve na aññamaññe dve na upanissaye dve na purejāte
translated: Predominance, cause, conascence, support, faculty, path, dissociation, present, not absent—in relation to object🔽two, in relation to proximity two, in relation to presence two, in relation to absence two, in relation to non-disappearance two, in relation to arising two,🔽in relation to falling away two, in relation to arising together two, in relation to dissolution two, in relation to change two, in relation to action two, in relation to result two, in relation to nutriment two, in relation to jhāna

original: dve, napacchājāte dve, naāsevane dve, nakamme dve, navipāke dve, naāhāre dve, najhāne
analyzed: dve na pacchājāte dve na āsevane dve na kamme dve na vipāke dve na āhāre dve na jhāne
translated: two, in relation to path two, in relation to association two, in relation to dissociation two, in relation to presence two, in relation to absence two, in relation to non-disappearance two, in relation to arising two,🔽in relation to falling away two, in relation to arising together two, in relation to dissolution two, in relation to change two, in relation to action two, in relation to result two, in relation to nutriment two, in relation to jhāna🔽two, in relation to path two, in relation to association two, in relation to dissociation two, in relation to presence two, in relation to absence two, in relation to non-disappearance two, in relation to arising two,🔽in relation to falling away two, in

original: dve, nasampayutte dve, nonatthiyā dve, novigate dve. [Avipāka—3]🔽Adhipati hetu sahajāta nissaya vipāka indriya magga atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe ekaṁ,🔽naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ, napurejāte🔽ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ,🔽nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: dve na sampayutte dve no natthiyā dve no vigate dve  adhipati hetu sahajāta nissaya vipāka indriya magga atthi avigata nti na ārammaṇe eka  na anantare eka na samanantare eka na aññamaññe eka na upanissaye eka na purejāte  eka na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na āhāre eka na jhāne eka  na sampayutte eka na vippayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: two, as non-concomitant, two, as not object, two, as not adverting. [Non-Resultant,]

analyzed: adhipati hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka indriya magga sampayutta atthi avigatanti  na ārammaṇe eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na upanissaye eka na purejāte  eka na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na āhāre eka na jhāne eka
