original: Adhipati hetu sahajāta nissaya vipāka indriya magga vippayutta atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe🔽ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ, napurejāte
analyzed: adhipati hetu sahajāta nissaya vipāka indriya magga vippayutta atthi avigata nti na ārammaṇe  na anantare eka na samanantare eka na aññamaññe eka na upanissaye eka na purejāte
translated: Predominant cause, conascence, support, kamma result, faculty, path, non-conjoined, present, not absent.🔽In the non-object, there is one. In the non-antecedent, there is one. In the non-conascence, there is one. In the non-reciprocal, there is one. In the non-support, there is one.

original: ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ,
analyzed: eka na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na āhāre eka na jhāne eka
translated: In the non-preceded, there is one. In the non-succeeded, there is one. In the non-consistence, there is one. In the non-kamma, there is one. In the non-nutritive, there is one. In the non-jhāna, there is one.

original: nasampayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ. [Savipāka—3]
analyzed: na sampayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: In the non-conjoined, there is one. In the non-requisite, there is one. In the non-deprivation, there is one. [With kamma result—]

original: Adhipatimūlakaṁ.
analyzed: adhipati mūlaka
translated: Predominant cause.

original: Anantaraduka
analyzed: anantara duka
translated: The section on the immediate

original: Anantarapaccayā nahetuyā satta, naārammaṇe satta, naadhipatiyā satta, nasahajāte
analyzed: anantara paccayā na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe satta na adhipatiyā satta na sahajāte
translated: In the condition by way of the immediate antecedent, there are seven in the non-cause, seven in the non-object, seven in the non-predominant, seven in the non-conascence,

original: satta, naaññamaññe satta, nanissaye satta, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte satta,
analyzed: satta na aññamaññe satta na nissaye satta na purejāte satta na pacchājāte satta
translated: seven in the non-reciprocal, seven in the non-support, seven in the non-preceded, seven in the non-succeeded,

original: naāsevane pañca, nakamme satta, navipāke satta, naāhāre satta, naindriye satta, najhāne
analyzed: na āsevane pañca na kamme satta na vipāke satta na āhāre satta na indriye satta na jhāne
translated: five in the non-consistence, seven in the non-kamma, seven in the non-kamma-result, seven in the non-nutritive, seven in the non-faculty, seven in the non-jhāna,

original: satta, namagge satta, nasampayutte satta, navippayutte satta, noatthiyā satta, noavigate satta.
analyzed: satta na magge satta na sampayutte satta na vippayutte satta no atthiyā satta no avigate satta
translated: seven, in the cognitive process seven, in association seven, in dissociation seven, in dependence seven, in the non-cognizables seven.

original: Anantaraghaṭanā
analyzed: anantara ghaṭanā
translated: The method of connection by way of the immediate antecedent

original: Anantara samanantara upanissaya natthi vigatanti nahetuyā satta, naārammaṇe satta,
analyzed: anantara samanantara upanissaya natthi vigata nti na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe satta
translated: In the absence of the root cause, there are seven in the immediate antecedent condition, in the proximity condition, in the support condition, in the absence, in the disappearance.🔽In the absence of the object, there are seven.🔽In the absence of the predominance, there are seven.🔽In the absence of the conascence, there are seven.🔽In the absence of the mutuality, there are seven.

original: naadhipatiyā satta, nasahajāte satta, naaññamaññe satta, nanissaye satta, napurejāte
analyzed: na adhipatiyā satta na sahajāte satta na aññamaññe satta na nissaye satta na purejāte
translated: In the absence of the dependence, there are seven.🔽In the absence of the prenascence, there are seven.🔽In the absence of the postnascence, there are seven.🔽In the absence of the repetition, there are five.🔽In the absence of the kamma, there are seven.🔽In the absence of the result, there are seven.

original: satta, napacchājāte satta, naāsevane pañca, nakamme satta, navipāke satta, naāhāre
analyzed: satta na pacchājāte satta na āsevane pañca na kamme satta na vipāke satta na āhāre
translated: In the absence of nutriment, there are seven.🔽In the absence of the faculty, there are seven.🔽In the absence of the jhāna, there are seven.🔽In the absence of the path, there are seven.🔽In the absence of association, there are seven.

original: satta, naindriye satta, najhāne satta, namagge satta, nasampayutte satta, navippayutte
analyzed: satta na indriye satta na jhāne satta na magge satta na sampayutte satta na vippayutte
translated: In the absence of dissociation, there are seven.🔽In the absence of the support, there are seven.

original: satta, noatthiyā satta, noavigate satta.
analyzed: satta no atthiyā satta no avigate satta
translated: In the absence of the non-cognizables, there are seven.

original: Anantara samanantara upanissaya āsevana natthi vigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe
analyzed: anantara samanantara upanissaya āsevana natthi vigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe
translated: In the absence of the root cause, there are three in the immediate antecedent condition, in the proximity condition, in the support condition, in the repetition condition, in the absence, in the disappearance.🔽In the absence of the object, there are three.🔽In the absence of the predominance, there are three.🔽In the absence of the conascence, there are three.🔽In the absence of the mutuality, there are three.

original: tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, nasahajāte tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, nanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte
analyzed: tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na sahajāte tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na nissaye tīṇi na purejāte
translated: In the absence of the dependence, there are three.🔽In the absence of the prenascence, there are three.

original: tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi, naindriye tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi na aindriye tīṇi
translated: Three, not in post-nascence, three, not in kamma, three, not in result, three, not in nutriment, three, not in faculty,

original: najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi, noatthiyā tīṇi, noavigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi no atthiyā tīṇi no avigate tīṇi
translated: three, not in jhāna, three, not in path, three, not in association, three, not in dissociation, three, not in presence, three, not in absence, three.

original: Anantara samanantara upanissaya kamma natthi vigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe🔽ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, nanissaye ekaṁ, napurejāte
analyzed: anantara samanantara upanissaya kamma natthi vigatanti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe  na adhipatiyā eka na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe eka na nissaye eka na purejāte
translated: In the section on the root cause, in the section on the condition being immediate antecedent, in the section on the condition being support, in the section on the condition being kamma, in the section on the condition being absence, there is one, not in cause,

original: ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, navipāke ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ,
analyzed: na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na vipāke eka na āhāre eka na aindriye eka
translated: one, not in object, one, not in predominance, one, not in association, one, not in mutuality, one, not in dependence, one, not in arising before,🔽one, not in arising together, one, not in post-nascence, one, not in repetition, one, not in result, one, not in nutriment, one, not in faculty,

original: najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ, noatthiyā ekaṁ, noavigate ekaṁ.🔽Anantaramūlakaṁ.
analyzed: na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka na vippayutte eka no atthiyāḥ eka no avigate eka  anantara mūlaka
translated: one, not in jhāna, one, not in path, one, not in association, one, not in dissociation, one, not in presence, one, not in absence.🔽The section on the root cause is finished.

original: Samanantaraduka
analyzed: samanantara duka
translated: The section on the condition being immediate antecedent

original: Samanantarapaccayā nahetuyā satta, naārammaṇe satta, naadhipatiyā satta, nasahajāte
analyzed: samanantara paccayā na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe satta na adhipatiyā satta na sahajāte
translated: In the section on the condition being immediate antecedent, there are seven, not in cause, seven, not in object, seven, not in predominance, seven, not in association,

original: satta, naaññamaññe satta, nanissaye satta, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte satta,
analyzed: satta na aññamaññe satta na nissaye satta na purejāte satta na pacchājāte satta
translated: seven, not with another seven, not with a condition seven, not with prior seven, not with subsequent seven,

original: naāsevane pañca, nakamme satta, navipāke satta, naāhāre satta, naindriye satta, najhāne
analyzed: na āsevane pañca na kamme satta na vipāke satta na āhāre satta na indriye satta na jhāne
translated: not with development five, not with action seven, not with result seven, not with nutriment seven, not with faculty seven, not with jhāna

original: satta, namagge satta, nasampayutte satta, navippayutte satta, noatthiyā satta, noavigate satta.
analyzed: satta na magge satta na sampayutte satta na vippayutte satta no atthiyā satta no avigate satta
translated: seven, not with path seven, not with association seven, not with dissociation seven, not with presence seven, not with absence seven.

original: Samanantaraghaṭanā🔽Samanantara anantara upanissaya natthi vigatanti nahetuyā satta, naārammaṇe satta,🔽naadhipatiyā satta, nasahajāte satta, naaññamaññe satta, nanissaye satta, napurejāte🔽satta, napacchājāte satta, naāsevane pañca, nakamme satta, navipāke satta, naāhāre🔽satta, naindriye satta, najhāne satta, namagge satta, nasampayutte satta, navippayutte
analyzed: samanantara ghaṭanā  samanantara anantara upanissaya natthi vigata nti na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe satta  na adhipatiyā satta na sahajāte satta na aññamaññe satta na nissaye satta na purejāte  satta na pacchājāte satta na āsevane pañca na kamme satta na vipāke satta na āhāre  satta na indriye satta na jhāne satta na magge satta na sampayutte satta na vippayutte
translated: The method of combining the sections on “immediately before”

original: satta, noatthiyā satta, noavigate satta.
analyzed: satta no atthiyā satta no avigate satta
translated: Immediately before, immediately before, and decisive support, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not, not,

original: Samanantara anantara upanissaya āsevana natthi vigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe🔽tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, nasahajāte tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, nanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte
analyzed: samanantara anantara upanissaya āsevana natthi vigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe  tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na sahajāte tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na nissaye tīṇi na purejāte
translated: With the condition being prior and proximate, and the condition being decisive support, and the condition being presence, and the condition being absence, there are three possibilities with respect to the cause condition.🔽With the condition being object, there are three possibilities.🔽With the condition being predominance, there are three possibilities. With the condition being conascence, there are three possibilities. With the condition being mutuality, there are three possibilities. With the condition being support, there are three possibilities. With the condition being prenascence, there are three possibilities.

original: tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi, naindriye tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi na aindriye tīṇi
translated: With the condition being postnascence, there are three possibilities. With the condition being kamma, there are three possibilities. With the condition being ripening, there are three possibilities. With the condition being nutriment, there are three possibilities. With the condition being faculty, there are three possibilities.

original: najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi, noatthiyā tīṇi, noavigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi no atthiyā tīṇi no avigate tīṇi
translated: With the condition being jhāna, there are three possibilities. With the condition being path, there are three possibilities. With the condition being association, there are three possibilities. With the condition being dissociation, there are three possibilities. With the condition being presence, there are three possibilities. With the condition being non-disappearance, there are three possibilities.

original: Samanantara anantara upanissaya kamma natthi vigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe🔽ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, nanissaye ekaṁ, napurejāte
analyzed: samanantara anantara upanissaya kamma natthi vigatanti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe  na adhipatiyā eka na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe eka na nissaye eka na purejāte
translated: With the condition being prior and proximate, and the condition being decisive support, and the condition being kamma, and the condition being absence, there is one possibility with respect to the cause condition.🔽With the condition being object, there is one possibility.🔽With the condition being predominance, there is one possibility. With the condition being conascence, there is one possibility. With the condition being mutuality, there is one possibility. With the condition being support, there is one possibility. With the condition being prenascence, there is one possibility.

original: ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, navipāke ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ,
analyzed: na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na vipāke eka na āhāre eka na aindriye eka
translated: With the condition being postnascence, there is one possibility. With the condition being nutriment, there is one possibility. With the condition being faculty, there is one possibility. With the condition being jhāna, there is one possibility. With the condition being path, there is one possibility. With the condition being association, there is one possibility. With the condition being dissociation, there is one possibility. With the condition being presence, there is one possibility. With the condition being non-disappearance, there is one possibility.

original: najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ, noatthiyā ekaṁ, noavigate ekaṁ.🔽Samanantaramūlakaṁ.
analyzed: na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka na vippayutte eka no atthiyāḥ eka no avigate eka  samanantara mūlaka
translated: in non-resolve, one; in non-path, one; in non-concomitant, one; in non-deprivation, one; in non-obtainment, one.🔽With respect to the section on “immediately preceding,”

original: Sahajātaduka
analyzed: sahajāta duka
translated: The dyad on “arisen together”

original: Sahajātapaccayā nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare nava,
analyzed: sahajāta paccayā na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava na adhipatiyā nava na anantare nava
translated: As condition arisen together, not as root cause, nine; not as object, nine; not as predominance, nine; not as proximity, nine;

original: nasamanantare nava, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye nava, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte🔽nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme nava, navipāke nava, naāhāre nava, naindriye nava,
analyzed: na samanantare nava na aññamaññe pañca na upanissaye nava na purejāte nava na pacchājāte  nava na āsevane nava na kamme nava na vipāke nava na āhāre nava na indriye nava
translated: not as contiguity, nine; not as mutual, five; not as support, nine; not as decisive support, nine; not as postnascence, nine;

original: najhāne nava, namagge nava, nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā nava, novigate nava.
analyzed: na jhāne nava na magge nava na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyāḥ nava no vigate nava
translated: not as nutriment, nine; not as faculty, nine; not as jhāna, nine; not as path, nine; not as association, five; not as non-disappearance, nine; not as disappearance, nine.

original: Sahajātaghaṭanā
analyzed: sahajāta ghaṭanā
translated: The combination of “arisen together” and “support”

original: Sahajāta nissaya atthi avigatanti nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava, naadhipatiyā nava,
analyzed: sahajāta nissaya atthi avigatanti na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava na adhipatiyā nava
translated: Arisen together and support, there is, not as root cause, nine; not as object, nine; not as predominance, nine;

original: naanantare nava, nasamanantare nava, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye nava …pe… namagge
analyzed: na anantare nava na samanantare nava na aññamaññe pañca na upanissaye nava pe na magge
translated: not as proximity, nine; not as contiguity, nine; not as mutual, five; not as decisive support, nine; not as path, nine;

original: nava, nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā nava, novigate nava.
analyzed: nava na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā nava no vigate nava
translated: Nine, in the non-conjoined five, in the non-disjoined three, in the not-not three, in the non-gone nine.

original: Sahajāta aññamañña nissaya atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā
analyzed: sahajāta aññamañña nissaya atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā
translated: In the conjoined, in the mutually-related, in the support, in the existent, in the not-disappeared there are three, in the object three, in the predominance three,

original: tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte🔽tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi, naindriye tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte  tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi na indriye tīṇi
translated: in the proximate three, in the not-proximate three, in the support-originated three, in the prenascent three, in the postnascent three,🔽in the nutriment three, in the action three, in the kamma-result three, in the faculty three,

original: najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.🔽Sahajāta aññamañña nissaya sampayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe
analyzed: na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte eka na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi  sahajāta aññamañña nissaya sampayutta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe
translated: in the path three, in the conjoined one, in the disjoined three, in the not-not three, in the non-gone three.

original: tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi
translated: In the conjoined, in the mutually-related, in the support, in the object, in the predominance, in the proximate, in the not-proximate, in the support-originated, in the prenascent, in the postnascent,🔽in the nutriment, in the action, in the kamma-result, in the faculty,

original: napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi,
analyzed: na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi
translated: in the path, in the conjoined one, in the disjoined three, in the not-not three, in the non-gone three.

original: naāhāre tīṇi, naindriye tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā
analyzed: na āhāre tīṇi na indriye tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā
translated: There are three lines for nutriment, three for faculty, three for path, three for non-causally related, three for not causally related,

original: tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: tīṇi na u vigate tīṇi
translated: and three for not causally related and not causally related.🔽There are three lines for the conascence, support, and non-causally related, and not causally related and not causally related.

original: Sahajāta nissaya vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā
analyzed: sahajāta nissaya vippayutta atthi avigatanti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā
translated: There are three lines for the object, dominance, and not causally related, and not causally related and not causally related.

original: tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte
analyzed: tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte
translated: There are three lines for the proximity, contiguity, and not causally related, and not causally related and not causally related.🔽There are three lines for the support, and not causally related, and not causally related and not causally related.

original: tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi
translated: There are three lines for the prenascence, postnascence, and not causally related, and not causally related and not causally related.🔽There are three lines for the nutriment, faculty, and not causally related, and not causally related and not causally related.🔽There are three lines for the path, and not causally related, and not causally related and not causally related.🔽There are three lines for the association, and not causally related, and not causally related and not causally related.🔽There are three lines for the not causally related and not causally related and not causally related.

original: naindriye tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na indriye tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: There are three lines for the conascence, mutuality, support, and non-causally related, and not causally related and not causally related.🔽There is one line for the object, and not causally related, and not causally related and not causally related.🔽There is one line for the dominance, and not causally related, and not causally related and not causally related.🔽There is one line for the proximity, and not causally related, and not causally related and not causally related.

original: Sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe🔽ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ,
analyzed: sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vippayutta atthi avigatanti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe 🔽na adhipatiyā eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na upanissaye eka
translated: There is one line for the contiguity, and not causally related, and not causally related and not causally related.

original: napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke ekaṁ,
analyzed: na purejāte na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na vipāke eka
translated: there is one in the past and future, one in the past and present, one in the future and present, and one in the past, future and present.

original: naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā
analyzed: na āhāre na indriye eka na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka no natthiyām
translated: There is one in the non-causative action, one in the non-result, one in the non-nutritive-essence, one in the non-faculty, one in the non-absorption, one in the non-path, one in the non-association, one in the non-disappearance,

original: ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ. [Avipāka—5]
analyzed: eka
translated: and one in the non-culmination.

original: Sahajāta nissaya vipāka atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, na ārammaṇe ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā🔽ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ, napurejāte
analyzed: sahajāta nissaya vipāka atthi avigata nti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe eka na adhipatiyā  na anantare eka na samanantare eka na aññamaññe eka na upanissaye eka na purejāte
translated: In the joint production, support, and result, there is one in the absence of cause, one in the absence of object, one in the absence of predominance,🔽one in the absence of proximity, one in the absence of contiguity, one in the absence of association, one in the absence of support, one in the absence of presence,

original: ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ,
analyzed: na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na āhāre eka na indriye eka
translated: one in the absence of post-nascence, one in the absence of nutriment, one in the absence of faculty, one in the absence of absorption,

original: najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka na vippayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: one in the absence of path, one in the absence of association, one in the absence of dissociation, one in the absence of disappearance, and one in the absence of culmination.

original: Sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe ekaṁ,
analyzed: sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka atthi avigata nti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe eka
translated: In the joint production, mutual dependence, support, and result, there is one in the absence of cause, one in the absence of object,

original: naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ, napurejāte🔽ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ,
analyzed: na adhipatiyā eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na upanissaye eka na purejāte  na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na āhāre eka na indriye eka
translated: Not as dominant condition, one. Not as prenascence, one. Not as postnascence, one. Not as repetition, one.🔽Not as nutriment, one. Not as faculty, one.

original: najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.🔽Sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka sampayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe🔽ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ,
analyzed: na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka na vippayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka  sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka sampayutta atthi avigatanti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe  na adhipatiyā eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na upanissaye eka
translated: Not as path, one. Not as association, one. Not as dissociation, one. Not as presence, one. Not as absence, one.🔽Conascence, mutuality, support, nutriment, faculty, jhāna, path, association, presence, absence, non-disappearance, non-degeneration,

original: napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye🔽ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na purejāte na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na āhāre eka na indriye  na jhāne eka na magge eka na vippayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: Conascence, mutuality, dependence, result, association, presence, non-disappearance, non-degeneration,

original: Sahajāta nissaya vipāka vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe ekaṁ,
analyzed: sahajāta nissaya vipāka vippayutta atthi avigatanti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe eka
translated: Conascence, dependence, result, dissociation, presence, non-disappearance, non-degeneration,

original: naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, naupanissaye🔽ekaṁ, napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ,
analyzed: na adhipatiyā eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na aññamaññe eka na upanissaye  na purejāte eka na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na āhāre eka
translated: Not as dominant, one. Not as prenascence, one. Not as postnascence, one. Not as mutuality, one.🔽Not as support, one. Not as prior, one. Not as subsequent, one. Not as repetition, one. Not as kamma, one. Not as nutriment, one.

original: naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na indriye eka na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: Not as faculty, one. Not as path, one. Not as association, one. Not as presence, one. Not as absence, one.

original: Sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe🔽ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ,🔽napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye
analyzed: sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka vippayutta atthi avigatanti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe  na adhipatiyā eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na upanissaye eka  na purejāte na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na āhāre eka na indriye
translated: Conascence, mutuality, support, result, dissociation, presence, absence. Not as root cause, one. Not as object,🔽one. Not as dominant, one. Not as prenascence, one. Not as postnascence, one. Not as mutuality, one. Not as support, one.🔽Not as prior, one. Not as subsequent, one. Not as repetition, one. Not as kamma, one. Not as nutriment, one. Not as faculty,

original: ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ. [Savipāka—5]🔽Sahajātamūlakaṁ.
analyzed: na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: one. Not as path, one. Not as association, one. Not as presence, one. Not as absence, one. [With Result]🔽The section on conascence.

original: Aññamaññaduka
analyzed: aññam añña duka
translated: The section on mutuality.

original: Aññamaññapaccayā nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi,
analyzed: aññamañña paccayāḥ na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na anantare tīṇi
translated: With the condition being mutual: there are three (instances) with the condition being not a root cause, there are three (instances) with the condition being not an object, there are three (instances) with the condition being not predominance, there are three (instances) with the condition being not proximity,

original: nasamanantare tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane🔽tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi, naindriye tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge
analyzed: na samanantare tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane  tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi na indriye tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge
translated: there are three (instances) with the condition being not contiguity, there are three (instances) with the condition being not support, there are three (instances) with the condition being not prenascence, there are three (instances) with the condition being not postnascence, there are three (instances) with the condition being not nutriment,🔽there are three (instances) with the condition being not action, there are three (instances) with the condition being not result, there are three (instances) with the condition being not nutriment, there are three (instances) with the condition being not faculty, there are three (instances) with the condition being not absorption, there are three (instances) with the condition being not path,

original: tīṇi, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: tīṇi na sampayutte na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: there is one (instance) with the condition being not association, there are three (instances) with the condition being not non-association, there are three (instances) with the condition being not presence, there are three (instances) with the condition being not absence.

original: Aññamaññaghaṭanā
analyzed: aññamañña ghaṭanā
translated: Mutual Combination

original: Aññamañña sahajāta nissaya atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā
analyzed: aññamañña sahajāta nissaya atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā
translated: With the condition being mutual, being conascent, support, there is, there is no absence: with the condition being not a root cause there are three (instances), with the condition being not an object there are three (instances), with the condition being not predominance

original: tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte🔽tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi, naindriye tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte 🔽tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi na indriye tīṇi
translated: there are three (instances), with the condition being not proximity there are three (instances), with the condition being not contiguity there are three (instances), with the condition being not support there are three (instances), with the condition being not prenascence there are three (instances), with the condition being not postnascence🔽there are three (instances), with the condition being not nutriment there are three (instances), with the condition being not action there are three (instances), with the condition being not result there are three (instances), with the condition being not nutriment there are three (instances), with the condition being not faculty there are three (instances),

original: najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.🔽Aññamañña sahajāta nissaya sampayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe
analyzed: na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte eka na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi  aññamañña sahajāta nissaya sampayutta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe
translated: In regard to non-root cause, there are three; in regard to non-path, there are three; in regard to non-association, there is one; in regard to non-dissociation, there are three; in regard to non-deprivation, there are three; in regard to non-overt action, there are three.

original: tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi,🔽napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi  na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi
translated: In regard to mutual dependence, co-nascence, dependence, association, presence, and non-disappearance, in regard to non-root cause, there are three; in regard to non-object, there are three; in regard to non-predominance, there are three; in regard to non-antecedent, there are three; in regard to non-conascence, there are three; in regard to non-support, there are three;🔽in regard to non-decisive support, there are three; in regard to non-result, there are three; in regard to non-concomitant, there are three; in regard to non-kamma, there are three; in regard to non-kamma-result, there are three;

original: naāhāre tīṇi, naindriye tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā
analyzed: na āhāre tīṇi na indriye tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā
translated: in regard to non-nutriment, there are three; in regard to non-faculty, there are three; in regard to non-path, there are three; in regard to non-dissociation, there are three; in regard to non-deprivation, there are three;

original: tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.🔽Aññamañña sahajāta nissaya vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe🔽ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ,
analyzed: tīṇi na u vigate tīṇi  aññamañña sahajāta nissaya vippayutta atthi avigatanti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe  na adhipatiyā eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na upanissaye eka
translated: in regard to non-overt action, there are three.🔽In regard to mutual dependence, co-nascence, dependence, dissociation, presence, and non-disappearance, in regard to non-root cause, there is one; in regard to non-object, there is one; in regard to non-predominance, there is one; in regard to non-antecedent, there is one; in regard to non-conascence, there is one; in regard to non-support, there is one;🔽in regard to non-decisive support, there is one; in regard to non-result, there is one; in regard to non-concomitant, there is one; in regard to non-kamma, there is one; in regard to non-kamma-result, there is one;

original: napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke ekaṁ,
analyzed: na purejāte na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na vipāke eka
translated: in regard to non-nutriment, there is one; in regard to non-faculty, there is one; in regard to non-path, there is one;

original: naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā
analyzed: na āhāre na indriye eka na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka no natthiyām
translated: not in nutriment, not in faculty, not in jhāna, not in path, not in association, not in non-disappearance,

original: ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ. [Avipāka—3]
analyzed: eka
translated: not in appearance.

original: Aññamañña sahajāta nissaya vipāka atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe ekaṁ,🔽naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ, napurejāte
analyzed: aññamañña sahajāta nissaya vipāka atthi avigata nti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe eka  na adhipatiyā eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na upanissaye eka na purejāte
translated: With the condition being mutual, conascence, dependence, and result, there is the state of not being dissociated. Not in cause, not in object,🔽not in predominance, not in proximity, not in contiguity, not in dependence, not in arising before,

original: ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ,
analyzed: na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na āhāre eka na indriye eka
translated: not in arising later, not in repetition, not in action, not in nutriment, not in faculty,

original: najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka na vippayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: not in jhāna, not in path, not in association, not in non-disappearance, not in disappearance.

original: Aññamañña sahajāta nissaya vipāka sampayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe
analyzed: aññamañña sahajāta nissaya vipāka sampayutta atthi avigatanti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe
translated: With the condition being mutual, conascence, dependence, result, association, and the state of not being dissociated. Not in cause, not in object,

original: ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ,
analyzed: na adhipatiyā eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na upanissaye eka
translated: not in predominance, not in proximity, not in contiguity, not in dependence,

original: napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye
analyzed: na purejāte na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na āhāre eka na indriye
translated: there is one (kind of) non-arising, there is one (kind of) post-arising, there is one (kind of) non-practice, there is one (kind of) action, there is one (kind of) nutriment, there is one (kind of) faculty,

original: ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na jhāne eka na magge eka na vippayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: In regard to the future, there is one. In regard to the past and the future, there is one. In regard to the prenascent, there is one. In regard to the postnascent, there is one. In regard to the prenascent and the postnascent, there is one. In regard to the action, there is one. In regard to the nutriment, there is one. In regard to the faculty, there is one. In regard to the jhāna, there is one. In regard to the path, there is one. In regard to the unassociated, there is one. In regard to the non-existent, there is one. In regard to the past and the unassociated, there is one. In regard to the future and the unassociated, there is one. In regard to the past and the future and the unassociated, there is one.

original: Aññamañña sahajāta nissaya vipāka vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe🔽ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ,🔽napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye🔽ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ. [Savipāka—3]
analyzed: aññamañña sahajāta nissaya vipāka vippayutta atthi avigatanti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe  na adhipatiyā eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na upanissaye eka  na purejāte na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na āhāre eka na indriye  na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: In regard to the mutually-related, the conascent, the support, the result, and the unassociated, there is one. In regard to the non-existent, there is one. In regard to the past and the non-existent, there is one. In regard to the future and the non-existent, there is one. In regard to the past and the future and the non-existent, there is one.

original: Aññamaññamūlakaṁ.
analyzed: aññamaññamūlaka
translated: In regard to the cause and the non-existent, there is one. In regard to the object and the non-existent, there is one. In regard to the predominance and the non-existent, there is one. In regard to the antecedent and the non-existent, there is one. In regard to the proximity and the non-existent, there is one. In regard to the contiguity and the non-existent, there is one. In regard to the condition and the non-existent, there is one. In regard to the arising and the non-existent, there is one. In regard to the dissolution and the non-existent, there is one. In regard to the state of presence and the non-existent, there is one. In regard to the past and the future and the non-existent, there is one. In regard to the past and the future and the unassociated and the non-existent, there is one.🔽[The section on] the mutually-related is finished.

original: Nissayaduka
analyzed: nissaya duka
translated: The section on the support

original: Nissayapaccayā nahetuyā terasa, naārammaṇe terasa, naadhipatiyā terasa, naanantare
analyzed: nissaya paccayāḥ na hetuyā terasa na ārammaṇe terasa na adhipatiyā terasa na anantare
translated: In regard to the support condition, there are thirteen in regard to the cause, thirteen in regard to the object,

original: terasa, nasamanantare terasa, nasahajāte tīṇi, naaññamaññe satta, naupanissaye terasa,🔽napurejāte nava, napacchājāte terasa, naāsevane terasa, nakamme terasa, navipāke
analyzed: terasa na samanantare terasa na sahajāte tīṇi na aññamaññe satta na upanissaye terasa  na purejāte nava na pacchājāte terasa na āsevane terasa na kamme terasa na vipāke
translated: with thirteen in the non-concomitant, thirteen in the post-nascence, thirteen in the absence, and thirteen in the non-disappearance.🔽With nine in the pre-birth, thirteen in the post-birth, thirteen in the presence, thirteen in the action,

original: terasa, naāhāre terasa, naindriye terasa, najhāne terasa, namagge terasa, nasampayutte
analyzed: terasa na āhāre terasa na aindriye terasa na jhāne terasa na magge terasa na sampayutte
translated: thirteen in the result, thirteen in the nutriment, thirteen in the faculty, thirteen in the path, thirteen in the association,

original: satta, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā terasa, novigate terasa.
analyzed: satta na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā terasa no vigate terasa
translated: seven in the dissociation, three in the absence, and thirteen in the disappearance.

original: Nissayamissakaghaṭanā🔽Nissaya atthi avigatanti nahetuyā terasa, naārammaṇe terasa, naadhipatiyā terasa,
analyzed: nissaya missaka ghaṭanā  nissaya atthi avigatanti na hetuyā terasa na ārammaṇe terasa na adhipatiyā terasa
translated: The Combination of the Requisites and the Conditions🔽With thirteen in the condition being present and not absent, thirteen in the object, thirteen in the predominance,

original: naanantare terasa, nasamanantare terasa, nasahajāte tīṇi, naaññamaññe satta, naupanissaye
analyzed: na anantare terasa na samanantare terasa na sahajāte tīṇi na aññamaññe satta na upanissaye
translated: thirteen in the proximity, thirteen in the non-deprivation, three in the association, seven in the dissociation, thirteen in the support,

original: terasa, napurejāte nava, na pacchājāte terasa, naāsevane terasa, nakamme terasa,🔽navipāke terasa, naāhāre terasa, naindriye terasa, najhāne terasa, namagge terasa,
analyzed: terasa na purejāte nava na pacchājāte terasa na āsevane terasa na kamme terasa 🔽na vipāke terasa na āhāre terasa na aindriye terasa na jhāne terasa na magge terasa
translated: nine in the pre-birth, thirteen in the post-birth, thirteen in the presence, thirteen in the action,🔽thirteen in the result, thirteen in the nutriment, thirteen in the faculty, thirteen in the path,

original: nasampayutte satta, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā terasa, novigate terasa.🔽Nissaya adhipati atthi avigatanti nahetuyā aṭṭha, naārammaṇe satta, naanantare aṭṭha,
analyzed: na sampayutte satta na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā terasa no vigate terasa  nissaya adhipati atthi avigatanti na hetuyā aṭṭha na ārammaṇe satta na anantare aṭṭha
translated: there are seven in the non-concomitant, three in the non-disappeared, thirteen in the non-culminated.🔽There are eight in the support and the dominant condition that are present and not absent. In the non-cause there are eight, in the non-object there are seven, in the non-antecedent there are eight,

original: nasamanantare aṭṭha, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe cattāri, naupanissaye satta, napurejāte
analyzed: na samanantare aṭṭha na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe cattāri na upanissaye satta na purejāte
translated: in the non-consequent there are eight, in the non-conascent there is one, in the non-requiring there are four, in the non-supported there are seven, in the non-arisen there are

analyzed: tīṇi nonatthiyāḥ aṭṭha no vigate aṭṭha
translated: there are three, in the non-disappeared there are eight, in the non-culminated there are eight.

original: Nissaya indriya atthi avigatanti nahetuyā satta, naārammaṇe satta, naadhipatiyā satta,
analyzed: nissaya indriya atthi avigatanti na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe satta na adhipatiyā satta
translated: There are seven in the support and the faculty that are present and not absent. In the non-cause there are seven, in the non-object there are seven, in the non-dominant there are seven,

analyzed: na anantare satta na samanantare satta na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye

analyzed: satta na purejāte satta na pacchājāte satta na āsevane satta na kamme satta na vipāke
translated: There are seven in regard to the prenascent, seven in regard to the postnascent, seven in regard to the condition being by way of non-support, seven in regard to the condition being by way of non-kamma,

original: satta, naāhāre satta, najhāne satta, namagge satta, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte
analyzed: satta na āhāre satta na jhāne satta na magge satta na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte

analyzed: tīṇi no natthiyā satta no vigate satta

analyzed: nissaya vippayutta atthi avigatanti na hetuyā pañca na ārammaṇe pañca na adhipatiyā

analyzed: pañca na anantare pañca na samanantare pañca na sahajāte tīṇi na aññamaññe pañca

analyzed: pañca na vipāke pañca na āhāre pañca na aindriye pañca na jhāne pañca na magge pañca

analyzed: na sampayutte pañca no natthiyā pañca no vigate pañca

analyzed: nissaya indriya vippayutta atthi avigatanti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā

translated: Support, object, predominance, decisive support, prenascence, non-causally related, present, not absent. Not cause,

Not cause,🔽one; not object, one;🔽not predominance, one; not proximity, one; not contiguity, one; not conascence, one; not mutuality,🔽one; not support, one; not postnascence, one; not nutriment, one; not faculty, one; not jhāna,

translated: The combination of the conascence condition is finished.

original: Nissaya sahajāta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava, naadhipatiyā nava,🔽naanantare nava, nasamanantare nava, naaññamaññe pañca, naupanissaye nava, napurejāte

analyzed: nissaya sahajāta aññamañña sampayutta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe

analyzed: satta na pacchājāte satta na āsevane pañca na kamme satta na vipāke satta na āhāre
translated: seven, from not postnascence seven, from not repetition five, from not kamma seven, from not result seven, from not nutriment

original: satta, naindriye satta, najhāne satta, namagge satta, nasampayutte satta, navippayutte
analyzed: satta na indriye satta na jhāne satta na magge satta na sampayutte satta na vippayutte
translated: seven, from not faculty seven, from not jhāna seven, from not path seven, from not association seven, from not non-association

original: satta, noatthiyā satta, noavigate satta.
analyzed: satta no atthiyā satta no avigate satta
translated: seven, from not presence seven, from not non-disappearance seven.

original: Upanissaya anantara samanantara āsevana atthi vigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe🔽tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, nasahajāte tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, nanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte
analyzed: upanissaya anantara samanantara āsevana atthi vigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe  tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na sahajāte tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na nissaye tīṇi na purejāte
translated: Condition, prior, proximate, repetition, having, not having disappeared: from not root cause three, from not object🔽three, from not predominance three, from not conascence three, from not mutuality three, from not support three, from not prenascence

original: tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi, naindriye tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi na aindriye tīṇi
translated: three, from not postnascence three, from not kamma three, from not result three, from not nutriment three, from not faculty three,

original: najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi, noatthiyā tīṇi, noavigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi no atthiyā tīṇi no avigate tīṇi
translated: There are three in regard to non-root, three in regard to non-path, three in regard to non-association, three in regard to non-dissociation, three in regard to non-presence, and three in regard to non-deprivation.

original: Upanissaya kammanti nahetuyā dve, naārammaṇe dve, naadhipatiyā dve, naanantare dve,
analyzed: upanissaya kammanti na hetuyā dve na ārammaṇe dve na adhipatiyā dve na anantare dve
translated: In the section on condition and action, there are two in regard to non-root, two in regard to non-object, two in regard to non-predominance, two in regard to non-antecedent,

original: nasamanantare dve, nasahajāte dve, naaññamaññe dve, nanissaye dve, napurejāte dve,🔽napacchājāte dve, naāsevane dve, navipāke dve, naāhāre dve, naindriye dve, najhāne
analyzed: na samanantare dve na sahajāte dve na aññamaññe dve na nissaye dve na purejāte dve  na pacchājāte dve na āsevane dve na vipāke dve na āhāre dve na aindriye dve na jhāne
translated: two in regard to non-concomitant, two in regard to non-conascence, two in regard to non-mutual, two in regard to non-dependence, two in regard to non-priority,🔽two in regard to non-posteriority, two in regard to non-nutritive, two in regard to non-kamma, two in regard to non-sphere, two in regard to non-element, two in regard to non-contact,

original: dve, namagge dve, nasampayutte dve, navippayutte dve, noatthiyā dve, nonatthiyā dve,
analyzed: dve na magge dve na sampayutte dve na vippayutte dve no atthiyāḥ dve no natthiyāḥ dve
translated: two in regard to non-feeling, two in regard to non-perceiving, two in regard to non-deprivation, two in regard to non-deprivation,

original: novigate dve, noavigate dve.
analyzed: na uvigate dve na u avigate dve
translated: two in regard to non-deprivation, and two in regard to non-deprivation.

original: Upanissaya anantara samanantara kamma natthi vigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe
analyzed: upanissaya anantara samanantara kamma natthi vigatanti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe
translated: In the section on condition, proximity, contiguity, and action, there is one in regard to non-root, one in regard to non-object,

original: ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, nanissaye ekaṁ, napurejāte
analyzed: na adhipatiyā eka na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe eka na nissaye eka na purejāte
translated: one in regard to non-predominance, one in regard to non-conascence, one in regard to non-mutual, one in regard to non-dependence, one in regard to non-priority,

original: ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, navipāke ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ,
analyzed: na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na vipāke eka na āhāre eka na aindriye eka
translated: one in the condition being post-nascence, one in the condition being not-kamma, one in the condition being not-result, one in the condition being not-nutriment, one in the condition being not-faculty,

original: najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ, noatthiyā ekaṁ, noavigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka na vippayutte eka no atthiyāḥ eka no avigate eka
translated: one in the condition being not-absorption, one in the condition being not-path, one in the condition being not-association, one in the condition being not-disassociation, one in the condition being not-presence, one in the condition being not-decisive-support.

original: Upanissayamūlakaṁ.
analyzed: upanissaya mūlaka
translated: The section on decisive-support.

original: Purejātaduka
analyzed: purejātaduka
translated: The dyad on prenascence

original: Purejātapaccayā nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi,
analyzed: purejāta paccayāḥ na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na anantare tīṇi
translated: As to prenascence condition: there are three lines of three each in the case of not being a root, three in the case of not being an object, three in the case of not being a dominant, three in the case of not being an antecedent,

original: nasamanantare tīṇi, nasahajāte tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, nanissaye tīṇi, naupanissaye🔽tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi,
analyzed: na samanantare tīṇi na sahajāte tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na nissaye tīṇi na upanissaye  tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi
translated: three in the case of not being a similar antecedent, three in the case of not being conascence, three in the case of not being mutuality, three in the case of not being support, three in the case of not being prenascence,

original: naindriye tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi,
analyzed: na aindriye tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: three in the case of not being postnascence, three in the case of not being nutriment, three in the case of not being kamma, three in the case of not being result, three in the case of not being faculty, three in the case of not being jhana, three in the case of not being path, three in the case of not being association, three in the case of not being disassociation,

original: nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: nonatthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: three in the case of not being presence, three in the case of not being absence.

original: Purejātaghaṭanā
analyzed: purejāta ghaṭanā
translated: The section on the prenascent

original: Purejāta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, naanantare
analyzed: purejāta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na anantare
translated: As to prenascence and presence and absence: there are three lines of three each in the case of not being a root, three in the case of not being an object, three in the case of not being a dominant, three in the case of not being an antecedent,

original: tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, nasahajāte tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, nanissaye tīṇi, naupanissaye🔽tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na sahajāte tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na nissaye tīṇi na upanissaye  tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi
translated: Three, not as condition, three, not as co-nascent, three, not as conascence, three, not as mutuality, three, not as support,

original: naindriye tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi,
analyzed: na aindriye tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: three, not as post-nascence, three, not as nutriment, three, not as kamma, three, not as result, three, not as faculty, three, not as path, three, not as association, three, not as dissociation,

original: nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: nonatthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: three, not as presence, three, not as absence.

original: Purejāta nissaya vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā
analyzed: purejāta nissaya vippayutta atthi avigatanti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā
translated: With past, with support, with dissociation, there is, not with cause, three, not with object, three, not with predominance,

original: tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, nasahajāte tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye
analyzed: tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na sahajāte tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye
translated: three, not with proximity, three, not with contiguity, three, not with arising together, three, not with presence, three, not with support,

original: tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi
translated: three, not with post-nascence, three, not with repetition, three, not with kamma, three, not with result, three, not with nutriment,

original: naindriye tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na indriye tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: three, not with faculty, three, not with jhāna, three, not with path, three, not with association, three, not with presence, three, not with absence.

original: Purejāta ārammaṇa atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi,
analyzed: purejāta ārammaṇa atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na anantare tīṇi
translated: Conditioned by what has arisen before, object, exists, not unconnected: with respect to not root cause, there are three; with respect to not predominance, there are three; with respect to not proximity, there are three;

original: nasamanantare tīṇi, nasahajāte tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, nanissaye tīṇi, naupanissaye🔽tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi,
analyzed: na samanantare tīṇi na sahajāte tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na nissaye tīṇi na upanissaye  tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi
translated: with respect to not contiguity, there are three; with respect to not arising together, there are three; with respect to not interdependence, there are three; with respect to not support, there are three; with respect to not decisive support,🔽there are three; with respect to not postnascence, there are three; with respect to not repetition, there are three; with respect to not kamma, there are three; with respect to not ripening, there are three; with respect to not nutriment, there are three;

original: naindriye tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi,
analyzed: na aindriye tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: with respect to not faculty, there are three; with respect to not path, there are three; with respect to not association, there are three; with respect to not dissociation, there are three;

original: nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: nonatthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: with respect to not presence, there are three; with respect to not disappearance, there are three.

original: Purejāta ārammaṇa nissaya vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naadhipatiyā🔽tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, nasahajāte tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye
analyzed: purejāta ārammaṇa nissaya vippayutta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na adhipatiyā  tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na sahajāte tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye
translated: Conditioned by what has arisen before, object, support, dissociation, exists, not unconnected: with respect to not root cause, there are three; with respect to not predominance,🔽there are three; with respect to not proximity, there are three; with respect to not contiguity, there are three; with respect to not arising together, there are three; with respect to not interdependence, there are three; with respect to not decisive support,

original: tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi
translated: there are three; with respect to not postnascence, there are three; with respect to not repetition, there are three; with respect to not kamma, there are three; with respect to not ripening, there are three; with respect to not nutriment, there are three;

original: naindriye tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na indriye tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: Not as faculty, not as jhāna, not as path, not as association, not as non-disappearance, not as non-culmination.

original: Purejāta ārammaṇa adhipati upanissaya atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naanantare🔽ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, nanissaye ekaṁ, napacchājāte
analyzed: purejāta ārammaṇa adhipati upanissaya atthi avigata nti na hetuyā eka na anantare  na samanantare eka na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe eka na nissaye eka na pacchājāte
translated: With respect to the prenascent, as object, as dominance, as support, as presence, as non-disappearance. Not as root cause, one.🔽Not as proximity, one. Not as contiguity, one. Not as arising together, one. Not as singleness, one. Not as support, one. Not as postnascent,

original: ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ,
analyzed: na āsevane eka na kamme eka na vipāke eka na āhāre eka na indriye eka
translated: one. Not as nutriment, one. Not as faculty, one.

original: najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka na vippayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: Not as jhāna, one. Not as path, one. Not as association, one. Not as non-disappearance, one. Not as non-culmination, one.

original: Purejāta ārammaṇa adhipati nissaya upanissaya vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā🔽ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, napacchājāte
analyzed: purejāta ārammaṇa adhipati nissaya upanissaya vippayutta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā  na anantare eka na samanantare eka na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe eka na pacchājāte
translated: With respect to the prenascent, as object, as dominance, as support, as non-disappearance, as non-culmination, as presence, as non-disappearance, as dissociation, as presence, as non-disappearance. Not as root cause,

original: ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ,
analyzed: na āsevane eka na kamme eka na vipāke eka na āhāre eka na indriye eka
translated: one. Not as proximity, one. Not as contiguity, one. Not as arising together, one. Not as singleness, one. Not as plurality, one. Not as postnascent,🔽one. Not as nutriment, one. Not as faculty, one.

original: najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.🔽Purejāta nissaya indriya vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe ekaṁ,
analyzed: na jhāne na magge eka na sampayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka  purejāta nissaya indriya vippayutta atthi avigatanti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe eka
translated: In the prenascent, in dependence, in the faculties, in the unassociated, in the existent, in the non-disappeared, one.

original: naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe🔽ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke🔽ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na adhipatiyāḥ eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe  eka na upanissaye eka na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na vipāke  na āhāre eka na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: In the cause, in the object, in the dominant, in the prior, in the proximate, in the associated, in the conascent, in the mutually-dependent,🔽in the support, in the postnascent, in the nutriment, in the action, in the result,

original: Purejātamūlakaṁ.
analyzed: purejātamūlaka
translated: in the food, in the jhāna, in the path, in the unassociated, in the non-existent, in the disappeared, one.🔽The section on the prenascent is finished.

original: Pacchājātaduka🔽Pacchājātapaccayā nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi,
analyzed: pacchājātaduka  pacchājāta paccayāḥ na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na anantare tīṇi
translated: The pair: postnascent🔽In the postnascent condition, in the cause, three; in the object, three; in the dominant, three; in the prior, three;

original: nasamanantare tīṇi, nasahajāte tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, nanissaye tīṇi, naupanissaye
analyzed: na samanantare tīṇi na sahajāte tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na nissaye tīṇi na upanissaye
translated: in the proximate, three; in the conascent, three; in the mutually-dependent, three; in the support, three; in the postnascent, three; in the nutriment, three; in the faculty, three; in the path, three; in the jhāna, three; in the fruition, three; in the unassociated, three; in the dissociated, three; in the absent, three; in the disappeared, three; in the unarisen, three; in the not-yet-present, three; in the past, three; in the future, three; in the present, three; in the non-existent, three; in the non-disappeared, three.

original: tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi
translated: There are three lines of three for non-prenascence, three for non-kamma, three for non-result, three for non-nutritive essence,

original: naindriye tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na indriye tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: three for non-faculty, three for non-path, three for non-association, three for non-disappearance, three for non-relinking.

original: Pacchājātaghaṭanā
analyzed: pacchā jāta ghaṭanā
translated: The Section on Post Nascence

original: Pacchājāta vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā
analyzed: pacchājāta vippayutta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā
translated: In the section on post-nascence, there are three lines of three for post-nascence dissociated, and for the rest of the triplets and couplets there are three lines of three.

original: tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, nasahajāte tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, nanissaye
analyzed: tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na sahajāte tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na nissaye
translated: In the absence of cause there are three lines of three. In the absence of object there are three lines of three. In the absence of predominance there are three lines of three.🔽In the absence of proximity there are three lines of three. In the absence of contiguity there are three lines of three. In the absence of presence there are three lines of three. In the absence of absence there are three lines of three. In the absence of disappearance there are three lines of three. In the absence of relinking there are three lines of three.

original: tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke
analyzed: tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke
translated: In the absence of post-nascence there are three lines of three. In the absence of repetition there are three lines of three. In the absence of kamma there are three lines of three. In the absence of result there are three lines of three.

original: tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi, naindriye tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte tīṇi,🔽nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi na aindriye tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi  nonatthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: In the absence of nutriment there are three lines of three. In the absence of faculty there are three lines of three. In the absence of path there are three lines of three. In the absence of association there are three lines of three.

original: Pacchājātamūlakaṁ.
analyzed: pacchā jāta mūlaka
translated: In the absence of disappearance there are three lines of three. In the absence of relinking there are three lines of three.🔽The Section on Post Nascence is finished.

original: Āsevanaduka
analyzed: āsevana duka
translated: The Section on Repetition

original: Āsevanapaccayā nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, nasahajāte tīṇi,
analyzed: āsevana paccayā na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na sahajāte tīṇi
translated: In the section on repetition, in the absence of cause there are three lines of three. In the absence of object there are three lines of three. In the absence of predominance there are three lines of three. In the absence of presence there are three lines of three.

original: naaññamaññe tīṇi, nanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi,🔽navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi, naindriye tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte
analyzed: na aññamaññe tīṇi na nissaye tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na kamme tīṇi  na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi na indriye tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte
translated: Three lines with “not another” (i.e. not another condition). Three lines with “not decisive support”. Three lines with “not prenascence”. Three lines with “not postnascence”. Three lines with “not kamma”.🔽Three lines with “not result”. Three lines with “not nutriment”. Three lines with “not faculty”. Three lines with “not path”. Three lines with “not jhāna”. Three lines with “not association”.

original: tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi, noatthiyā tīṇi, noavigate tīṇi.
analyzed: tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi no atthiyā tīṇi no avigate tīṇi
translated: Three lines with “not non-association”. Three lines with “not presence”. Three lines with “not absence”.

original: Āsevanaghaṭanā
analyzed: āsevana ghaṭanā
translated: The Section on Repetition

original: Āsevana anantara samanantara upanissaya natthi vigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe
analyzed: āsevana anantara samanantara upanissaya natthi vigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe
translated: Repetition, occurrence, immediate, proximity, support, absence, disappearance, not cause, three lines. Not object, three lines.

original: tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, nasahajāte tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, nanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte🔽tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi, naindriye tīṇi,🔽najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi, noatthiyā tīṇi, noavigate tīṇi.
analyzed: tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na sahajāte tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na nissaye tīṇi na purejāte  tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi na aindriye tīṇi  na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi no atthiyā tīṇi no avigate tīṇi
translated: Not dominance, three lines. Not conascence, three lines. Not another, three lines. Not support, three lines. Not prenascence, three lines.🔽Not postnascence, three lines. Not kamma, three lines. Not result, three lines. Not nutriment, three lines. Not faculty, three lines.🔽Not jhāna, three lines. Not path, three lines. Not association, three lines. Not non-association, three lines. Not presence, three lines. Not absence, three lines.

original: Āsevanamūlakaṁ.
analyzed: āsevana mūlaka
translated: The Section on Repetition is finished.

original: Kammaduka
analyzed: kammaduka
translated: The Dual Set

original: Kammapaccayā nahetuyā satta, naārammaṇe satta, naadhipatiyā satta, naanantare satta,
analyzed: kamma paccayāḥ na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe satta na adhipatiyā satta na anantare satta
translated: With kamma as condition, non-root-cause, there are seven; non-object, seven; non-domin-ance, seven; non-antecedent, seven;

original: nasamanantare satta, nasahajāte dve, naaññamaññe tīṇi, nanissaye dve, naupanissaye
analyzed: na samanantare satta na sahajāte dve na aññamaññe tīṇi na nissaye dve na upanissaye
translated: non-consequent, seven; co-nascent, two; mutually-related, three; non-support, two; non-decisive support,

original: satta, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte satta, naāsevane satta, navipāke satta, naāhāre
analyzed: satta na purejāte satta na pacchājāte satta na āsevane satta na vipāke satta na āhāre
translated: seven; non-pre-nascent, seven; non-post-nascent, seven; non-kamma-result, seven; non-nutritive-essence,

original: dve, naindriye satta, najhāne satta, namagge satta, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte
analyzed: dve na aindriye satta na jhāne satta na magge satta na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte
translated: two; non-faculty, seven; non-path, seven; non-association, three; non-dissociation,

original: pañca, noatthiyā dve, nonatthiyā satta, novigate satta, noavigate dve.🔽Kammapakiṇṇakaghaṭanā🔽Kamma upanissayanti nahetuyā dve, naārammaṇe dve, naadhipatiyā dve, naanantare dve,🔽nasamanantare dve, nasahajāte dve, naaññamaññe dve, nanissaye dve, napurejāte dve,🔽napacchājāte dve, naāsevane dve, navipāke dve, naāhāre dve, naindriye dve, najhāne
analyzed: pañca no atthiyā dve no natthiyā satta no vigate satta no avigate dve 🔽kamma pakiṇṇaka ghaṭanā 🔽kamma upanissayanti na hetuyāḥ dve na ārammaṇe dve na adhipatiyāḥ dve na anantare dve 🔽na samanantare dve na sahajāte dve na aññamaññe dve na nissaye dve na purejāte dve 🔽na pacchājāte dve na āsevane dve na vipāke dve na āhāre dve na aindriye dve na jhāne
translated: five; non-presence, two; non-absence, seven; non-deprivation, seven; non-consummation, two.

original: dve, namagge dve, nasampayutte dve, navippayutte dve, noatthiyā dve, nonatthiyā dve,
analyzed: dve na magge dve na sampayutte dve na vippayutte dve no atthiyāḥ dve no natthiyāḥ dve
translated: two, in the cognitive process two, in association two, in dissociation two, in dependence for presence two, in dependence for non-appearance two,

original: novigate dve, noavigate dve.🔽Kamma anantara samanantara upanissaya natthi vigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe🔽ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, nanissaye ekaṁ, napurejāte🔽ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, navipāke ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ,🔽najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ, noatthiyā ekaṁ, noavigate ekaṁ.🔽Sahajātaghaṭanā
analyzed: na uvigate dve na u avigate dve  kamma anantara samanantara upanissaya natthi vigata nti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe  na adhipatiyā eka na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe eka na nissaye eka na purejāte  na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na vipāke eka na āhāre eka na aindriye eka  na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka na vippayutte eka no atthiyāḥ eka no avigate eka  sahajāta ghaṭanā
translated: in dependence for appearance two, in dependence for non-disappearance two.🔽Kamma is related to Resultant by way of proximity, contiguity, support, and absence, but not by way of root, not by way of object,

original: Kamma sahajāta nissaya āhāra atthi avigatanti nahetuyā satta, naārammaṇe satta, naadhipatiyā🔽satta, naanantare satta, nasamanantare satta, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye satta,
analyzed: kamma sahajāta nissaya āhāra atthi avigatanti na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe satta na adhipatiyā 🔽satta na anantare satta na samanantare satta na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye satta
