original: napurejāte satta, napacchājāte satta, naāsevane satta, navipāke satta, naindriye🔽satta, najhāne satta, namagge satta, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā
analyzed: na purejāte satta na pacchājāte satta na āsevane satta na vipāke satta na indriye  satta na jhāne satta na magge satta na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā
translated: there are seven in the past and seven in the future, there are seven in the not-yet-come, there are seven in the not-yet-arisen, there are seven in the conditions, there are seven in the faculties,🔽there are seven in the jhānas, there are seven in the paths, there are three in the associated, there are three in the not-associated, there are three in the not-supported,🔽there are three in the supported,

original: satta, novigate satta.
analyzed: satta no vigate satta
translated: There are seven in regard to what is not previously ceased, seven in regard to what is not subsequently ceased, seven in regard to what is not presently ceasing, seven in regard to what is not arisen, seven in regard to what is not present, seven in regard to what is not future, seven in regard to what is not past, seven in regard to what is not internal, seven in regard to what is not external, seven in regard to what is not to be directly known, seven in regard to what is not to be developed, seven in regard to what is not to be comprehended, seven in regard to what is not to be abandoned, seven in regard to what is not to be realized, seven in regard to what is not to be resorted to, seven in regard to what is not to be brought about.

original: Kamma sahajāta aññamañña nissaya āhāra atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe🔽tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi,🔽napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naindriye tīṇi,🔽najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: kamma sahajāta aññamañña nissaya āhāra atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe  tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi  na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na aindriye tīṇi  na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte eka na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: There are three in regard to what is not associated with, three in regard to what is not dissociated from, three in regard to what is not conditionally related to, three in regard to what is not conditionally arisen.🔽There are seven in regard to what is not a condition, seven in regard to what is not a decisive support, seven in regard to what is not a support, seven in regard to what is not a foundation, seven in regard to what is not a basis, seven in regard to what is not a proximity, seven in regard to what is not a dissociation, seven in regard to what is not a presence.🔽There are three in regard to what is not a cause, three in regard to what is not a condition being a cause, three in regard to what is not a decisive support being a condition, three in regard to what is not a support being a condition, three in regard to what is not a foundation being a condition, three in regard to what is not a basis being a condition, three in regard to what is not a proximity being a condition, three in regard to what is not a dissociation being a condition, three in regard to what is not a presence being a condition.

original: Kamma sahajāta aññamañña nissaya āhāra sampayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi,
analyzed: kamma sahajāta aññamañña nissaya āhāra sampayutta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi
translated: There are three in regard to what is not a cause, not a condition being a cause, not a decisive support, not a support, not a foundation, not a basis, not a proximity, not a dissociation, not a presence.🔽There are three in regard to what is not a cause, not a condition being a cause, not a decisive support, not a support, not a foundation, not a basis, not a proximity, not a dissociation, not a presence, not

original: naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, naupanissaye🔽tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naindriye🔽tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.🔽Kamma sahajāta nissaya āhāra vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe
analyzed: na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na upanissaye  tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na aindriye  tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi  kamma sahajāta nissaya āhāra vippayutta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe
translated: With respect to object, there are three. With respect to predominance, there are three. With respect to proximity, there are three. With respect to contiguity, there are three. With respect to support, there are three.🔽With respect to arising together, there are three. With respect to arising before, there are three. With respect to arising after, there are three. With respect to presence, there are three. With respect to result, there are three. With respect to the faculties, there are three.

original: tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye🔽tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naindriye
analyzed: tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye  tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na aindriye
translated: With respect to the paths, there are three. With respect to non-contention, there are three. With respect to the kinds of knowledge, there are three. With respect to the fruits, there are three. With respect to the meditative development, there are three. With respect to the path, there are three. With respect to non-deprivation, there are three. With respect to the spiritual levels, there are three. With respect to the powers, there are three. With respect to the faculties, there are three. With respect to the enlightenment factors, there are three. With respect to the path, there are three. With respect to the dependent origination, there are three. With respect to the aggregates, there are three. With respect to the sense spheres, there are three. With respect to the elements, there are three. With respect to the truths, there are three. With respect to the causal process, there are three. With respect to the fruits, there are three. With respect to the wholesome roots, there are three. With respect to the wholesome, there are three. With respect to the defilements, there are three. With respect to the floods, there are three. With respect to the bonds, there are three. With respect to the hindrances, there are three. With respect to the clingings, there are three. With respect to the knots, there are three. With respect to the latent tendencies, there are three. With respect to the wrongnesses, there are three. With respect to the mundane phenomena, there are three. With respect to the supramundane phenomena, there are three. With respect to the conditioned phenomena, there are three. With respect to the unconditioned phenomena, there are three.

original: tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi. [Avipāka—4]🔽Kamma sahajāta nissaya vipāka āhāra atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe ekaṁ,
analyzed: tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi 🔽kamma sahajāta nissaya vipāka āhāra atthi avigatanti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe eka
translated: With respect to the cause, there are three. With respect to the condition, there are three. With respect to the cause and condition, there are three. With respect to the cause and condition, there are three. With respect

original: naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, naupanissaye🔽ekaṁ, napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne
analyzed: na adhipatiyā eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na aññamaññe eka na upanissaye  eka na purejāte eka na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na indriye eka na jhāne
translated: Not as dominant condition, there is one. Not as prior condition, there is one. Not as subsequent condition, there is one. Not as support condition, there is one.🔽Not as arising before, there is one. Not as arising later, there is one. Not as repetition condition, there is one. Not as faculty condition, there is one. Not as absorption condition, there is one.

original: ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na magge eka na sampayutte eka na vippayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: Not as path condition, there is one. Not as association condition, there is one. Not as dissociation condition, there is one. Not as presence condition, there is one. Not as absence condition, there is one.

original: Kamma sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka āhāra atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe
analyzed: kamma sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka āhāra atthi avigata nti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe
translated: Kamma, arising together, mutually related, support, result, nutriment, present, not absent - not as root cause, there is one. Not as object, there is one.

original: ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ,
analyzed: na adhipatiyā eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na upanissaye eka
translated: Not as dominant condition, there is one. Not as prior condition, there is one. Not as subsequent condition, there is one. Not as support condition, there is one.

original: napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ,
analyzed: na purejāte na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na indriye eka na jhāne eka
translated: Not as arising before, there is one. Not as arising later, there is one. Not as repetition condition, there is one. Not as faculty condition, there is one. Not as absorption condition, there is one.

original: namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na magge eka na sampayutte eka na vippayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: Not as path condition, there is one. Not as association condition, there is one. Not as dissociation condition, there is one. Not as presence condition, there is one. Not as absence condition, there is one.

original: Kamma sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka āhāra sampayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā
analyzed: kamma sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka āhāra sampayutta atthi avigatanti na hetuyā

analyzed: na adhipatiyā eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na upanissaye eka

original: nasamanantare satta, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe tīṇi, nanissaye ekaṁ, naupanissaye
analyzed: na samanantare satta na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe tīṇi na nissaye eka na upanissaye
translated: not arising-later, one; not repetition, one; not jhāna, one; not path, one; not foundation, one; not non-disappearance, one.

original: satta, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte satta, naāsevane satta, nakamme satta, navipāke🔽satta, naindriye satta, najhāne satta, namagge satta, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte
analyzed: satta na purejāte satta na pacchājāte satta na āsevane satta na kamme satta na vipāke  satta na indriye satta na jhāne satta na magge satta na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte
translated: there are seven [things] not related to what is past, there are seven [things] not related to what is future, there are seven [things] not related to nutriment, there are seven [things] not related to action,🔽there are seven [things] not related to result, there are seven [things] not related to the faculties, there are seven [things] not related to the paths, there are seven [things] not related to the jhānas, there are three [things] not related to association,🔽there are seven [things] not related to dissociation,

original: tīṇi, nonatthiyā satta, novigate satta.
analyzed: tīṇi no natthiyā satta no vigate satta
translated: there are seven in the post-nascence relation, seven in the absence relation, seven in the non-compounded, seven in the presence relation, seven in the presence-absence relation, seven in the past, seven in the future, seven in the present, seven in the unarisen, seven in the arisen, seven in the unarisen-arisen, seven in the internal, seven in the external, seven in the internal-external, seven in the gross, seven in the subtle, seven in the gross-subtle, seven in the far, seven in the near, seven in the far-near.

original: Āhāramissakaghaṭanā
analyzed: āhāra missaka ghaṭanā

translated: There are seven in the root-cause condition that is not a condition by way of nutriment, seven in the object condition, seven in the predominance condition, seven in the proximity condition,

original: tīṇi, nonatthiyā satta, novigate satta.
analyzed: tīṇi no natthiyā satta no vigate satta
translated: seven in the contiguity condition, seven in the absence condition, seven in the disappearance condition, seven in the non-disappearance condition, seven in the past, seven in the future, seven in the present, seven in the unarisen, seven in the arisen, seven in the unarisen-arisen, seven in the internal, seven in the external, seven in the internal-external, seven in the gross, seven in the subtle, seven in the gross-subtle, seven in the far, seven in the near, seven in the far-near.

original: Sahajātasāmaññaghaṭanā

analyzed: āhāra sahajāta nissaya atthi avigatanti na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe satta na adhipatiyā

original: satta, naanantare satta, nasamanantare satta, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye satta,
analyzed: satta na anantare satta na samanantare satta na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye satta

original: napurejāte satta, napacchājāte satta, naāsevane satta, nakamme satta, navipāke satta,
analyzed: na purejāte satta na pacchājāte satta na āsevane satta na kamme satta na vipāke satta
translated: and seven with respect to “prenascence,” and seven with respect to “postnascence,” and seven with respect to “nutriment,” and seven with respect to “kamma,” and seven with respect to “ripening,”

original: naindriye satta, najhāne satta, namagge satta, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi,
analyzed: na indriye satta na jhāne satta na magge satta na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: and seven with respect to “faculty,” and seven with respect to “path,” and seven with respect to “absorption,” and three with respect to “association,” and three with respect to “non-association,”

original: nonatthiyā satta, novigate satta.
analyzed: nonatthiyā satta no vigate satta
translated: and seven with respect to “presence,” and seven with respect to “disappearance.”

original: Āhāra sahajāta aññamañña nissaya atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi,🔽naadhipatiyā tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte
analyzed: āhāra sahajāta aññamañña nissaya atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi  na adhipatiyā tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte
translated: With respect to “nutriment” (as the fourth factor), there are three (instances) with respect to “conascence” and “mutuality” and “support” and “presence” and “non-disappearance,” but not with respect to “root-cause.” There are three (instances) with respect to “object,” and three with respect to “predominance,”🔽and three with respect to “antecedent,” and three with respect to “conascence,” and three with respect to “decisive support,” and three with respect to “prenascence,”

original: tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naindriye tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na indriye tīṇi
translated: and three with respect to “postnascence,” and three with respect to “nutriment,” and three with respect to “kamma,” and three with respect to “ripening,” and three with respect to “faculty,”

original: najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte eka na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: In regard to non-root cause, there are three. In regard to non-path, there are three. In regard to non-association, there is one. In regard to non-dissociation, there are three. In regard to non-deprivation, there are three. In regard to non-surpassing, there are three.

original: Āhāra sahajāta aññamañña nissaya sampayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe
analyzed: āhāra sahajāta aññamañña nissaya sampayutta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe
translated: In regard to nutriment that is conascence, mutuality, support, and association, there is existence and non-disappearance. In regard to non-root cause, there are three. In regard to non-object, there are three.

original: tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi,🔽napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi  na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi
translated: In regard to non-predominance, there are three. In regard to non-prenascence, there are three. In regard to non-proximity, there are three. In regard to non-arising, there are three.

original: naindriye tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na aindriye tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: In regard to non-conascence, there are three. In regard to non-purity, there are three. In regard to non-development, there are three. In regard to non-arising, there are three. In regard to non-disappearance, there are three.

original: Āhāra sahajāta nissaya vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi,
analyzed: āhāra sahajāta nissaya vippayutta atthi avigatanti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi

original: naadhipatiyā tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye
analyzed: na adhipatiyā tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye
translated: In regard to non-predominance, there are three. In regard to non-prenascence, there are three. In regard to non-proximity, there are three. In regard to non-mutuality, there are three.

original: tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke
analyzed: tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke
translated: In regard to non-arising, there are three. In regard to non-conascence, there are three. In regard to non-purity, there are three. In regard to non-development, there are three. In regard to non-arising, there are three. In regard to non-disappearance, there are three.

analyzed: na u vigate tīṇi

analyzed: āhāra sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka vippayutta atthi avigatanti na hetuyā eka  na ārammaṇe eka na adhipatiyā eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na upanissaye
translated: With nutriment as conascence, mutuality, support, kamma result, non-causally related, present, not disappeared – with non-cause as one,🔽not object as one, not predominance as one, not proximity as one, not contiguity as one, not presence as one,

original: ekaṁ, napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, naindriye
analyzed: na purejāte eka na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na indriye

original: Sakammaghaṭanā
analyzed: sa kamma ghaṭanā

analyzed: āhāra sahajāta nissaya kamma atthi avigatanti na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe satta na adhipatiyā

analyzed: satta na anantare satta na samanantare satta na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye satta  na purejāte satta na pacchājāte satta na āsevane satta na vipāke satta na indriye

analyzed: satta na jhāne satta na magge satta na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā

analyzed: āhāra sahajāta aññamañña nissaya kamma atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe

With the condition being a condition by way of contiguity, there are three. With the condition being a condition by way of nutriment, there are three. With the condition being a condition by way of faculty, there are three.

original: Āhāra sahajāta aññamañña nissaya kamma sampayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi,
analyzed: āhāra sahajāta aññamañña nissaya kamma sampayutta atthi avigatanti na hetuyā tīṇi

With the condition being a condition by way of non-dissociation, there are three. With the condition being a condition by way of presence, there are three. With the condition being a condition by way of non-disappearance, there are three.

With respect to presence, there are three. With respect to result, there are three. With respect to the faculties, there are three.

analyzed: tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi  āhāra sahajāta nissaya kamma vippayutta atthi avigatanti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe  tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye  tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na aindriye

original: tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi. [Avipāka—4]
analyzed: tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi

With respect to dissociation, there is one. With respect to presence, there is one.

analyzed: āhāra sahajāta nissaya kamma vipāka atthi avigatanti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe eka

translated: not as dominant, one; not as prior, one; not as subsequent, one; not as support, one; not as object, one; not as decisive support, one; not as proximity, one; not as contiguity, one; not as association, one; not as non-disappearance, one; not as faculty, one; not as path, one; not as relation, one; not as presence, one; not as absence, one; not as possession, one; not as acquisition, one; not as non-acquisition, one.

analyzed: āhāra sahajāta aññamañña nissaya indriya atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe

original: tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi,🔽napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi,

analyzed: tīṇi no natthiyā satta no vigate satta

original: Indriyamissakaghaṭanā
analyzed: indriya missaka ghaṭanā
translated: The Combination of the Faculties and the Miscellaneous

analyzed: indriya atthi avigatanti na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe satta na adhipatiyā satta na anantare
translated: With the faculty being present and not absent, with the cause, there are seven; with the object, there are seven; with the predominance, there are seven; with the proximity,

analyzed: satta na purejāte satta na pacchājāte satta na āsevane satta na kamme satta na vipāke

analyzed: satta na āhāre satta na jhāne satta na magge satta na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte

analyzed: na anantare satta na samanantare satta na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye  satta na purejāte satta na pacchājāte satta na āsevane satta na kamme satta na vipāke  satta na āhāre satta na jhāne satta na magge satta na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte
translated: There are three in the not-present-pacc-born-non-pacc-born-non-vanished.

original: tīṇi, nonatthiyā satta, novigate satta.🔽Indriya nissaya vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā
analyzed: tīṇi no natthiyā satta no vigate satta 🔽indriya nissaya vippayutta atthi avigatanti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā
translated: There are three in the not-present-arisen-non-arisen-non-vanished.

original: tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye🔽tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke
analyzed: tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye  tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke
translated: Three, three, three, one, three, three,🔽three, three, three, three, three, three,

original: tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: three, three, three, three, three, three, three, three, three, three.

original: Pakiṇṇakaghaṭanā
analyzed: pakiṇṇaka ghaṭanā
translated: The method of combination in the case of the miscellaneous terms.

original: Indriya nissaya purejāta vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe ekaṁ,
analyzed: indriya nissaya purejāta vippayutta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe eka
translated: In the case of the triad “root cause, support, prenascence, dissociated, present, not absent,” there is one permutation in the case of “not as root cause,” one in the case of “not object,”

original: naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe🔽ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke
analyzed: na adhipatiyāḥ eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe  eka na upanissaye eka na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na vipāke
translated: one in the case of “not dominant condition,” one in the case of “not proximity,” one in the case of “not contiguity,” one in the case of “not conascence,” one in the case of “not mutuality,”

original: ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na āhāre eka na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: one in the case of “not support,” one in the case of “not postnascence,” one in the case of “not nutriment,” one in the case of “not faculty,” one in the case of “not path,” one in the case of “not association,” one in the case of “not presence,” one in the case of “not non-disappearance.”

original: Sahajātasāmaññaghaṭanā
translated: The method of combination in the case of the conascence-commonality.

original: Indriya sahajāta nissaya atthi avigatanti nahetuyā satta, naārammaṇe satta, naadhipatiyā🔽satta, naanantare satta, nasamanantare satta, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye satta,
analyzed: indriya sahajāta nissaya atthi avigata nti na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe satta na adhipatiyā  satta na anantare satta na samanantare satta na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye satta
translated: Conascent, decisive-support, present, not-disappeared: not-root, seven; not-object, seven; not-predominance,

original: napurejāte satta, napacchājāte satta, naāsevane satta, nakamme satta, navipāke satta,
analyzed: na purejāte satta na pacchājāte satta na āsevane satta na kamme satta na vipāke satta
translated: seven; not-preceded, seven; not-consecutive, seven; not-kamma, seven; not-result, seven;

original: naāhāre satta, najhāne satta, namagge satta, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi,
analyzed: na āhāre satta na jhāne satta na magge satta na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: not-nutritive-essence, seven; not-jhana, seven; not-path, seven; not-association, three; not-disassociation, three;

original: nonatthiyā satta, novigate satta.
analyzed: nonatthiyā satta no vigate satta
translated: not-presence, seven; not-decisive-support, seven; not-absence, seven; not-disappearance, seven.

original: Indriya sahajāta aññamañña nissaya atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi,🔽naadhipatiyā tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte
analyzed: indriya sahajāta aññamañña nissaya atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi  na adhipatiyā tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte
translated: Conascent, reciprocal, decisive-support, present, not-disappeared: not-root, three; not-object, three;

original: tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi
translated: not-predominance, three; not-preceded, three; not-consecutive, three; not-decisive-support, three; not-absence, three; not-disappearance, three.

original: najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.

original: nonatthiyā satta, novigate satta.
analyzed: nonatthiyā satta no vigate satta
translated: there are seven that are not related to faculties, and seven that are not unrelated to faculties.

original: Indriya sahajāta aññamañña nissaya magga atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi …pe… nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: indriya sahajāta aññamañña nissaya magga atthi avigatanti na hetuyā tīṇi pe na sampayutte eka na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: When it comes to faculties that are conjoined, reciprocally related, and related to the path, there are three that are not roots … one that is not a condition by way of association … three that are not unrelated … three that are not related to faculties … three that are not unrelated to faculties.

original: Indriya sahajāta aññamañña nissaya magga sampayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi …pe… novigate tīṇi.

translated: When it comes to faculties that are conjoined, reciprocally related, and related to the path, and are related to the path, there are three that are not roots … three that are not unrelated.

original: Indriya sahajāta nissaya magga vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi …pe… novigate tīṇi. translated: When it comes to faculties that are conjoined, reciprocally related, and related to the path, and are results, and are related to the path, and are related to the path, there is one that is not a root … one that is not unrelated.

translated: Conditioned by faculty, cause, conascence, support, path, and dissociated, there is … not object … not proximity … not presence … not non-disappearance.🔽Conditioned by faculty, cause, conascence, support, result, path, and presence, there is … not object … not proximity … not presence … not non-disappearance.🔽Conditioned by faculty, cause, conascence, mutuality, support, result, path, and presence, there is … not object … not proximity … not presence … not non-disappearance.

original: Indriya hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka magga sampayutta atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: indriya hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka magga sampayutta atthi avigatanti na ārammaṇe ekam pe no vigate eka
translated: Conditioned by faculty, cause, conascence, mutuality, support, result, path, presence, and associated, there is … not object … not proximity … not presence … not non-disappearance.

original: Indriya hetu sahajāta nissaya vipāka magga vippayutta atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: indriya hetu sahajāta nissaya vipāka magga vippayutta atthi avigatanti na ārammaṇe ekam pe no vigate eka
translated: Conditioned by faculty, cause, and conascence, and not by object, and so on.

original: Indriya hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka magga vippayutta atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… novigate ekaṁ. [Savipāka—5]
analyzed: indriya hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka magga vippayutta atthi avigatanti na ārammaṇe ekam pe no vigate eka
translated: Conditioned by faculty, cause, and conascence, and mutual dependence, and not by object, and so on.

original: Sahetādhipati-maggaghaṭanā
analyzed: saheta adhipati magga ghaṭanā
translated: The method of combining the conditions with cause and predominance is as follows:

original: Indriya hetādhipati sahajāta nissaya magga atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe cattāri, naanantare🔽cattāri, nasamanantare cattāri, naaññamaññe dve, naupanissaye cattāri, napurejāte🔽cattāri, napacchājāte cattāri, naāsevane cattāri, nakamme cattāri, navipāke cattāri,🔽naāhāre cattāri, najhāne cattāri, nasampayutte dve, navippayutte dve, nonatthiyā
analyzed: indriya hetu ādhipati sahajāta nissaya magga atthi avigata nti na ārammaṇe cattāri na anantare  cattāri na samanantare cattāri na aññamaññe dve na upanissaye cattāri na purejāte  cattāri na pacchājāte cattāri na āsevane cattāri na kamme cattāri na vipāke cattāri  na āhāre cattāri na jhāne cattāri na sampayutte dve na vippayutte dve no natthiyā
translated: Conditioned by faculty, cause, predominance, and path, and not by object, there are four.

original: cattāri, novigate cattāri.
analyzed: cattāri no vigate cattāri
translated: There are four not by proximity, four not by contiguity, four not by presence, two not by absence, four not by kamma, four not by nutriment, four not by faculty, four not by jhāna, two not by association, two not by non-causality, four not by presence, four not by disappearance, four not by arising, four not by cessation, four not by taints, four not by the path, two not by fruit, and four not by the unformed element.

analyzed: indriya hetā adhipati sahajāta aññamañña nissaya magga sampayutta atthi avigatanti

translated: With respect to “path” as conascence, mutuality, dependence, result, and dissociation, there is “present” as non-disappearance. With respect to “not cause” there is one. … With respect to “not-non-disappearance” there is one.

original: Magga sahajāta nissaya indriya atthi avigatanti nahetuyā satta …pe… naaññamaññe tīṇi,
analyzed: magga sahajāta nissaya indriya atthi avigatanti na hetuyā satta pe na aññamaññe tīṇi
translated: With respect to “path” as conascence, dependence, and faculty, there is “present” as non-disappearance. With respect to “not cause” there are seven. … With respect to “not mutuality” there are three. …

original: naupanissaye satta …pe… nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā satta, novigate satta.
analyzed: na upanissaye satta pe na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā satta no vigate satta
translated: With respect to “not decisive-support” there are seven. … With respect to “not association” there are three. … With respect to “not dissociation” there are three. … With respect to “not presence” there are seven. … With respect to “not non-disappearance” there are seven.

translated: Dependent Origination, etc.

translated: With respect to the root cause, there are three. … With respect to the presence, there are three. 🔽With respect to the support, there is one. … With respect to the presence, there is one.

translated: With respect to the path, there is one condition (as) a conascence condition, a mutuality condition, a result condition, a faculty condition, a absorption condition, a presence condition, and an absence condition.🔽With respect to the path, there is one condition (as) a conascence condition, a mutuality condition, a result condition, a faculty condition, a absorption condition, a presence condition, and an absence condition.

translated: With respect to the path, there is one condition (as) a result condition, a faculty condition, a absorption condition, and an absence condition.🔽With respect to the path, there is one condition (as) a result condition, a faculty condition, a absorption condition, and an absence condition.🔽With respect to the path, there is one condition (as) a result condition, a faculty condition, a absorption condition, and an absence condition.🔽With respect to the path, there is one condition (as) a result condition, a faculty condition, a absorption condition, and an absence condition.

translated: With respect to the path, there is one condition (as) a conascence condition, a support condition, a faculty condition, and an absence condition.🔽With respect to the path, there is one condition (as) a conascence condition, a support condition, a kamma condition, a nutriment condition, a faculty condition, and an absence condition.🔽With respect to the path, there is one condition (as) a conascence condition, a support condition, a kamma condition, a nutriment condition, a faculty condition, and an absence condition.

original: tīṇi, naupanissaye satta …pe… nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā satta, novigate satta.
analyzed: tīṇi na upanissaye satta pe na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā satta no vigate satta
translated: With respect to the path, there is one condition (as) a conascence condition, a support condition, a kamma condition, a nutriment condition, a faculty condition, and an absence condition.

original: Magga adhipati sahajāta aññamañña nissaya indriya sampayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi …pe… novigate tīṇi.🔽Magga adhipati sahajāta nissaya indriya vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi …pe… novigate tīṇi. [Avipāka—3]

translated: With respect to the root cause, there are three possibilities for the path as a dominant condition, and so on. … With respect to the root cause, there are three possibilities for the path as a non-disappearance condition, and so on.🔽With respect to the root cause, there are three possibilities for the path as a dominant condition, and so on, excluding the support condition. … With respect to the root cause, there are three possibilities for the path as a non-disappearance condition, and so on, excluding the support condition.🔽With respect to the root cause, there are three possibilities for the path as a dominant condition, and so on, excluding the support condition and the result condition. … With respect to the root cause, there are three possibilities for the path as a non-disappearance condition, and so on, excluding the support condition and the result condition.

original: Magga adhipati sahajāta nissaya vipāka indriya atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ …pe… novigate ekaṁ.🔽Magga adhipati sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka indriya sampayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ …pe… novigate ekaṁ.

translated: With respect to the root cause, there are three possibilities for the path as a dominant condition, and so on, excluding the support condition, the result condition, and the condition by way of association. … With respect to the root cause, there are three possibilities for the path as a non-disappearance condition, and so on, excluding the support condition, the result condition, and the condition by way of association.

original: Magga adhipati sahajāta nissaya vipāka indriya vippayutta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ …pe… novigate ekaṁ. [Savipāka—3]
analyzed: magga adhipati sahajāta nissaya vipāka indriya vippayutta atthi avigatanti na hetuyā ekam pe no vigate eka
translated: With respect to the root cause, there are three possibilities for the path as a dominant condition, and so on, excluding the support condition, the result condition, and the condition by way of dissociation. … With respect to the root cause, there are three possibilities for the path as a non-disappearance condition, and so on, excluding the support condition, the result condition, and the condition by way of dissociation.

original: Sahetu-indriyaghaṭanā
analyzed: sa hetu indriya ghaṭanā
translated: The method of combining the conditions with the faculties

original: Magga hetu sahajāta nissaya indriya atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe cattāri …pe… naaññamaññe
analyzed: magga hetu sahajāta nissaya indriya atthi avigatanti na ārammaṇe cattāri pe na aññamaññe
translated: With respect to the root cause, there are four possibilities for the path as a condition by way of decisive support, and so on, excluding the object condition. … With respect to the root cause, there are four possibilities for the path as a condition by way of decisive support, and so on, excluding the condition by way of association.

original: dve, naupanissaye cattāri …pe… nasampayutte dve, navippayutte dve, nonatthiyā cattāri, novigate cattāri.
analyzed: dve na upanissaye cattāri pe na sampayutte dve na vippayutte dve no natthiyā cattāri no vigate cattāri
translated: With respect to non-dependence, there are four … With respect to non-concomitance, there are two … With respect to non-disappearance, there are four … With respect to non-restraint, there are four.

original: Magga hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissaya indriya atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe dve …pe… nasampayutte ekaṁ, navippayutte dve, nonatthiyā dve, novigate dve.🔽Magga hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissaya indriya sampayutta atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe dve …pe… novigate dve.🔽Magga hetu sahajāta nissaya indriya vippayutta atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe dve …pe… novigate dve. [Avipāka—4]
analyzed: magga hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissaya indriya atthi avigatanti na ārammaṇe dve pe na sampayutte eka na vippayutte dve no natthiyāḥ dve no vigate dve  magga hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissaya indriya sampayutta atthi avigatanti na ārammaṇe dve pe no vigate dve  magga hetu sahajāta nissaya indriya vippayutta atthi avigatanti na ārammaṇe dve pe no vigate dve
translated: With respect to the path, there are two conditions that are causes, co-nascent, and mutually-related, and that are faculties, and that are present, and that are not absent. … With respect to non-object, there are two … With respect to non-concomitance, there is one … With respect to non-disappearance, there are two … With respect to non-restraint, there are two.🔽With respect to the path, there are two conditions that are causes, co-nascent, and mutually-related, and that are faculties, and that are conjoined, and that are present, and that are not absent. … With respect to non-restraint, there are two.🔽With respect to the path, there are two conditions that are causes, co-nascent, and mutually-related, and that are faculties, and that are not conjoined, and that are present, and that are not absent. … With respect to non-restraint, there are two.

original: Magga hetu sahajāta nissaya vipāka indriya atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: magga hetu sahajāta nissaya vipāka indriya atthi avigata nti na ārammaṇe ekam pe no vigate eka
translated: With respect to the path, there are two conditions that are causes, co-nascent, and mutually-related, and that are faculties, and that are results, and that are present, and that are not absent. … With respect to non-restraint, there is one.

original: Magga hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipākaṁ indriya atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: magga hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipākaṃ indriya atthi avigatanti na ārammaṇe ekam pe no vigate eka
translated: With respect to the path, there are two conditions that are causes, co-nascent, and mutually-related, and that are faculties, and that are results, and that are conjoined, and that are present, and that are not absent. … With respect to non-restraint, there is one.

original: Magga hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka indriya sampayutta atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… novigate ekaṁ.🔽Magga hetu sahajāta nissaya vipāka indriya vippayutta atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: magga hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka indriya sampayutta atthi avigatanti na ārammaṇe ekam pe no vigate eka  magga hetu sahajāta nissaya vipāka indriya vippayutta atthi avigatanti na ārammaṇe ekam pe no vigate eka
translated: “Path” as a condition, and as conascence, and as mutuality, and as support, and as nutriment, and as a faculty, and as association, and as presence, and as non-disappearance: there is no object in one, and so down to no non-disappearance in one.🔽“Path” as a condition, and as conascence, and as support, and as nutriment, and as a faculty, and as dissociation, and as presence, and as non-disappearance: there is no object in one, and so down to no non-disappearance in one.

original: Magga hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka indriya vippayutta atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… novigate ekaṁ. [Savipāka—5]🔽Sahetādhipati-indriyaghaṭanā🔽Magga hetādhipati sahajāta nissaya indriya atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe cattāri …pe…🔽naaññamaññe dve, naupanissaye cattāri …pe… nasampayutte dve, navippayutte dve, nonatthiyā
analyzed: magga hetu sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka indriya vippayutta atthi avigatanti na ārammaṇe ekam pe no vigate eka  saheta adhipati indriya ghaṭanā  magga hetā adhipati sahajāta nissaya indriya atthi avigata nti na ārammaṇe cattāri pe na aññamaññe dve na upanissaye cattāri pe na sampayutte dve na vippayutte dve no natthiyā
translated: With respect to the condition being a path and a cause, and being conascence, mutuality, support, and result, and being a faculty, and being conjoined, there is one permutation. … With respect to the condition being a path and a cause, and being conascence, support, and result, and being a faculty, and being dissociated, there is one permutation. … With respect to the condition being a path and a cause, and being conascence, mutuality, support, and result, and being a faculty, and being dissociated, there is one permutation. …

original: cattāri, novigate cattāri.
analyzed: cattāri no vigate cattāri
translated: With respect to the condition being a path and a cause, and being a decisive support, and being a faculty, and being present, there are four permutations. … With respect to the condition being a path and a cause, and being a decisive support, and being a faculty, and being absent, there are four permutations. … With respect to the condition being a path and a cause, and being a decisive support, and being a faculty, and being present or absent, there are four permutations. …

original: Magga hetādhipati sahajāta aññamañña nissaya indriya sampayutta atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe dve …pe… novigate dve.
analyzed: magga hetā adhipati sahajāta aññamañña nissaya indriya sampayutta atthi avigatanti na ārammaṇe dve pe no vigate dve
translated: With respect to the condition being a path and a cause, and being a decisive support, and being a faculty, and being conjoined, there are two permutations. … With respect to the condition being a path and a cause, and being a decisive support, and being a faculty, and being conjoined or being absent, there are two permutations. …

original: Magga hetādhipati sahajāta nissaya indriya vippayutta atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe dve …pe… novigate dve. [Avipāka—3]🔽Magga hetādhipati sahajāta nissaya vipāka indriya atthi avigatanti na ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… novigate ekaṁ.🔽Magga hetādhipati sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka indriya sampayutta atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: magga hetā adhipati sahajāta nissaya indriya vippayutta atthi avigata nti na ārammaṇe dve pe no vigate dve  magga hetā adhipati sahajāta nissaya vipāka indriya atthi avigatanti na ārammaṇe ekam pe novigate eka  magga hetā adhipati sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka indriya sampayutta atthi avigatanti na ārammaṇe ekam pe no vigate eka
translated: In the section on the root cause, etc., there are two in the condition by way of object, etc., and two in the non-disappearance. [Non-Resultant]🔽In the section on the root cause, etc., there is one in the condition by way of object, etc., and one in the non-disappearance.🔽In the section on the root cause, etc., there is one in the condition by way of object, etc., and one in the non-disappearance.

original: Magga hetādhipati sahajāta nissaya vipāka indriya vippayutta atthi avigatanti naārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… novigate ekaṁ. [Savipāka—3]
analyzed: magga hetā adhipati sahajāta nissaya vipāka indriya vippayutta atthi avigatanti na ārammaṇe ekam pe no vigate eka
translated: In the section on the root cause, etc., there is one in the condition by way of object, etc., and one in the non-disappearance. [Resultant]

original: Maggamūlakaṁ.
analyzed: maggamūlaka
translated: The section on the path.

original: Sampayuttaduka🔽Sampayuttapaccayā nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi,
analyzed: sampayutta duka  sampayutta paccayā na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na anantare tīṇi
translated: The dyad on association🔽In the condition by way of association, there are three in the absence of the cause, three in the absence of the object, three in the absence of the dominant condition, three in the absence of the antecedent,🔽three in the absence of the proximity, three in the absence of the contiguity, three in the absence of the support, three in the absence of the prior, three in the absence of the arising together,

original: nasamanantare tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane
analyzed: na samanantare tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane
translated: three in the absence of the post-arising, three in the absence of the repetition,

original: tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi, naindriye tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge
analyzed: tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi na indriye tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge
translated: Three, three, three, three, three, three, three,🔽three, three, three, three, three, three.

original: tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: The section on the connected triads is finished.

original: Sampayuttaghaṭanā
analyzed: sampayutta ghaṭanā
translated: The connected dyads

original: Sampayutta sahajāta aññamañña nissaya atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi …pe… novigate tīṇi. [Avipāka—1]🔽Sampayutta sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ …pe… novigate ekaṁ. [Savipāka—1]
analyzed: sampayutta sahajāta aññamañña nissaya atthi avigatanti na hetuyā tīṇi pe no vigate tīṇi  sampayutta sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka atthi avigatanti na hetuyā ekam pe no vigate eka
translated: With the connected, the produced together, the reciprocal, the support, the present, and the not absent: with the not cause, three … with the not object, three … with the not condition, three … with the not prior, three … with the not proximate, three … with the not decisive-support, three … with the not-not decisive-support, three … with the not-after, three … with the not-before, three … with the not-present, three … with the not-absent, three.

original: Sampayuttamūlakaṁ.
analyzed: sampayutta mūlaka
translated: With the connected, the produced together, the reciprocal, the support, the result, and the not absent: with the not cause, one … with the not object, one … with the not condition, one … with the not prior, one … with the not proximate, one … with the not decisive-support, one … with the not-not decisive-support, one … with the not-after, one … with the not-before, one … with the not-present, one … with the not-absent, one.🔽The connected dyads are finished.

original: Vippayuttaduka🔽Vippayuttapaccayā nahetuyā pañca, naārammaṇe pañca, naadhipatiyā pañca, naanantare🔽pañca, nasamanantare pañca, nasahajāte pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, nanissaye tīṇi,

translated: The unconnected dyads

analyzed: na upanissaye pañca na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte pañca na āsevane pañca na kamme
translated: With the unconnected condition, with the not cause, five … with the not object, five … with the not condition, five … with the not prior, five … with the not proximate, five … with the not produced together, five … with the not-pendent, five … with the not support, five … with the not-supported, five … with the not-possession, five … with the not-decisive-support, three … with the not-not decisive-support, five … with the not-after, three … with the not-before, five … with the not-present, five … with the not-absent, five …

analyzed: pañca na vipāke pañca na āhāre pañca na aindriye pañca na jhāne pañca na magge pañca

translated: in the not-associated five, in the not-absent five, in the not-contiguous five.

analyzed: na anantare pañca na samanantare pañca na sahajāte pañca na aññamaññe pañca na nissaye  tīṇi na upanissaye pañca na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte pañca na āsevane pañca na kamme

translated: There are four in the clause “not as proximity” and in the clause “not as non-disappearance”, there is one in the clause “not as conascence”, there are four in the clause “not as mutuality”, there are three in the clause “not as support”,🔽there are three in the clause “not as prenascence”, there are four in the clause “not as postnascence”, there are four in the clause “not as nutriment” and in the clause “not as kamma-result” and in the clause “not as faculty” and in the clause “not as path” and in the clause “not as association”, there are four in the clause “not as presence” and in the clause “not as disappearance”.

With respect to the clause “dissociated, support, faculty, past, not-disappeared”, there are four. With respect to the clause “dissociated, support, faculty, future, not-disappeared”, there are four.

analyzed: tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi  pakiṇṇaka ghaṭanā  vippayutta pacchājāta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā  tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na sahajāte tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na nissaye

analyzed: na indriye tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: There are three lines beginning with “not in the immediately preceding” and ending with “not in the nutriment” and “not in the faculties” and “not in the jhānas” and “not in the path” and “not in the associated” and “not in the absent” and “not in the opposites”.

original: Vippayutta ārammaṇa adhipati nissaya upanissaya purejāta atthi avigatanti nahetuyā
analyzed: vippayutta ārammaṇa adhipati nissaya upanissaya purejāta atthi avigata nti na hetuyā
translated: Dissociated, object, dominant, support, decisive support, prenascence, present, not absent, not opposite. Not cause,

original: ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, napacchājāte
analyzed: na anantare eka na samanantare eka na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe eka na pacchājāte
translated: one; not proximity, one; not contiguity, one; not conascence, one; not mutuality, one; not postnascence,

original: ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ,
analyzed: na āsevane eka na kamme eka na vipāke eka na āhāre eka na indriye eka
translated: one; not nutriment, one; not action, one; not result, one; not food, one; not faculty, one;

original: najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.🔽Vippayutta nissaya purejāta indriya atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe ekaṁ,
analyzed: na jhāne na magge eka na sampayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka  vippayutta nissaya purejāta indriya atthi avigata nti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe eka
translated: not jhāna, one; not path, one; not association, one; not absence, one; not opposition, one.🔽Support, prenascence, faculty, present, not absent, not opposite. Not cause, one; not object, one;

original: naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe
analyzed: na adhipatiyāḥ eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe
translated: not dominant, one; not proximity, one; not contiguity, one; not conascence, one; not mutuality,🔽one;

original: ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke
analyzed: eka na upanissaye eka na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na vipāke
translated: one in the condition being –, one in the support –, one in the post-nascence –, one in the pre-arising –, one in the action –, one in the result –,

original: ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na āhāre eka na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: one in the nutriment –, one in the jhāna –, one in the path –, one in the association –, one in the absence –, one in the presence –.

original: Sahajātaghaṭanā
analyzed: sahajāta ghaṭanā
translated: The combination of the conascent.🔽The absence –, the presence –.🔽The combination of the conascent, the mutuality, the support, the presence, the absence.🔽In the absence –, the presence –.

original: Vippayutta sahajāta nissaya atthi avigatanti nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā🔽tīṇi, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte🔽tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, naāhāre tīṇi,
analyzed: vippayutta sahajāta nissaya atthi avigata nti na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā  tīṇi na anantare tīṇi na samanantare tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte  tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na āhāre tīṇi
translated: The combination of the conascent, the mutuality, the support, the presence, the absence, the root-cause, the object, the predominance,

original: naindriye tīṇi, najhāne tīṇi, namagge tīṇi, nasampayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na indriye tīṇi na jhāne tīṇi na magge tīṇi na sampayutte tīṇi no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: the proximity, the contiguity, the dependence, the association, the dissociation, the presence, the absence.🔽The combination of the conascent, the mutuality, the support, the presence, the absence, the root-cause, the object, the predominance,

original: Vippayutta sahajāta aññamañña nissaya atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe
analyzed: vippayutta sahajāta aññamañña nissaya atthi avigata nti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe
translated: the proximity, the contiguity, the dependence, the association, the dissociation, the presence, the absence, the root-cause, the object, the predominance,🔽the proximity, the contiguity, the dependence, the association, the dissociation, the presence, the absence, the root-cause, the object, the predominance,🔽the proximity, the contiguity, the dependence, the association, the dissociation, the presence, the absence, the root-cause, the object, the predominance,🔽the proximity, the contiguity, the dependence, the association, the dissociation, the presence, the absence, the root-cause, the object, the predominance,🔽the proximity, the contiguity, the dependence, the association, the dissociation, the presence, the absence, the root-cause, the object, the predominance,🔽the proximity, the contiguity, the dependence, the association, the dissociation, the presence, the absence, the root-cause, the object, the predominance,🔽the proximity, the contiguity, the dependence, the association, the dissociation, the presence, the absence, the root-cause, the object, the predominance,🔽the proximity, the contiguity, the dependence, the association, the dissociation, the presence, the absence, the root-cause, the object, the predominance,🔽the proximity, the contiguity, the dependence, the association, the dissociation, the presence, the

original: ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ,🔽napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, navipāke ekaṁ,
analyzed: na adhipatiyā eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na upanissaye eka  na purejāte na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na vipāke eka
translated: one, not as dominant condition, one, not as prenascence condition, one, not as postnascence condition, one, not as support condition,🔽one, not as pre-arising condition, one, not as post-arising condition, one, not as repetition condition, one, not as kamma condition, one, not as result condition,

original: naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā
analyzed: na āhāre na indriye eka na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka no natthiyām
translated: one, not as nutriment condition, one, not as faculty condition, one, not as path condition, one, not as association condition, one, not as absence condition,

original: ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ. [Avipāka—2]
analyzed: eka
translated: one, not as disappearance condition. [Not a Result]

original: Vippayutta sahajāta nissaya vipāka atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe ekaṁ,
analyzed: vippayutta sahajāta nissaya vipāka atthi avigatanti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe eka
translated: Associated, conascence, dependence, result, present, not absent: not as cause one, not as object one,

original: naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naaññamaññe ekaṁ, naupanissaye
analyzed: na adhipatiyā eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na aññamaññe eka na upanissaye
translated: not as dominant one, not as prenascence one, not as postnascence one, not as repetition one, not as support one,

original: ekaṁ, napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ,
analyzed: na purejāte eka na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na āhāre eka
translated: not as pre-arising one, not as post-arising one, not as nutriment one, not as faculty one, not as path one, not as association one, not as absence one,

original: naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: na indriye eka na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: not as disappearance one.

original: Vippayutta sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka atthi avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe🔽ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ,
analyzed: vippayutta sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka atthi avigatanti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe  na adhipatiyā eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na upanissaye eka
translated: one in the absence of an Object,

original: napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye
analyzed: na purejāte na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na āhāre eka na indriye
translated: one in the absence of a Pre-nascent, one in the absence of a Post-nascent, one in the absence of a Nutriment, one in the absence of a Faculty,

original: ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ. [Savipāka—2]
analyzed: na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: one in the absence of a Path, one in the absence of an Associated, one in the absence of a Non-existent, and one in the absence of a Disappeared.

original: Vippayuttamūlakaṁ.
translated: With the Dissociated.

original: Atthiduka
analyzed: atthiduka
translated: The Dyad on Existence

original: Atthipaccayā nahetuyā terasa, naārammaṇe terasa, naadhipatiyā terasa, naanantare
analyzed: atthi paccayā na hetuyā terasa na ārammaṇe terasa na adhipatiyā terasa na anantare
translated: With Existence as Condition, there are thirteen in the absence of a Root Cause, thirteen in the absence of an Object, thirteen in the absence of a Dominant, thirteen in the absence of a Pre-nascent,

original: terasa, nasamanantare terasa, nasahajāte satta, naaññamaññe satta, nanissaye satta,
analyzed: terasa na samanantare terasa na sahajāte satta na aññamaññe satta na nissaye satta
translated: thirteen in the absence of a Post-nascent, seven in the absence of a Conascent, seven in the absence of a Reciprocal, seven in the absence of a Support,

original: naupanissaye terasa, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte terasa, naāsevane terasa, nakamme
analyzed: na upanissaye terasa na purejāte nava na pacchājāte terasa na āsevane terasa na kamme
translated: thirteen in the absence of a Pre-condition, nine in the absence of a Post-condition, thirteen in the absence of a Nutriment, thirteen in the absence of a Kamma,🔽thirteen in the absence of a Result, thirteen in the absence of a Pre-birth, thirteen in the absence of a Life Continuum, thirteen in the absence of a Death, thirteen in the absence of a Birth, thirteen in the absence of an Appearance, thirteen in the absence of a Non-disappearance, thirteen in the absence of an Ascertainable, and thirteen in the absence of an Unascertainable.

original: terasa, navipāke terasa, naāhāre terasa, naindriye terasa, najhāne terasa, namagge
analyzed: terasa na vipāke terasa na āhāre terasa na aindriye terasa na jhāne terasa na magge
translated: There are thirteen in the clause “not as object” and thirteen in the clause “not as root-cause” and thirteen in the clause “not as condition”.

original: terasa, nasampayutte satta, navippayutte pañca, nonatthiyā terasa, novigate terasa.
analyzed: terasa na sampayutte satta na vippayutte pañca no natthiyā terasa no vigate terasa
translated: There are seven in the clause “not as conascence” and five in the clause “not as non-conascence” and thirteen in the clause “not as presence” and thirteen in the clause “not as non-disappearance”.

original: Atthimissakaghaṭanā
analyzed: atthi missaka ghaṭanā
translated: The Combination with the “Is”

original: Atthi avigatanti nahetuyā terasa, naārammaṇe terasa, naadhipatiyā terasa, naanantare🔽terasa, nasamanantare terasa, nasahajāte satta, naaññamaññe satta, nanissaye satta,🔽naupanissaye terasa, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte terasa, naāsevane terasa, nakamme🔽terasa, navipāke terasa, naāhāre terasa, naindriye terasa, najhāne terasa, namagge
analyzed: atthi avigatanti na hetuyā terasa na ārammaṇe terasa na adhipatiyā terasa na anantare  terasa na samanantare terasa na sahajāte satta na aññamaññe satta na nissaye satta  na upanissaye terasa na purejāte nava na pacchājāte terasa na āsevane terasa na kamme  terasa na vipāke terasa na āhāre terasa na aindriye terasa na jhāne terasa na magge
translated: As to “is not dissociated”: there are thirteen in the clause “not as root-cause” and thirteen in the clause “not as object” and thirteen in the clause “not as predominance” and thirteen in the clause “not as proximity” …

original: terasa, nasampayutte satta, navippayutte pañca, nonatthiyā terasa, novigate terasa.
analyzed: terasa na sampayutte satta na vippayutte pañca no natthiyā terasa no vigate terasa
translated: … thirteen in the clause “not as contiguity” and seven in the clause “not as conascence” and seven in the clause “not as mutuality” and seven in the clause “not as support” and seven in the clause “not as prenascence” and seven in the clause “not as postnascence” and thirteen in the clause “not as nutriment” and thirteen in the clause “not as faculty” and thirteen in the clause “not as jhāna” and thirteen in the clause “not as path” and thirteen in the clause “not as association” and five in the clause “not as non-disappearance” and thirteen in the clause “not as presence” and thirteen in the clause “not as non-disappearance”.

original: Atthi nissaya avigatanti nahetuyā terasa, naārammaṇe terasa, naadhipatiyā terasa,
analyzed: atthi nissaya avigatanti na hetuyā terasa na ārammaṇe terasa na adhipatiyā terasa
translated: As to “is a condition, is not dissociated”: there are thirteen in the clause “not as root-cause” and thirteen in the clause “not as object” and thirteen in the clause “not as predominance” …🔽…

original: naanantare terasa, nasamanantare terasa, nasahajāte tīṇi, naaññamaññe satta, naupanissaye🔽terasa, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte terasa, naāsevane terasa, nakamme terasa, navipāke
analyzed: na anantare terasa na samanantare terasa na sahajāte tīṇi na aññamaññe satta na upanissaye  terasa na purejāte nava na pacchājāte terasa na āsevane terasa na kamme terasa na vipāke
translated: There are thirteen in the clause “not as object.” There are thirteen in the clause “not as proximity.” There are three in the clause “not as conascence.” There are seven in the clause “not as mutuality.”🔽There are thirteen in the clause “not as support.”

original: terasa, naāhāre terasa, naindriye terasa, najhāne terasa, namagge terasa, nasampayutte
analyzed: terasa na āhāre terasa na aindriye terasa na jhāne terasa na magge terasa na sampayutte
translated: There are nine in the clause “not as prenascence.” There are thirteen in the clause “not as postnascence.” There are thirteen in the clause “not as nutriment.” There are thirteen in the clause “not as faculty.” There are thirteen in the clause “not as jhāna.” There are thirteen in the clause “not as path.”

original: satta, navippayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā terasa, novigate terasa.
analyzed: satta na vippayutte tīṇi no natthiyā terasa no vigate terasa
translated: There are seven in the clause “not as association.” There are three in the clause “not as dissociation.” There are thirteen in the clause “not as presence.” There are thirteen in the clause “not as absence.”

original: Atthi adhipati avigatanti nahetuyā aṭṭha, naārammaṇe satta, naanantare aṭṭha, nasamanantare🔽aṭṭha, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe cattāri, nanissaye ekaṁ, naupanissaye satta,🔽napurejāte satta, napacchājāte aṭṭha, naāsevane aṭṭha, nakamme aṭṭha, navipāke aṭṭha,
analyzed: atthi adhipati avigata nti na hetuyā aṭṭha na ārammaṇe satta na anantare aṭṭha na samanantare  na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe cattāri na nissaye eka na upanissaye satta  na purejāte satta na pacchājāte aṭṭha na āsevane aṭṭha na kamme aṭṭha na vipāke aṭṭha
translated: “There is a dominant, not non-disappeared” : there are eight in the clause “not as root-cause.” There are seven in the clause “not as object.” There are eight in the clause “not as proximity.” There are eight in the clause “not as contiguity.”🔽There is one in the clause “not as conascence.” There are four in the clause “not as mutuality.” There is one in the clause “not as support.” There are seven in the clause “not as absence of support.”

original: naāhāre aṭṭha, naindriye aṭṭha, najhāne aṭṭha, namagge aṭṭha, nasampayutte cattāri,
analyzed: na āhāre aṭṭha na indriye aṭṭha na jhāne aṭṭha na magge aṭṭha na sampayutte cattāri
translated: There are seven in the clause “not as prenascence.” There are eight in the clause “not as postnascence.” There are eight in the clause “not as nutriment.” There are eight in the clause “not as faculty.” There are eight in the clause “not as jhāna.” There are eight in the clause “not as path.” There are four in the clause “not as association.”

original: navippayutte cattāri, nonatthiyā aṭṭha, novigate aṭṭha.🔽Atthi adhipati nissaya avigatanti nahetuyā aṭṭha, naārammaṇe satta, naanantare aṭṭha,
analyzed: na vippayutte cattāri no natthiyāḥ aṭṭha no vigate aṭṭha  atthi adhipati nissaya avigata nti na hetuyā aṭṭha na ārammaṇe satta na anantare aṭṭha
translated: There are four in regard to non-disappearance. There are eight in regard to non-disconnection. There are eight in regard to non-going.🔽There are eight in regard to presence and support, but not in regard to cause. There are seven in regard to object. There are eight in regard to proximity.

original: nasamanantare aṭṭha, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe cattāri, naupanissaye satta, napurejāte🔽satta, napacchājāte aṭṭha, naāsevane aṭṭha, nakamme aṭṭha, navipāke aṭṭha, naāhāre🔽aṭṭha, naindriye aṭṭha, najhāne aṭṭha, namagge aṭṭha, nasampayutte cattāri, navippayutte
analyzed: na samanantare aṭṭha na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe cattāri na upanissaye satta na purejāte  satta na pacchājāte aṭṭha na āsevane aṭṭha na kamme aṭṭha na vipāke aṭṭha na āhāre  na aindriye aṭṭha na jhāne aṭṭha na magge aṭṭha na sampayutte cattāri na vippayutte
translated: There are eight in regard to non-contiguity. There is one in regard to co-arising. There are four in regard to mutuality. There are seven in regard to support. There are seven in regard to prenascence.🔽There are eight in regard to postnascence. There are eight in regard to nutriment. There are eight in regard to action. There are eight in regard to result. There are eight in regard to nutriment.🔽There are eight in regard to faculty. There are eight in regard to path. There are eight in regard to jhāna. There are four in regard to association. There are three in regard to non-disappearance.

original: tīṇi, nonatthiyā aṭṭha, novigate aṭṭha.
analyzed: tīṇi nonatthiyāḥ aṭṭha no vigate aṭṭha
translated: There are eight in regard to non-disconnection.

original: Atthi āhāra avigatanti nahetuyā satta, naārammaṇe satta, naadhipatiyā satta, naanantare
analyzed: atthi āhāra avigatanti na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe satta na adhipatiyā satta na anantare
translated: There are seven in regard to nutriment and presence, but not in regard to cause. There are seven in regard to object. There are seven in regard to support. There are seven in regard to proximity.

original: satta, nasamanantare satta, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe tīṇi, nanissaye ekaṁ, naupanissaye
analyzed: satta na samanantare satta na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe tīṇi na nissaye eka na upanissaye
translated: There are seven in regard to non-contiguity. There is one in regard to co-arising. There are three in regard to mutuality. There is one in regard to dependence. There are none in regard to support.

original: satta, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte satta, naāsevane satta, nakamme satta, navipāke
analyzed: satta na purejāte satta na pacchājāte satta na āsevane satta na kamme satta na vipāke
translated: There are seven in regard to the prenascent, seven in regard to the postnascent, seven in regard to condition, seven in regard to non-causality, seven in regard to result,

original: satta, naindriye satta, najhāne satta, namagge satta, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte
analyzed: satta na indriye satta na jhāne satta na magge satta na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte
translated: seven in regard to the faculties, seven in regard to the path, seven in regard to the jhānas, seven in regard to association, three in regard to dissociation,

original: tīṇi, nonatthiyā satta, novigate satta.
analyzed: tīṇi no natthiyā satta no vigate satta
translated: three in regard to the unconditioned, seven in regard to the unincluded.🔽There are seven in regard to the faculties that are not dissociated.

original: Atthi indriya avigatanti nahetuyā satta, naārammaṇe satta, naadhipatiyā satta, naanantare🔽satta, nasamanantare satta, nasahajāte ekaṁ, naaññamaññe tīṇi, nanissaye ekaṁ, naupanissaye🔽satta, napurejāte satta, napacchājāte satta, naāsevane satta, nakamme satta, navipāke
analyzed: atthi indriya avigatanti na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe satta na adhipatiyā satta na anantare  satta na samanantare satta na sahajāte eka na aññamaññe tīṇi na nissaye eka na upanissaye  satta na purejāte satta na pacchājāte satta na āsevane satta na kamme satta na vipāke
translated: There are seven in regard to the conditions that are not roots, seven in regard to the conditions that are not objects, seven in regard to the conditions that are not predominances, seven in regard to the conditions that are not proximity,🔽seven in regard to the conditions that are not contiguity, seven in regard to the conditions that are not conascence, one in regard to the conditions that are not mutuality, three in regard to the conditions that are not support, one in regard to the conditions that are not dependence,

original: satta, naāhāre satta, najhāne satta, namagge satta, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte
analyzed: satta na āhāre satta na jhāne satta na magge satta na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte

translated: three in regard to the conditions that are not dissociation, seven in regard to the conditions that are not the unconditioned, seven in regard to the conditions that are not the unincluded.🔽There are seven in regard to the conditions that are supports and are not dissociated.

translated: With object, support, prenascence, dissociation, non-disappearance: with non-cause, three; with non-dominance,🔽three; with non-antecedent, three; with non-conascence, three; with non-kamma, three; with non-result, three; with non-nutriment, three;🔽with non-faculty, three; with non-path, three; with non-association, three; with non-non-causality, three; with non-disappearance, three.🔽With object, dominance, support, prenascence, non-disappearance: with non-cause, one; with non-antecedent,🔽one;
