original: naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ.🔽Atthi sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka vippayutta avigatanti nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe
analyzed: na indriye eka na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka  atthi sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka vippayutta avigatanti na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe
translated: In the case of faculties, in the case of jhānas, in the case of paths, in the case of non-concomitance, in the case of non-causality, in the case of non-deprivation, there is one.🔽There is, in the case of conascence, mutuality, support, kamma result, non-concomitance, and non-deprivation, one.

original: ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā ekaṁ, naanantare ekaṁ, nasamanantare ekaṁ, naupanissaye ekaṁ,
analyzed: na adhipatiyā eka na anantare eka na samanantare eka na upanissaye eka
translated: In the case of the decisive-support, in the case of the prenascence, in the case of the postnascence, in the case of repetition, in the case of action, in the case of nutriment, in the case of faculties, in the case of jhānas, in the case of paths, in the case of non-concomitance, in the case of non-deprivation, there is one.

original: napurejāte ekaṁ, napacchājāte ekaṁ, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme ekaṁ, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye🔽ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā ekaṁ, novigate ekaṁ. [Savipāka—5]
analyzed: na purejāte na pacchājāte eka na āsevane eka na kamme eka na āhāre eka na indriye  na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte eka no natthiyāḥ eka no vigate eka
translated: In the case of kamma-result, in the case of the prenascence, in the case of the postnascence, in the case of repetition, in the case of nutriment, in the case of faculties, in the case of jhānas, in the case of paths, in the case of non-concomitance, in the case of non-deprivation, there is one.

original: Atthimūlakaṁ.🔽Natthi-vigataduka
analyzed: atthimūlaka  natthi vigata duka
translated: The section on the existent.🔽The pair: existent and non-existent.

original: Natthipaccayā nahetuyā satta …pe… vigatapaccayā nahetuyā satta …pe…. (Natthipaccayampi vigatapaccayampi anantarapaccayasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: natthi paccayā na hetuyā satta pe vigata paccayā na hetuyā satta pe natthi paccayampi vigata paccayampi anantara paccaya sadisa
translated: With non-existence as condition, in the case of non-cause there are seven … With disappearance as condition, in the case of non-cause there are seven … (As in the case of the prior condition, the same method is used in the case of the subsequent condition.)

original: Avigataduka
analyzed: avigata duka
translated: The pair: non-disappearance and non-deprivation.

original: Avigatapaccayā nahetuyā terasa …. (Yathā atthipaccayo vitthārito evaṁ avigatapaccayo vitthāretabbo.)🔽Pañhāvārassa anulomapaccanīyaṁ.
analyzed: avigata paccayāḥ na hetuyā terasa yathā atthi paccayaḥ vitthāritaḥ evam avigata paccayaḥ vitthāretabbaḥ  pañhāvārassa anuloma paccanīya
translated: With the condition not-disappearance, there are thirteen with the condition not-a-root. (As the condition existence was expanded, so the condition not-disappearance should be expanded.)🔽The question section in forward order and reverse order is finished.

original: 1.2.7.4. Paccayapaccanīyānuloma
analyzed: paccaya paccanīya anuloma
translated: The section on conditions in forward order and reverse order is finished.

original: Nahetuduka
analyzed: na hetu duka
translated: The pair: not-a-root

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā dasa, anantare satta, samanantare satta,
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā dasa anantare satta samanantare satta
translated: With the condition not-a-root, there are nine in object, ten in predominance, seven in proximity, seven in singleness,

original: sahajāte nava, aññamaññe tīṇi, nissaye terasa, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi, pacchājāte
analyzed: sahajāte nava aññamaññe tīṇi nissaye terasa upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte
translated: nine in conascence, three in mutuality, thirteen in support, nine in dependence, three in prenascence,

original: tīṇi, āsevane tīṇi, kamme satta, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre satta, indriye satta, jhāne satta,
analyzed: tīṇi āsevane tīṇi kamme satta vipāke eka āhāre satta indriye satta jhāne satta
translated: three in postnascence, three in repetition, seven in kamma, one in result, seven in nutriment, seven in faculty, seven in jhāna,

original: magge satta, sampayutte tīṇi, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā terasa, natthiyā satta, vigate
analyzed: magge satta sampayutte tīṇi vippayutte pañca atthiyā terasa natthiyā satta vigate
translated: seven in path, three in association, five in dissociation, thirteen in presence, seven in absence,

original: satta, avigate terasa.
analyzed: satta avigate terasa
translated: seven in disappearance, thirteen in non-disappearance.

original: Tika
analyzed: tika
translated: The triad

original: Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā adhipatiyā satta, anantare satta, samanantare satta,
analyzed: na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā adhipatiyā satta anantare satta samanantare satta
translated: With the condition not-a-root, there are seven with the condition not-object, seven in predominance, seven in proximity, seven in singleness,

original: sahajāte nava, aññamaññe tīṇi, nissaye terasa, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi, pacchājāte
analyzed: sahajāte nava aññamaññe tīṇi nissaye terasa upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte
translated: with conascence nine, with mutuality three, with support thirteen, with object nine, with proximity three, with antecedents three,

original: tīṇi, āsevane tīṇi, kamme satta, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre satta, indriye satta, jhāne satta,
analyzed: tīṇi āsevane tīṇi kamme satta vipāke eka āhāre satta indriye satta jhāne satta
translated: with consequences three, with kamma seven, with ripening one, with nutriment seven, with faculty seven, with jhāna seven,

original: magge satta, sampayutte tīṇi, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā terasa, natthiyā satta, vigate
analyzed: magge satta sampayutte tīṇi vippayutte pañca atthiyā terasa natthiyā satta vigate
translated: with path seven, with association three, with dissociation five, with presence thirteen, with absence seven, with disappearance seven,

original: satta, avigate terasa.
analyzed: satta avigate terasa
translated: with non-disappearance thirteen.

original: Catukka
analyzed: catukka
translated: The Tetrads

original: Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatipaccayā anantare satta, samanantare satta,
analyzed: na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā na adhipati paccayā anantare satta samanantare satta
translated: With no condition of root-cause, with no condition of object, with no condition of predominance, with the immediately prior seven, with the proximity seven,

original: sahajāte nava, aññamaññe tīṇi, nissaye terasa, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi, pacchājāte
analyzed: sahajāte nava aññamaññe tīṇi nissaye terasa upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte
translated: with conascence nine, with mutuality three, with support thirteen, with object nine, with proximity three, with antecedents three, with consequences three,

original: tīṇi, āsevane tīṇi, kamme satta, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre satta, indriye satta, jhāne satta,🔽magge satta, sampayutte tīṇi, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā terasa, natthiyā satta, vigate
analyzed: tīṇi āsevane tīṇi kamme satta vipāke eka āhāre satta indriye satta jhāne satta  magge satta sampayutte tīṇi vippayutte pañca atthiyā terasa natthiyā satta vigate
translated: with kamma seven, with ripening one, with nutriment seven, with faculty seven, with jhāna seven,🔽with path seven, with association three, with dissociation five, with presence thirteen, with absence seven, with disappearance seven,

original: satta, avigate terasa …pe….
analyzed: satta avigate terasa pe
translated: with non-disappearance thirteen.

original: Chakka
analyzed: chakka
translated: The Sixes

original: Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatipaccayā naanantarapaccayā nasamanantarapaccayā
analyzed: na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā na adhipati paccayā na anantara paccayā na samanantara paccayā
translated: Not as root-cause condition, not as object condition, not as predominance condition, not as proximity condition, not as contiguity condition,

original: sahajāte nava, aññamaññe tīṇi, nissaye terasa, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi, pacchājāte
analyzed: sahajāte nava aññamaññe tīṇi nissaye terasa upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte
translated: in the born-with, there are nine; in the support, there are thirteen; in the decisive support, there are nine; in the prenascent, there are three; in the postnascent,

original: tīṇi, kamme satta, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre satta, indriye satta, jhāne satta, magge satta,
analyzed: tīṇi kamme satta vipāke eka āhāre satta indriye satta jhāne satta magge satta
translated: there are three; in kamma, there are seven; in the result, there is one; in nutriment, there are seven; in the faculties, there are seven; in jhāna, there are seven; in the path, there are seven;

original: sampayutte tīṇi, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā terasa, avigate terasa.
analyzed: sampayutte tīṇi vippayutte pañca atthiyā terasa avigate terasa
translated: in the associated, there are three; in the not-associated, there are five; in the causally-arisen, there are thirteen; in the uncaused, there are thirteen.

original: Sattaka
analyzed: sattaka
translated: Seven

original: Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatipaccayā naanantarapaccayā nasamanantarapaccayā
analyzed: na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā na adhipati paccayā na anantara paccayā na samanantara paccayā
translated: Not as root-cause condition, not as object condition, not as predominance condition, not as proximity condition, not as contiguity condition,

original: nasahajātapaccayā nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi, pacchājāte tīṇi,
analyzed: na sahajāta paccayā nissaye tīṇi upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte tīṇi
translated: not as postnascent condition, in the support, there are three; in the decisive support, there are nine; in the prenascent, there are three; in the postnascent, there are three;

original: kamme dve, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā satta, avigate satta.
analyzed: kamme dve āhāre eka indriye eka vippayutte pañca atthiyā satta avigate satta
translated: in kamma, there are two; in nutriment, there is one; in the faculties, there is one; in the not-associated, there are five; in the causally-arisen, there are seven; in the uncaused, there are seven.

original: Aṭṭhaka
analyzed: aṭṭhaka
translated: Eight

original: Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatipaccayā naanantarapaccayā nasamanantarapaccayā
analyzed: na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā na adhipati paccayā na anantara paccayā na samanantara paccayā
translated: Not as root-cause condition, not as object condition, not as predominance condition, not as proximity condition, not as contiguity condition,

original: nasahajātapaccayā naaññamaññapaccayā nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi,🔽pacchājāte tīṇi, kamme dve, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā satta, avigate satta.🔽Navaka🔽Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā …pe… naaññamaññapaccayā nanissayapaccayā upanissaye🔽nava, pacchājāte tīṇi, kamme dve, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, vippayutte tīṇi, atthiyā🔽pañca, avigate pañca …pe….🔽Ekādasaka

translated: The sixteen (with nutriment)

original: Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā (mūlakaṁ saṅkhittaṁ) napacchājātapaccayā naāsevanapaccayā
analyzed: na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā mūlakam saṅkhitta na pacchājāta paccayā na āsevana paccayā
translated: With no condition of root cause, no condition of object, (the basic section is abbreviated) … No condition of arising together, no condition of frequenting,

original: nakammapaccayā navipākapaccayā naāhārapaccayā indriye ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ …pe….
analyzed: na kamma paccayā na vipāka paccayā na āhāra paccayā indriye eka atthiyāḥ eka avigate ekam pe
translated: No condition of kamma, no condition of result, no condition of nutriment, there is one in relation to a faculty, one in relation to presence, one in relation to non-disappearance. …

original: Bāvīsaka (sāhāra)
analyzed: bāvīsaka sāhāra
translated: The twenty-two (with nutriment)

original: Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā (mūlakaṁ saṅkhittaṁ) naāhārapaccayā najhānapaccayā
analyzed: na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā mūlakam saṅkhitta na āhāra paccayā na jhāna paccayā
translated: With no condition of root cause, no condition of object, (the basic section is abbreviated) … No condition of nutriment, no condition of knowledge,

original: namaggapaccayā nasampayuttapaccayā navippayuttapaccayā nonatthipaccayā novigatapaccayā
analyzed: na magga paccayā na sampayutta paccayā na vippayutta paccayā no natthi paccayā no vigata paccayā
translated: No condition of path, no condition of association, no condition of dissociation, no condition of presence, no condition of disappearance,

original: indriye ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: indriye eka atthiyāḥ eka avigate eka
translated: There is one in relation to a faculty, one in relation to presence, one in relation to non-disappearance.

original: Soḷasaka (saindriya)
analyzed: soḍasaka sa aindriya
translated: The sixteen (with faculties)

original: Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā (mūlakaṁ saṅkhittaṁ) navipākapaccayā naindriyapaccayā āhāre ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ …pe….
analyzed: na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā mūlakam saṅkhitta na vipāka paccayā na indriya paccayā āhāre eka atthiyāḥ eka avigate ekam pe
translated: With no condition of root cause, no condition of object, (the basic section is abbreviated) … no condition of kamma result, no condition of faculty, in nutriment there is one, in presence there is one, in non-disappearance there is one …

original: Bāvīsaka (saindriya)🔽Nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā (mūlakaṁ saṅkhittaṁ) naindriyapaccayā najhānapaccayā
analyzed: bāvīsaka sa aindriya  na hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇa paccayāḥ mūlakam saṅkhitta na indriya paccayāḥ na jhāna paccayāḥ
translated: The twenty-two (with faculties)

original: namaggapaccayā nasampayuttapaccayā navippayuttapaccayā nonatthipaccayā novigatapaccayā
analyzed: na magga paccayā na sampayutta paccayā na vippayutta paccayā no natthi paccayā no vigata paccayā
translated: With no condition of root cause, no condition of object, (the basic section is abbreviated) … no condition of faculty, no condition of path, no condition of association, no condition of dissociation, no condition of presence, no condition of non-disappearance,

original: āhāre ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ.🔽Nahetumūlakaṁ.
analyzed: āhāre eka atthiyā eka avigate eka  na hetu mūlaka
translated: in nutriment there is one, in presence there is one, in non-disappearance there is one.🔽The section on root cause is finished.

original: Naārammaṇaduka
analyzed: na ārammaṇa duka
translated: The section on object

original: Naārammaṇapaccayā hetuyā satta, adhipatiyā satta, anantare satta, samanantare satta,
analyzed: na ārammaṇa paccayā hetuyā satta adhipatiyā satta anantare satta samanantare satta
translated: With a condition of object, there are seven as root cause, seven as predominance, seven as proximity, seven as contiguity,

original: sahajāte nava, aññamaññe tīṇi, nissaye terasa, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi, pacchājāte
analyzed: sahajāte nava aññamaññe tīṇi nissaye terasa upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte
translated: nine as arising together, three as mutuality, thirteen as support, nine as prenascence, three as postnascence,

original: tīṇi, āsevane tīṇi, kamme satta, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre satta, indriye satta, jhāne satta,
analyzed: tīṇi āsevane tīṇi kamme satta vipāke eka āhāre satta indriye satta jhāne satta
translated: three as repetition, seven as kamma, one as kamma result, seven as nutriment, seven as faculty, seven as jhāna,

original: magge satta, sampayutte tīṇi, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā terasa, natthiyā satta, vigate
analyzed: magge satta sampayutte tīṇi vippayutte pañca atthiyā terasa natthiyā satta vigate
translated: in the case of the path, there are seven, in the case of the associated, there are three, in the case of the dissociated, there are five, in the case of the particulars, there are thirteen, in the case of the non-existents, there are seven, in the case of the past, there are seven,

original: satta, avigate terasa …pe….
analyzed: satta avigate terasa pe
translated: in the path, there are seven; in the associated, three; in the not-yet-arisen, five; in the not-present, thirteen; in the absent, seven; in the opposite, seven; in the not-opposite, thirteen.

original: Aṭṭhaka
analyzed: aṭṭhaka
translated: The eight

original: Naārammaṇapaccayā nahetupaccayā naadhipatipaccayā naanantarapaccayā nasamanantarapaccayā
analyzed: na ārammaṇa paccayā na hetu paccayā na adhipati paccayā na anantara paccayā na samanantara paccayā
translated: From the condition not object, not condition root, not condition predominance, not condition proximity, not condition contiguity,

original: nasahajātapaccayā naaññamaññapaccayā nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi,🔽pacchājāte tīṇi, kamme dve, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā satta, avigate satta …pe….
analyzed: na sahajāta paccayā na aññamañña paccayā nissaye tīṇi upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi  pacchājāte tīṇi kamme dve āhāre eka indriye eka vippayutte pañca atthiyā satta avigate satta pe
translated: not condition decisive support, not condition prenascence, not condition postnascence, not condition arising together, not condition conascence, not condition mutuality, in the support, there are three; in the object, nine; in the prenascence, three;

original: Naārammaṇamūlakaṁ.
analyzed: na ārammaṇa mūlaka
translated: in the postnascence, three; in the action, two; in the nutriment, one; in the faculty, one; in the absence, five; in the presence, seven; in the past, seven; in the future, seven; in the present, seven; in the unconditioned, seven; in the internal, seven; in the external, seven; in the internal and external, seven; in the not-internal and not-external, seven; in the sense-sphere, seven; in the fine-material, seven; in the immaterial, seven; in the past, future and present, seven; in the sense-sphere, fine-material and immaterial, seven; in the past, future and present, and in the sense-sphere, fine-material and immaterial, seven; in the unformed, seven.🔽The not object root.

original: Naadhipatiduka
analyzed: na adhipati duka
translated: The not predominance dual

original: Naadhipatipaccayā hetuyā satta, ārammaṇe nava ….
analyzed: na adhipati paccayā hetuyā satta ārammaṇe nava
translated: From the condition not predominance, in the root, there are seven; in the object, nine.

original: Yathā nahetumūlakaṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.🔽Naadhipatimūlakaṁ.
analyzed: yathā na hetu mūlake evam  na adhipati mūlaka
translated: As in the not root, so it should be expanded.🔽The not predominance root.

original: Naanantara-nasamanantaraduka
analyzed: na anantara na samanantara duka
translated: The not proximity, not contiguity dual

original: Naanantarapaccayā …pe… nasamanantarapaccayā hetuyā satta, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā
analyzed: na anantara paccayā pe na samanantara paccayā hetuyā satta ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā
translated: From the condition not proximity, … not contiguity, in the root, there are seven; in the object, nine; in the predominance, nine; in the support, nine; in the disappearance, nine; in the establishment, nine; in the presence, nine; in the past, nine; in the future, nine; in the present, nine; in the unconditioned, nine; in the internal, nine; in the external, nine; in the internal and external, nine; in the not-internal and not-external, nine; in the sense-sphere, nine; in the fine-material, nine; in the immaterial, nine; in the past, future

original: dasa, sahajāte nava, aññamaññe tīṇi, nissaye terasa, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi,🔽pacchājāte tīṇi, kamme satta, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre satta, indriye satta, jhāne satta,
analyzed: dasa sahajāte nava aññamaññe tīṇi nissaye terasa upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi  pacchājāte tīṇi kamme satta vipāke eka āhāre satta indriye satta jhāne satta
translated: with three, with seven, with one, with seven, with seven,

original: magge satta, sampayutte tīṇi, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā terasa, avigate terasa …pe….
analyzed: magge satta sampayutte tīṇi vippayutte pañca atthiyā terasa avigate terasa pe
translated: with seven, with three, with five, with thirteen, with thirteen.

original: Aṭṭhaka
analyzed: aṭṭhaka
translated: The Eight

original: Nasamanantarapaccayā nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatipaccayā naanantarapaccayā
analyzed: na samanantara paccayāḥ na hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇa paccayāḥ na adhipati paccayāḥ na anantara paccayāḥ
translated: Without the condition being sequential, without the condition being root, without the condition being object, without the condition being predominance, without the condition being immediately before,

original: nasahajātapaccayā naaññamaññapaccayā nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi,
analyzed: na sahajāta paccayā na aññamañña paccayā nissaye tīṇi upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi
translated: without the condition being conascence, without the condition being mutuality, with three, with nine, with three,

original: pacchājāte tīṇi, kamme dve, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā satta,
analyzed: pacchājāte tīṇi kamme dve āhāre eka indriye eka vippayutte pañca atthiyā satta
translated: with three, with two, with one, with one, with five, with seven,

original: avigate satta. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nasamanantaramūlakaṁ.
analyzed: avigate satta saṅkhitta  na samanantara mūlaka
translated: with seven. (In brief.)🔽The section on without the condition being sequential.

original: Nasahajātaduka
analyzed: na sahajāta duka
translated: The Two on Without the Condition Being Conascence

original: Nasahajātapaccayā ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā satta, anantare satta, samanantare satta,
analyzed: na sahajāta paccayā ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā satta anantare satta samanantare satta
translated: With the condition being conascence, with object nine, with predominance seven, with proximity seven, with proximity and non-disappearance seven,

original: nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi, pacchājāte tīṇi, āsevane tīṇi, kamme🔽dve, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā satta, natthiyā satta, vigate
analyzed: nissaye tīṇi upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte tīṇi āsevane tīṇi kamme  dve āhāre eka indriye eka vippayutte pañca atthiyā satta natthiyā satta vigate
translated: in the root-cause condition, there are three; in the support condition, there are nine; in the prenascence condition, there are three; in the postnascence condition, there are three; in the repetition condition, there are three; in the kamma condition,🔽there are two; in the nutriment condition, there is one; in the faculty condition, there is one; in the absence condition, there are five; in the presence condition, there are seven; in the disappearance condition,🔽there are seven;

original: satta, avigate satta …pe….🔽Pañcaka🔽Nasahajātapaccayā nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatipaccayā anantare satta,
analyzed: satta avigate satta pe  pañcaka  na sahajāta paccayāḥ na hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇa paccayāḥ na adhipati paccayāḥ anantare satta
translated: in the condition by way of faculty there is one; in the condition by way of object there are three; in the condition by way of root there are three; in the condition by way of object and root there are three; in the condition by way of object and faculty there is one; in the condition by way of object, root and faculty there are three; in the non-disappearance of the object there are three; in the non-disappearance of the root there are three; in the non-disappearance of the object and root there are three; in the non-disappearance of the object and faculty there is one; in the non-disappearance of the object, root and faculty there are three.

original: samanantare satta, nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi, pacchājāte tīṇi,🔽āsevane tīṇi, kamme dve, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā satta,
analyzed: samanantare satta nissaye tīṇi upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte tīṇi  āsevane tīṇi kamme dve āhāre eka indriye eka vippayutte pañca atthiyā satta
translated: In the condition by way of object there are three; in the condition by way of root there are three; in the condition by way of object and root there are three; in the condition by way of object and faculty there is one; in the condition by way of object, root and faculty there are three; in the non-disappearance of the object there are three; in the non-disappearance of the root there are three; in the non-disappearance of the object and root there are three; in the non-disappearance of the object and faculty there is one; in the non-disappearance of the object, root and faculty there are three.

original: natthiyā satta, vigate satta, avigate satta …pe….🔽Navaka
analyzed: natthiyā satta vigate satta avigate satta pe  navaka
translated: In the condition by way of object there are three; in the condition by way of root there are three; in the condition by way of object and root there are three; in the condition by way of object and faculty there is one; in the condition by way of object, root and faculty there are three; in the non-disappearance of the object there are three; in the non-disappearance of the root there are three; in the non-disappearance of the object and root there are three; in the non-disappearance of the object and faculty there is one; in the non-disappearance of the object, root and faculty there are three.

original: Nasahajātapaccayā nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatipaccayā naanantarapaccayā🔽nasamanantarapaccayā naaññamaññapaccayā nanissayapaccayā upanissaye nava, pacchājāte
analyzed: na sahajāta paccayā na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā na adhipati paccayā na anantara paccayā 🔽na samanantara paccayāḥ na aññamañña paccayāḥ na nissaya paccayāḥ upanissaye nava pacchājāte
translated: In the condition by way of object there are three; in the condition by way of root there are three; in the condition by way of object and root there are three; in the condition by way of object and faculty there is one; in the condition by way of object, root and faculty there are three; in the non-disappearance of the object there are three; in the non-disappearance of the root there are three; in

original: tīṇi, kamme dve, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, vippayutte tīṇi, atthiyā pañca, avigate
analyzed: tīṇi kamme dve āhāre eka indriye eka vippayutte tīṇi atthiyā pañca avigate
translated: three, two, one, one, three, five, five. (Abbreviated.)

original: pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nasahajātamūlakaṁ.
analyzed: pañca saṅkhitta  na sahajāta mūlaka
translated: The section on not-co-nascence is finished.

original: Naaññamaññaduka
analyzed: na añña mañña duka
translated: Not-reciprocal

original: Naaññamaññapaccayā hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā aṭṭha, anantare satta,
analyzed: na aññamañña paccayā hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā aṭṭha anantare satta
translated: As to “not-reciprocal condition,” there are three kinds of roots, nine kinds of objects, eight kinds of predominance, seven kinds of proximity,

original: samanantare satta, sahajāte pañca, nissaye satta, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi,
analyzed: samanantare satta sahajāte pañca nissaye satta upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi
translated: seven kinds of contiguity, five kinds of conascence, seven kinds of support, nine kinds of decisive-support, three kinds of prenascence,

original: pacchājāte tīṇi, āsevane tīṇi, kamme tīṇi, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre tīṇi, indriye tīṇi,
analyzed: pacchājāte tīṇi āsevane tīṇi kamme tīṇi vipāke eka āhāre tīṇi indriye tīṇi
translated: three kinds of postnascence, three kinds of repetition, three kinds of kamma, one kind of result, three kinds of nutriment, three kinds of faculty,

original: jhāne tīṇi, magge tīṇi, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā satta, natthiyā satta, vigate satta, avigate satta …pe….
analyzed: jhāne tīṇi magge tīṇi vippayutte pañca atthiyā satta natthiyā satta vigate satta avigate satta pe
translated: three kinds of jhāna, three kinds of path, five kinds of dissociation, seven kinds of presence, seven kinds of absence, seven kinds of disappearance, seven kinds of non-disappearance.

original: Catukka🔽Naaññamaññapaccayā nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā adhipatiyā tīṇi, anantare satta,
analyzed: catukka  na aññamañña paccayā na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā adhipatiyā tīṇi anantare satta
translated: The fourfold section🔽As to “not-reciprocal condition,” there are three kinds of roots, seven kinds of proximity,

original: samanantare satta, sahajāte pañca, nissaye satta, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi,
analyzed: samanantare satta sahajāte pañca nissaye satta upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi
translated: seven kinds of contiguity, five kinds of conascence, seven kinds of support, nine kinds of decisive-support, three kinds of prenascence,

original: pacchājāte tīṇi, āsevane tīṇi, kamme tīṇi, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre tīṇi, indriye tīṇi,
analyzed: pacchājāte tīṇi āsevane tīṇi kamme tīṇi vipāke eka āhāre tīṇi indriye tīṇi
translated: With postnascent, there are three. With nutriment, there are three. With faculty, there are three.

original: jhāne tīṇi, magge tīṇi, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā satta, natthiyā satta, vigate satta, avigate satta …pe….
analyzed: jhāne tīṇi magge tīṇi vippayutte pañca atthiyā satta natthiyā satta vigate satta avigate satta pe
translated: With jhāna, there are three. With path, there are three. With the unassociated, there are five. With the existent, there are seven. With the non-existent, there are seven. With the past, there are seven. With the future, there are seven. With the present, there are seven. With the past and future, there are seven. With the past and present, there are seven. With the future and present, there are seven. With the past, future, and present, there are seven.

original: Aṭṭhaka🔽Naaññamaññapaccayā nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatipaccayā naanantarapaccayā🔽nasamanantarapaccayā nasahajātapaccayā nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi,🔽pacchājāte tīṇi, kamme dve, āhāre ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā satta,🔽avigate satta. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: aṭṭhaka  na aññamañña paccayā na hetu paccayā na ārammaṇa paccayā na adhipati paccayā na anantara paccayā  na samanantara paccayā na sahajāta paccayā nissaye tīṇi upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi  pacchājāte tīṇi kamme dve āhāre eka indriye eka vippayutte pañca atthiyā satta  avigate satta saṅkhitta
translated: The Eight

original: Naaññamaññamūlakaṁ.🔽Nanissayaduka🔽Nanissayapaccayā ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā satta, anantare satta, samanantare satta,🔽upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi, pacchājāte tīṇi, āsevane tīṇi, kamme dve, āhāre ekaṁ,
analyzed: na añña mañña mūlaka 🔽na nissaya duka 🔽na nissaya paccayā ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā satta anantare satta samanantare satta 🔽upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte tīṇi āsevane tīṇi kamme dve āhāre eka
translated: With neither-as-condition nor root-cause nor object nor predominance nor proximity nor Arousal nor presence nor disappearance nor disappearance- reappearance nor arising nor falling away nor alteration nor conditionality nor decisive-support nor support nor absorption nor association nor dissociation nor presence nor absence nor past nor future nor present nor non-arising nor arising nor already-arisen nor non-culmination nor culmination nor non-disappearance nor disappearance nor past-sign nor future-sign nor present-sign nor past-purity nor future-purity nor present-purity nor past-non-purity nor future-non-purity nor present-non-purity nor past-non-arising nor future-non-arising nor present-non-arising nor past-arising nor future-arising nor present-arising nor past-non-ceasing nor future-non-ceasing nor present-non-ceasing nor past-non-arrestedness nor future-non-arrestedness nor present-non-arrestedness nor past-arrestedness nor future-arrestedness nor present-arrestedness nor past-non-disappearance nor future-non-disappearance nor present-non-disappearance nor past-disappearance nor future-disappearance nor present-disappearance nor past-non-arising nor future-non-arising nor present-non-arising nor past-arising nor future-arising nor present-arising nor past-non-arising nor future-non-arising nor present-non-arising nor past-arising nor future-arising nor present-arising nor past-non-arising nor future-non-arising nor present-non-arising nor past-arising nor future-arising

original: indriye ekaṁ, vippayutte tīṇi, atthiyā satta, natthiyā satta, vigate satta, avigate satta …pe….
analyzed: indriye eka vippayutte tīṇi atthiyā satta natthiyā satta vigate satta avigate satta pe
translated: in the faculties one, in the unities three, in the presences seven, in the absences seven, in the passings away seven, in the non-passings away seven.

original: Pañcaka
analyzed: pañcaka
translated: The pentad

original: Nanissayapaccayā nahetupaccayā naārammaṇapaccayā naadhipatipaccayā anantare satta,
analyzed: na nissaya paccayāḥ na hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇa paccayāḥ na adhipati paccayāḥ anantare satta
translated: In the condition being a support but not a decisive-support condition, not an object condition, not a predominance condition, in the immediately preceding seven,

translated: With the condition being a non-nutritive-essence condition and a non-root condition and a non-object condition, there are seven by way of predominance. There are seven by way of proximity.

original: Navippayuttapaccayā nahetupaccayā …pe… nakammapaccayā navipākapaccayā naāhārapaccayā indriye ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ, avigate ekaṁ …pe….

original: nonatthipaccayā novigatapaccayā noavigatapaccayā upanissaye nava.
analyzed: nonatthi paccayā novigata paccayā noavigata paccayā upanissaye nava
translated: With “not as presence” as the root-cause, there are nine.

original: Noatthimūlakaṁ.🔽Nonatthiduka
analyzed: noatthimūlaka  naḥ na tthi duka
translated: The “not as presence” dyad.

original: Nonatthipaccayā hetuyā satta …pe… avigate terasa.
analyzed: nonatthi paccayāḥ hetuyā satta pe avigate terasa
translated: With “not as presence” as condition, there are seven … in the “disappearance” triad, thirteen.

original: Yathā nahetumūlakaṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.
analyzed: yathā na hetu mūlake evam
translated: As with the “not as root-cause” triad, it should be expanded.🔽With “not as presence” as the root-cause, there are nine.

original: Nonatthimūlakaṁ.🔽Novigataduka
analyzed: nonatthimūlaka  na u vigata duka
translated: The “not as disappearance” dyad.

original: Novigatapaccayā hetuyā satta …pe… avigate terasa.
analyzed: no vigata paccayāḥ hetuyā satta pe avigate terasa
translated: With “not as disappearance” as condition, there are seven … in the “disappearance” triad, thirteen.

original: Yathā nahetumūlakaṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.
analyzed: yathā na hetu mūlake evam
translated: As with the “not as root-cause” triad, it should be expanded.🔽With “not as disappearance” as the root-cause, there are nine.

original: Novigatamūlakaṁ.🔽Noavigataduka
analyzed: na u vigata mūlaka  na u a vigata duka
translated: The “not as non-disappearance” dyad.

original: Noavigatapaccayā ārammaṇe nava …pe… natthiyā satta, vigate satta.
analyzed: no avigata paccayā ārammaṇe nava pe natthiyā satta vigate satta
translated: With “not as non-disappearance” as condition, there are nine … in the “disappearance” triad, seven.

original: Yathā noatthimūlakaṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.
analyzed: yathā evam
translated: As with the “not as presence” triad, it should be expanded.🔽With “not as non-disappearance” as the root-cause, there are nine.

original: Noavigatamūlakaṁ.
analyzed: na u avigata mūlaka
translated: The “not as non-disappearance” dyad.

original: Pañhāvārassa paccanīyānulomaṁ.
analyzed: pañhāvārassa paccanīya anuloma
translated: The “Questions” section is concluded.

original: Kusalattikaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: kusala ttikam niṭṭhita
translated: The “wholesome” triad is finished.
